verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां ह्य॑ग्ने॒ सद॒मित्स॑म॒न्यवो॑ दे॒वासो॑ दे॒वम॑र॒तिं न्ये॑रि॒र इति॒ क्रत्वा॑ न्येरि॒रे अम॑र्त्यं यजत॒ मर्त्ये॒ष्वा दे॒वमादे॑वं जनत॒ प्रचे॑तसं॒ विश्व॒मादे॑वं जनत॒ प्रचे॑तसम्
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ hy àgne sádam ít samanyávo  devā́so devám aratíṃ nyeriré-  íti krátvā nyeriré  ámartyaṃ yajata mártyeṣv~ā́  devám ā́devaṃ janata prácetasaṃ  víśvam ā́devaṃ janata prácetasam

translation.text: , THEE Agni, have the Gods, ever of one accord, sent hither down, a God, appointed messenger, yea, with their wisdom sent thee down. The Immortal, O thou Holy One, mid mortal men, the God-devoted God, the wise, have they brought forth, brought forth the omnipresent God-devoted Sage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स भ्रात॑रं॒ वरु॑णमग्न॒ आ व॑वृत्स्व दे॒वाँ अच्छा॑ सुम॒ती य॒ज्ञव॑नसं॒ ज्येष्ठं॑ य॒ज्ञव॑नसम् ऋ॒तावा॑नमादि॒त्यं च॑र्षणी॒धृतं॒ राजा॑नं चर्षणी॒धृत॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá bhrā́taraṃ váruṇam agna ā́ vavr̥tsva  devā́m̐ áchā sumatī́ yajñávanasaṃ  jyéṣṭhaṃ yajñávanasam  r̥tā́vānam ādityáṃ carṣaṇīdhŕ̥taṃ  rā́jānaṃ carṣaṇīdhŕ̥tam

translation.text: As such, O Agni, bring with favour to the Gods thy Brother Varuṇa who loveth sacrifice, True to the Law, the Âditya who supporteth men, the King, supporter of mankind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सखे॒ सखा॑यम॒भ्या व॑वृत्स्वा॒शुं न च॒क्रं रथ्ये॑व॒ रंह्या॒स्मभ्यं॑ दस्म॒ रंह्या॑ अग्ने॑ मृळी॒कं वरु॑णे॒ सचा॑ विदो म॒रुत्सु॑ वि॒श्वभा॑नुषु तो॒काय॑ तु॒जे शु॑शुचान॒ शं कृ॑ध्य॒स्मभ्यं॑ दस्म॒ शं कृ॑धि
verses.transliteration: sákhe sákhāyam abhy ā́ vavr̥tsva-  -āśúṃ ná cakráṃ ráthyeva ráṃhyā-  -asmábhyaṃ dasma ráṃhyā  ágne mr̥ḷīkáṃ váruṇe sácā vido  marútsu viśvábhānuṣu  tokā́ya tujé śuśucāna śáṃ kr̥dhi-  asmábhyaṃ dasma śáṃ kr̥dhi

translation.text: Do thou, O Friend, turn hither him who is our Friend, swift as a wheel, like two car-steeds in rapid course, Wondrous! to us in rapid course. O Agni, find thou grace for us with Varuṇa, with Maruts who illumine all. Bless us, thou Radiant One, for seed and progeny, yea, bless us, O thou Wondrous God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ अग्ने॒ वरु॑णस्य वि॒द्वान्दे॒वस्य॒ हेळोऽव॑ यासिसीष्ठाः यजि॑ष्ठो॒ वह्नि॑तमः॒ शोशु॑चानो॒ विश्वा॒ द्वेषां॑सि॒ प्र मु॑मुग्ध्य॒स्मत्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no agne váruṇasya vidvā́n  devásya héḷó 'va yāsisīṣṭhāḥ  yájiṣṭho váhnitamaḥ śóśucāno  víśvā dvéṣāṃsi prá mumugdhy asmát

translation.text: Do thou who knowest Varuṇa, O Agni, put far away from us the God's displeasure. Best Sacrificer, brightest One, refulgent remove thou far from us all those who hate us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स त्वं नो॑ अग्नेऽव॒मो भ॑वो॒ती नेदि॑ष्ठो अ॒स्या उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ अव॑ यक्ष्व नो॒ वरु॑णं॒ ररा॑णो वी॒हि मृ॑ळी॒कं सु॒हवो॑ न एधि
verses.transliteration: sá tváṃ no agne 'vamó bhavotī́  nédiṣṭho asyā́ uṣáso vyùṣṭau  áva yakṣva no váruṇaṃ rárāṇo  vīhí mr̥ḷīkáṃ suhávo na edhi

translation.text: Be thou, O Agni, nearest us with succour, our closest Friend while now this Morn is breaking. Reconcile to us Varuṇa, be bounteous enjoy the gracious juice; be swift to hear us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य श्रेष्ठा॑ सु॒भग॑स्य सं॒दृग्दे॒वस्य॑ चि॒त्रत॑मा॒ मर्त्ये॑षु शुचि॑ घृ॒तं न त॒प्तमघ्न्या॑याः स्पा॒र्हा दे॒वस्य॑ मं॒हने॑व धे॒नोः
verses.transliteration: asyá śréṣṭhā subhágasya saṃdŕ̥g  devásya citrátamā mártyeṣu  śúci ghr̥táṃ ná taptám ághnyāyāḥ-  spārhā́ devásya maṃháneva dhenóḥ

translation.text: Excellent is the glance, of brightest splendour, which the auspicious God bestows on mortals- The God's glance, longed-for even as the butter, pure, heated, of the cow, the milch-cow's bounty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिर॑स्य॒ ता प॑र॒मा स॑न्ति स॒त्या स्पा॒र्हा दे॒वस्य॒ जनि॑मान्य॒ग्नेः अ॒न॒न्ते अ॒न्तः परि॑वीत॒ आगा॒च्छुचिः॑ शु॒क्रो अ॒र्यो रोरु॑चानः
verses.transliteration: trír asya tā́ paramā́ santi satyā́  spārhā́ devásya jánimāny agnéḥ  ananté antáḥ párivīta ā́gāt-  -śúciḥ śukró aryó rórucānaḥ

translation.text: Three are those births, the true, the most exalted, eagerly longed-for, of the God, of Agni. He came invested in the boundless region, pure, radiant, friendly, mightily resplendent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स दू॒तो विश्वेद॒भि व॑ष्टि॒ सद्मा॒ होता॒ हिर॑ण्यरथो॒ रंसु॑जिह्वः रो॒हिद॑श्वो वपु॒ष्यो॑ वि॒भावा॒ सदा॑ र॒ण्वः पि॑तु॒मती॑व सं॒सत्
verses.transliteration: sá dūtó víśvéd abhí vaṣṭi sádmā  hótā híraṇyaratho ráṃsujihvaḥ  rohídaśvo vapuṣyò vibhā́vā  sádā raṇváḥ pitumátīva saṃsát

translation.text: This envoy joyeth in all seats of worship, borne on his golden car, sweet-tongued Invoker: Lovely to look on, with red steeds, effulgent, like a feast rich in food, joyous for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स चे॑तय॒न्मनु॑षो य॒ज्ञब॑न्धुः॒ प्र तं म॒ह्या र॑श॒नया॑ नयन्ति स क्षे॑त्यस्य॒ दुर्या॑सु॒ साध॑न्दे॒वो मर्त॑स्य सधनि॒त्वमा॑प
verses.transliteration: sá cetayan mánuṣo yajñábandhuḥ  prá tám mahyā́ raśanáyā nayanti  sá kṣety asya dúryāsu sā́dhan  devó mártasya sadhanitvám āpa

translation.text: Allied by worship, let him give man knowledge: by an extended cord they lead him onward. He stays, effectual in this mortal's dwelling, and the God wins a share in his possessions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स तू नो॑ अ॒ग्निर्न॑यतु प्रजा॒नन्नच्छा॒ रत्नं॑ दे॒वभ॑क्तं॒ यद॑स्य धि॒या यद्विश्वे॑ अ॒मृता॒ अकृ॑ण्व॒न्द्यौष्पि॒ता ज॑नि॒ता स॒त्यमु॑क्षन्
verses.transliteration: sá tū́ no agnír nayatu prajānánn  áchā rátnaṃ devábhaktaṃ yád asya  dhiyā́ yád víśve amŕ̥tā ákr̥ṇvan  dyaúṣ pitā́ janitā́ satyám ukṣan

translation.text: Let Agni -for he knows the way- conduct us to all that he enjoys of God-sent riches, What all the Immortals have prepared with wisdom, Dyaus, Sire, Begetter, raining down true blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स जा॑यत प्रथ॒मः प॒स्त्या॑सु म॒हो बु॒ध्ने रज॑सो अ॒स्य योनौ॑ अ॒पाद॑शी॒र्षा गु॒हमा॑नो॒ अन्ता॒योयु॑वानो वृष॒भस्य॑ नी॒ळे
verses.transliteration: sá jāyata prathamáḥ pastyā̀su  mahó budhné rájaso asyá yónau  apā́d aśīrṣā́ guhámāno ántā-  -āyóyuvāno vr̥ṣabhásya nīḷé

translation.text: In houses first he sprang into existence, at great heaven's base, and in this region's bosom; Footless and headless, both his ends concealing, in his Bull's lair drawing himself together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र शर्ध॑ आर्त प्रथ॒मं वि॑प॒न्याँ ऋ॒तस्य॒ योना॑ वृष॒भस्य॑ नी॒ळे स्पा॒र्हो युवा॑ वपु॒ष्यो॑ वि॒भावा॑ स॒प्त प्रि॒यासो॑ऽजनयन्त॒ वृष्णे॑
verses.transliteration: prá śárdha ārta prathamáṃ vipanyā́m̐  r̥tásya yónā vr̥ṣabhásya nīḷé  spārhó yúvā vapuṣyò vibhā́vā  saptá priyā́so (')janayanta vŕ̥ṣṇe

translation.text: Wondrously first he rose aloft, defiant, in the Bull's lair, the homeof holy Order, Longed-for, young, beautiful, and far-resplendent: and sevendear frieuds sprang up unto the Mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माक॒मत्र॑ पि॒तरो॑ मनु॒ष्या॑ अ॒भि प्र से॑दुर्ऋ॒तमा॑शुषा॒णाः अश्म॑व्रजाः सु॒दुघा॑ व॒व्रे अ॒न्तरुदु॒स्रा आ॑जन्नु॒षसो॑ हुवा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: asmā́kam átra pitáro manuṣyā̀ḥ-  abhí prá sedur r̥tám āśuṣāṇā́ḥ  áśmavrajāḥ sudúghā vavré antár  úd usrā́ ājann uṣáso huvānā́ḥ

translation.text: Here did our human fathers take their places, fain to fulfil the sacred Law of worship. Forth drave they, with loud call, Dawn's teeming Milch-kine bid in the mountainstable, in the cavern.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते म॑र्मृजत ददृ॒वांसो॒ अद्रिं॒ तदे॑षाम॒न्ये अ॒भितो॒ वि वो॑चन् प॒श्वय॑न्त्रासो अ॒भि का॒रम॑र्चन्वि॒दन्त॒ ज्योति॑श्चकृ॒पन्त॑ धी॒भिः
verses.transliteration: té marmr̥jata dadr̥vā́ṃso ádriṃ  tád eṣām anyé abhíto ví vocan  paśváyantrāso abhí kārám arcan  vidánta jyótiś cakr̥pánta dhībhíḥ

translation.text: Splendid were they when they had rent the mountain: others, around, shall tell forth this their exploit. They sang their song, prepared to free the cattle: they found the light; with holy hymns they worshipped.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते ग॑व्य॒ता मन॑सा दृ॒ध्रमु॒ब्धं गा ये॑मा॒नं परि॒ षन्त॒मद्रि॑म् दृ॒ळ्हं नरो॒ वच॑सा॒ दैव्ये॑न व्र॒जं गोम॑न्तमु॒शिजो॒ वि व॑व्रुः
verses.transliteration: té gavyatā́ mánasā dr̥dhrám ubdháṃ  gā́ yemānám pári ṣántam ádrim  dr̥ḷháṃ náro vácasā daívyena  vrajáṃ gómantam uśíjo ví vavruḥ

translation.text: Eager, with thought intent upon the booty, the men with their celestial speech threw open, The solid mountain firm, compact, enclosing, confining Cows, the stable full of cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते म॑न्वत प्रथ॒मं नाम॑ धे॒नोस्त्रिः स॒प्त मा॒तुः प॑र॒माणि॑ विन्दन् तज्जा॑न॒तीर॒भ्य॑नूषत॒ व्रा आ॒विर्भु॑वदरु॒णीर्य॒शसा॒ गोः
verses.transliteration: té manvata prathamáṃ nā́ma dhenós  tríḥ saptá mātúḥ paramā́ṇi vindan  táj jānatī́r abhy ànūṣata vrā́ḥ-  āvír bhuvad aruṇī́r yaśásā góḥ

translation.text: The Milch-cow's earliest name they comprehended: they found the Mother's thrice-seven noblest titles. This the bands knew, and sent forth acclamation:with the Bull's sheen the Red One was apparent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नेश॒त्तमो॒ दुधि॑तं॒ रोच॑त॒ द्यौरुद्दे॒व्या उ॒षसो॑ भा॒नुर॑र्त आ सूर्यो॑ बृह॒तस्ति॑ष्ठ॒दज्राँ॑ ऋ॒जु मर्ते॑षु वृजि॒ना च॒ पश्य॑न्
verses.transliteration: néśat támo dúdhitaṃ rócata dyaúr  úd devyā́ uṣáso bhānúr arta  ā́ sū́ryo br̥hatás tiṣṭhad ájrām̐  r̥jú márteṣu vr̥jinā́ ca páśyan

translation.text: The turbid darkness fled, the heaven was sp, endid! up rose the bright beam of celestial Morning. Sûrya ascended to the wide expanses, beholding deeds of men both good and evil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आदित्प॒श्चा बु॑बुधा॒ना व्य॑ख्य॒न्नादिद्रत्नं॑ धारयन्त॒ द्युभ॑क्तम् विश्वे॒ विश्वा॑सु॒ दुर्या॑सु दे॒वा मित्र॑ धि॒ये व॑रुण स॒त्यम॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: ā́d ít paścā́ bubudhānā́ vy àkhyann  ā́d íd rátnaṃ dhārayanta dyúbhaktam  víśve víśvāsu dúryāsu devā́ḥ-  mítra dhiyé varuṇa satyám astu

translation.text: Then, afterwards they looked around, awakened, when first they held that Heaven allotted treasure. Now all the Gods abide in all their dwellings. Varuṇa, Mitra, be the prayer effective.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॑ वोचेय शुशुचा॒नम॒ग्निं होता॑रं वि॒श्वभ॑रसं॒ यजि॑ष्ठम् शुच्यूधो॑ अतृण॒न्न गवा॒मन्धो॒ न पू॒तं परि॑षिक्तमं॒शोः
verses.transliteration: áchā voceya śuśucānám agníṃ  hótāraṃ viśvábharasaṃ yájiṣṭham  śúcy ū́dho atr̥ṇan ná gávām  ándho ná pūtám páriṣiktam aṃśóḥ

translation.text: I will call hither brightly-beaming Agni, the Herald, all-supporting, best at worship. He hath disclosed, like the milch cows' pure udder, the Sorria's juice when cleansed and poured from beakers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑षा॒मदि॑तिर्य॒ज्ञिया॑नां॒ विश्वे॑षा॒मति॑थि॒र्मानु॑षाणाम् अ॒ग्निर्दे॒वाना॒मव॑ आवृणा॒नः सु॑मृळी॒को भ॑वतु जा॒तवे॑दाः
verses.transliteration: víśveṣām áditir yajñíyānāṃ  víśveṣām átithir mā́nuṣāṇām  agnír devā́nām áva āvr̥ṇānáḥ  sumr̥ḷīkó bhavatu jātávedāḥ

translation.text: The freest God of all who should be worshipped, the guest who is received in all men's houses, Agni who hath secured the Gods' high favour,– may he be gracious, to us Jâtavedas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो मर्त्ये॑ष्व॒मृत॑ ऋ॒तावा॑ दे॒वो दे॒वेष्व॑र॒तिर्नि॒धायि॑ होता॒ यजि॑ष्ठो म॒ह्ना शु॒चध्यै॑ ह॒व्यैर॒ग्निर्मनु॑ष ईर॒यध्यै॑
verses.transliteration: yó mártyeṣv amŕ̥ta r̥tā́vā  devó devéṣv aratír nidhā́yi  hótā yájiṣṭho mahnā́ śucádhyai  havyaír agnír mánuṣa īrayádhyai

translation.text: THE, Faithful One, Immortal among mortals, a God among the Gods, appointed envoy, Priest, best at worship, must shine forth in glory . Agni shall be raised high with man's oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ह त्वं सू॑नो सहसो नो अ॒द्य जा॒तो जा॒ताँ उ॒भयाँ॑ अ॒न्तर॑ग्ने दू॒त ई॑यसे युयुजा॒न ऋ॑ष्व ऋजुमु॒ष्कान्वृष॑णः शु॒क्राँश्च॑
verses.transliteration: ihá tváṃ sūno sahaso no adyá  jātó jātā́m̐ ubháyām̐ antár agne  dūtá īyase yuyujāná r̥ṣva  r̥jumuṣkā́n vŕ̥ṣaṇaḥ śukrā́ṃś ca

translation.text: Born for us here this day, O Son of Vigour, between both races of born beings, Agni, Thou farest as an envoy, having harnessed, Sublime One! thy strong-muscled radiant stallions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्या॑ वृध॒स्नू रोहि॑ता घृ॒तस्नू॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ मन्ये॒ मन॑सा॒ जवि॑ष्ठा अ॒न्तरी॑यसे अरु॒षा यु॑जा॒नो यु॒ष्माँश्च॑ दे॒वान्विश॒ आ च॒ मर्ता॑न्
verses.transliteration: átyā vr̥dhasnū́ róhitā ghr̥tásnū  r̥tásya manye mánasā jáviṣṭhā  antár īyase aruṣā́ yujānó  yuṣmā́ṃś ca devā́n víśa ā́ ca mártān

translation.text: I laud the ruddy steeds who pour down blessing, dropping oil, flectest through the thoualit of Order. Yoking red horses to and fro thou goest between you Deities and mortal races.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्य॒मणं॒ वरु॑णं मि॒त्रमे॑षा॒मिन्द्रा॒विष्णू॑ म॒रुतो॑ अ॒श्विनो॒त स्वश्वो॑ अग्ने सु॒रथः॑ सु॒राधा॒ एदु॑ वह सुह॒विषे॒ जना॑य
verses.transliteration: aryamáṇaṃ váruṇam mitrám eṣām  índrāvíṣṇū marúto aśvínotá  sváśvo agne suráthaḥ surā́dhāḥ-  éd u vaha suhavíṣe jánāya

translation.text: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa, and Indra with Vishṇu, of the Gods, Maruts and Aṣvins- These, Agni, with good car and steeds, bring hither, most bountiful, to folk with fair oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोमाँ॑ अ॒ग्नेऽवि॑माँ अ॒श्वी य॒ज्ञो नृ॒वत्स॑खा॒ सद॒मिद॑प्रमृ॒ष्यः इळा॑वाँ ए॒षो अ॑सुर प्र॒जावा॑न्दी॒र्घो र॒यिः पृ॑थुबु॒ध्नः स॒भावा॑न्
verses.transliteration: gómām̐ agné 'vimām̐ aśvī́ yajñó  nr̥vátsakhā sádam íd apramr̥ṣyáḥ  íḷāvām̐ eṣó asura prajā́vān  dīrghó rayíḥ pr̥thubudhnáḥ sabhā́vān

translation.text: Agni, be this our sacrifice eternal, with brave friends, rich in kine and sheep and horses, Rich, Asura! in sacred food and children, in full assembly, wealth broad-based and during.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त॑ इ॒ध्मं ज॒भर॑त्सिष्विदा॒नो मू॒र्धानं॑ वा त॒तप॑ते त्वा॒या भुव॒स्तस्य॒ स्वत॑वाँः पा॒युर॑ग्ने॒ विश्व॑स्मात्सीमघाय॒त उ॑रुष्य
verses.transliteration: yás ta idhmáṃ jabhárat siṣvidānó  mūrdhā́naṃ vā tatápate tvāyā́  bhúvas tásya svátavām̐ḥ pāyúr agne  víśvasmāt sīm aghāyatá uruṣya

translation.text: The man who, sweating, brings for thee the fuel, and makes his head to ache, thy faithful servant,– Agni, to him be a self-strong Protector guard him from all who seek to do him mischief.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॒ भरा॒दन्नि॑यते चि॒दन्नं॑ नि॒शिष॑न्म॒न्द्रमति॑थिमु॒दीर॑त् आ दे॑व॒युरि॒नध॑ते दुरो॒णे तस्मि॑न्र॒यिर्ध्रु॒वो अ॑स्तु॒ दास्वा॑न्
verses.transliteration: yás te bhárād ánniyate cid ánnaṃ  niśíṣan mandrám átithim udī́rat  ā́ devayúr inádhate duroṇé  tásmin rayír dhruvó astu dā́svān

translation.text: Who brings thee food, though thou hast food in plenty, welcomes his cheerful guest and speeds him onward, Who kindles thee devoutly in his dwelling,to him be wealth secure and freely giving.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त्वा॑ दो॒षा य उ॒षसि॑ प्र॒शंसा॑त्प्रि॒यं वा॑ त्वा कृ॒णव॑ते ह॒विष्मा॑न् अश्वो॒ न स्वे दम॒ आ हे॒म्यावा॒न्तमंह॑सः पीपरो दा॒श्वांस॑म्
verses.transliteration: yás tvā doṣā́ yá uṣási praśáṃsāt  priyáṃ vā tvā kr̥ṇávate havíṣmān  áśvo ná své dáma ā́ hemyā́vān  tám áṃhasaḥ pīparo dāśvā́ṃsam

translation.text: Whoso sings praise to thee at eve or morning, and, with oblation, doth the thing thou lovest,– In his own home, even as a goId-girt courser, rescue him from distress, the bounteous giver.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्तुभ्य॑मग्ने अ॒मृता॑य॒ दाश॒द्दुव॒स्त्वे कृ॒णव॑ते य॒तस्रु॑क् न स रा॒या श॑शमा॒नो वि यो॑ष॒न्नैन॒मंहः॒ परि॑ वरदघा॒योः
verses.transliteration: yás túbhyam agne amŕ̥tāya dā́śad  dúvas tvé kr̥ṇávate yatásruk  ná sá rāyā́ śaśamānó ví yoṣat-  naínam áṃhaḥ pári varad aghāyóḥ

translation.text: Whoso brings gifts to thee Immortal, Agni, and doth thee service with uplifted ladle,– Let him not, sorely toiling, lose his riches; let not the sinner's wickedness enclose him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ त्वम॑ग्ने अध्व॒रं जुजो॑षो दे॒वो मर्त॑स्य॒ सुधि॑तं॒ ररा॑णः प्री॒तेद॑स॒द्धोत्रा॒ सा य॑वि॒ष्ठासा॑म॒ यस्य॑ विध॒तो वृ॒धासः॑
verses.transliteration: yásya tvám agne adhvaráṃ jújoṣo  devó mártasya súdhitaṃ rárāṇaḥ  prītéd asad dhótrā sā́ yaviṣṭha-  -ásāma yásya vidható vr̥dhā́saḥ

translation.text: Whose well-wrought worship thou acceptest, Agni, thou God a mortal's gift, thou liberal Giver,– Dear be his sacrifice to thee, Most Youthful! and may we strengthen him when he adores thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चित्ति॒मचि॑त्तिं चिनव॒द्वि वि॒द्वान्पृ॒ष्ठेव॑ वी॒ता वृ॑जि॒ना च॒ मर्ता॑न् रा॒ये च॑ नः स्वप॒त्याय॑ देव॒ दितिं॑ च॒ रास्वादि॑तिमुरुष्य
verses.transliteration: cíttim ácittiṃ cinavad ví vidvā́n  pr̥ṣṭhéva vītā́ vr̥jinā́ ca mártān  rāyé ca naḥ svapatyā́ya deva  dítiṃ ca rā́svā́ditim uruṣya

translation.text: May he who knows distinguish sense and folly of men, like straight and crooked backs of horses. Lead us, O God, to wealth and noble offspring: keep penury afar and grant us plenty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒विं श॑शासुः क॒वयोऽद॑ब्धा निधा॒रय॑न्तो॒ दुर्या॑स्वा॒योः अत॒स्त्वं दृश्याँ॑ अग्न ए॒तान्प॒ड्भिः प॑श्ये॒रद्भु॑ताँ अ॒र्य एवैः॑
verses.transliteration: kavíṃ śaśāsuḥ kaváyó 'dabdhāḥ-  nidhāráyanto dúryāsv āyóḥ  átas tváṃ dŕ̥śyām̐ agna etā́n  paḍbhíḥ paśyer ádbhutām̐ aryá évaiḥ

translation.text: This Sage the Sages, ne'er deceived, commanded, setting him down in dwellings of the living. Hence mayst thou, friendly God, with rapid footsteps behold the Gods, wonderful, fair to look on.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने वा॒घते॑ सु॒प्रणी॑तिः सु॒तसो॑माय विध॒ते य॑विष्ठ रत्नं॑ भर शशमा॒नाय॑ घृष्वे पृ॒थु श्च॒न्द्रमव॑से चर्षणि॒प्राः
verses.transliteration: tvám agne vāgháte supráṇītiḥ  sutásomāya vidhaté yaviṣṭha  rátnam bhara śaśamānā́ya ghr̥ṣve  pr̥thú ścandrám ávase carṣaṇiprā́ḥ

translation.text: Good guidance hast thou for the priest, O Agni, who, Youngest God! with outpoured Soma serves thee. Ruler of men, thou joyous God, bring treasure splendid and plentiful to aid the toiler.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑ ह॒ यद्व॒यम॑ग्ने त्वा॒या प॒ड्भिर्हस्ते॑भिश्चकृ॒मा त॒नूभिः॑ रथं॒ न क्रन्तो॒ अप॑सा भु॒रिजो॑र्ऋ॒तं ये॑मुः सु॒ध्य॑ आशुषा॒णाः
verses.transliteration: ádhā ha yád vayám agne tvāyā́  paḍbhír hástebhiś cakr̥mā́ tanū́bhiḥ  ráthaṃ ná kránto ápasā bhuríjor  r̥táṃ yemuḥ sudhyà āśuṣāṇā́ḥ

translation.text: Now all that we, thy faithful servants, Agni, have done with feet, with hands, and with our bodies, The wise, with toil, the holy rite have guided, as those who frame a car with manual cunning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑ मा॒तुरु॒षसः॑ स॒प्त विप्रा॒ जाये॑महि प्रथ॒मा वे॒धसो॒ नॄन् दि॒वस्पु॒त्रा अङ्गि॑रसो भवे॒माद्रिं॑ रुजेम ध॒निनं॑ शु॒चन्तः॑
verses.transliteration: ádhā mātúr uṣásaḥ saptá víprāḥ-  jā́yemahi prathamā́ vedháso nr̥̄́n  divás putrā́ áṅgiraso bhavema-  -ádriṃ rujema dhanínaṃ śucántaḥ

translation.text: May we, seven sages first in rank, engender, from Dawn the Mother, men to be ordainers. May we, Angirases, be sons of Heaven, and, radiant, burst the wealth-containing mountain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॒ यथा॑ नः पि॒तरः॒ परा॑सः प्र॒त्नासो॑ अग्न ऋ॒तमा॑शुषा॒णाः शुचीद॑य॒न्दीधि॑तिमुक्थ॒शासः॒ क्षामा॑ भि॒न्दन्तो॑ अरु॒णीरप॑ व्रन्
verses.transliteration: ádhā yáthā naḥ pitáraḥ párāsaḥ  pratnā́so agna r̥tám āśuṣāṇā́ḥ  śúcī́d ayan dī́dhitim ukthaśā́saḥ  kṣā́mā bhindánto aruṇī́r ápa vran

translation.text: As in the days of old our ancient Fathers, speeding the work of holy worship, Agni, Sought pure light and devotion, singing praises; they cleft the ground and made red Dawns apparent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒कर्मा॑णः सु॒रुचो॑ देव॒यन्तोऽयो॒ न दे॒वा जनि॑मा॒ धम॑न्तः शु॒चन्तो॑ अ॒ग्निं व॑वृ॒धन्त॒ इन्द्र॑मू॒र्वं गव्यं॑ परि॒षद॑न्तो अग्मन्
verses.transliteration: sukármāṇaḥ surúco devayántaḥ-  -áyo ná devā́ jánimā dhámantaḥ  śucánto agníṃ vavr̥dhánta índram  ūrváṃ gávyam pariṣádanto agman

translation.text: Gods, doing holy acts, devout, resplendent, smelting like ore their human generations. Enkindling Agni and exalting Indra, they came encompassing the stall of cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यू॒थेव॑ क्षु॒मति॑ प॒श्वो अ॑ख्यद्दे॒वानां॒ यज्जनि॒मान्त्यु॑ग्र मर्ता॑नां चिदु॒र्वशी॑रकृप्रन्वृ॒धे चि॑द॒र्य उप॑रस्या॒योः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yūthéva kṣumáti paśvó akhyad  devā́nāṃ yáj jánimā́nty ugra  mártānāṃ cid urváśīr akr̥pran  vr̥dhé cid aryá úparasyāyóḥ

translation.text: Strong One! he marked them-and the Gods before them-like herds of cattle in a foodful pasture. There they moaned forth their strong desire for mortals, to aid the True, the nearest One, the Living.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अक॑र्म ते॒ स्वप॑सो अभूम ऋ॒तम॑वस्रन्नु॒षसो॑ विभा॒तीः अनू॑नम॒ग्निं पु॑रु॒धा सु॑श्च॒न्द्रं दे॒वस्य॒ मर्मृ॑जत॒श्चारु॒ चक्षुः॑
verses.transliteration: ákarma te svápaso abhūma  r̥tám avasrann uṣáso vibhātī́ḥ  ánūnam agním purudhā́ suścandráṃ  devásya mármr̥jataś cā́ru cákṣuḥ

translation.text: We have worked for thee, we have laboured nobly-bright Dawns have shed their light upon our worship- Adding a beauty to the perfect Agni, and the God's beauteous eye that shines for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता ते॑ अग्न उ॒चथा॑नि वे॒धोऽवो॑चाम क॒वये॒ ता जु॑षस्व उच्छो॑चस्व कृणु॒हि वस्य॑सो नो म॒हो रा॒यः पु॑रुवार॒ प्र य॑न्धि
verses.transliteration: etā́ te agna ucáthāni vedho  -ávocāma kaváye tā́ juṣasva  úc chocasva kr̥ṇuhí vásyaso no  mahó rāyáḥ puruvāra prá yandhi

translation.text: Agni, Disposer, we have sung these praises to thee the Wise: do thou accept them gladly. Blaze up on high and ever make us richer. Give us great wealth, O thou whose boons are many.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वो॒ राजा॑नमध्व॒रस्य॑ रु॒द्रं होता॑रं सत्य॒यजं॒ रोद॑स्योः अ॒ग्निं पु॒रा त॑नयि॒त्नोर॒चित्ता॒द्धिर॑ण्यरूप॒मव॑से कृणुध्वम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vo rā́jānam adhvarásya rudráṃ  hótāraṃ satyayájaṃ ródasyoḥ  agním purā́ tanayitnór acíttād  -híraṇyarūpam ávase kr̥ṇudhvam

translation.text: WIN, to assist you, Rudra, Lord of worship, Priest of both worlds, effectual Sacrificer, Agni, invested with his golden colours, before the thunder strike and lay you senseless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं योनि॑श्चकृ॒मा यं व॒यं ते॑ जा॒येव॒ पत्य॑ उश॒ती सु॒वासाः॑ अ॒र्वा॒ची॒नः परि॑वीतो॒ नि षी॑दे॒मा उ॑ ते स्वपाक प्रती॒चीः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ yóniś cakr̥mā́ yáṃ vayáṃ te  jāyéva pátya uśatī́ suvā́sāḥ-  arvācīnáḥ párivīto ní ṣīda-  -imā́ u te svapāka pratīcī́ḥ

translation.text: This shrine have we made ready for thy coming, as the fond dame attires her for her husband. Performer of good work, sit down before us, invested while these flames incline to meet thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒शृ॒ण्व॒ते अदृ॑पिताय॒ मन्म॑ नृ॒चक्ष॑से सुमृळी॒काय॑ वेधः दे॒वाय॑ श॒स्तिम॒मृता॑य शंस॒ ग्रावे॑व॒ सोता॑ मधु॒षुद्यमी॒ळे
verses.transliteration: āśr̥ṇvaté ádr̥pitāya mánma  nr̥cákṣase sumr̥ḷīkā́ya vedhaḥ  devā́ya śastím amŕ̥tāya śaṃsa  grā́veva sótā madhuṣúd yám īḷé

translation.text: A hymn, O Priest, to him who hears, the gentle, to him who looks on men, exceeding gracious, A song of praise sing to the God Immortal, whom the stone, presser of the sweet juice, worships.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं चि॑न्नः॒ शम्या॑ अग्ने अ॒स्या ऋ॒तस्य॑ बोध्यृतचित्स्वा॒धीः क॒दा त॑ उ॒क्था स॑ध॒माद्या॑नि क॒दा भ॑वन्ति स॒ख्या गृ॒हे ते॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ cin naḥ śámyā agne asyā́ḥ-  r̥tásya bodhy r̥tacit svādhī́ḥ  kadā́ ta ukthā́ sadhamā́dyāni  kadā́ bhavanti sakhyā́ gr̥hé te

translation.text: Even as true knower of the Law, O Agni, to this our solemn rite he thou attentive. When shall thy songs of festival be sung thee? When is thy friendship shown within our dwelling?

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒था ह॒ तद्वरु॑णाय॒ त्वम॑ग्ने क॒था दि॒वे ग॑र्हसे॒ कन्न॒ आगः॑ क॒था मि॒त्राय॑ मी॒ळ्हुषे॑ पृथि॒व्यै ब्रवः॒ कद॑र्य॒म्णे कद्भगा॑य
verses.transliteration: kathā́ ha tád váruṇāya tvám agne  kathā́ divé garhase kán na ā́gaḥ  kathā́ mitrā́ya mīḷhúṣe pr̥thivyaí  brávaḥ kád aryamṇé kád bhágāya

translation.text: Why this complaint to Varuṇa, O Agni? And why to Heaven? for what is our transgression? How wilt thou speak to Earth and bounteous Mitra? What wilt thou say to Aryaman and Bhaga?

verses.sanskrit_deva: कद्धिष्ण्या॑सु वृधसा॒नो अ॑ग्ने॒ कद्वाता॑य॒ प्रत॑वसे शुभं॒ये परि॑ज्मने॒ नास॑त्याय॒ क्षे ब्रवः॒ कद॑ग्ने रु॒द्राय॑ नृ॒घ्ने
verses.transliteration: kád dhíṣṇyāsu vr̥dhasānó agne  kád vā́tāya prátavase śubhaṃyé  párijmane nā́satyāya kṣé  brávaḥ kád agne rudrā́ya nr̥ghné

translation.text: What, when thou blazest on the lesser altars, what to the mighty Wind who comes tobless us, True, circumambient? what to Earth, O Agni, what wilt thou say to man-destroying Rudra?

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒था म॒हे पु॑ष्टिम्भ॒राय॑ पू॒ष्णे कद्रु॒द्राय॒ सुम॑खाय हवि॒र्दे कद्विष्ण॑व उरुगा॒याय॒ रेतो॒ ब्रवः॒ कद॑ग्ने॒ शर॑वे बृह॒त्यै
verses.transliteration: kathā́ mahé puṣṭimbharā́ya pūṣṇé  kád rudrā́ya súmakhāya havirdé  kád víṣṇava urugāyā́ya réto  brávaḥ kád agne śárave br̥hatyaí

translation.text: How to great Pûshan who promotes our welfare,– to honoured Rudra what, who gives oblations? What sin of ours to the far-striding Vishṇu, what, Agni, wilt thou tell the Lofty Arrow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒था शर्धा॑य म॒रुता॑मृ॒ताय॑ क॒था सू॒रे बृ॑ह॒ते पृ॒च्छ्यमा॑नः प्रति॑ ब्र॒वोऽदि॑तये तु॒राय॒ साधा॑ दि॒वो जा॑तवेदश्चिकि॒त्वान्
verses.transliteration: kathā́ śárdhāya marútām r̥tā́ya  kathā́ sūré br̥haté pr̥chyámānaḥ  práti bravó 'ditaye turā́ya  sā́dhā divó jātavedaś cikitvā́n

translation.text: What wilt thou tell the truthful band of Maruts, how answer the great Sun when thou art questioned? Before the Free, before the Swift, defend us: fulfil heaven's work, all-knowing Jâtavedas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तेन॑ ऋ॒तं निय॑तमीळ॒ आ गोरा॒मा सचा॒ मधु॑मत्प॒क्वम॑ग्ने कृ॒ष्णा स॒ती रुश॑ता धा॒सिनै॒षा जाम॑र्येण॒ पय॑सा पीपाय
verses.transliteration: r̥téna r̥táṃ níyatam īḷa ā́ gór  āmā́ sácā mádhumat pakvám agne  kr̥ṣṇā́ satī́ rúśatā dhāsínaiṣā́  jā́maryeṇa páyasā pīpāya

translation.text: I crave the cow's true gift arranged by Order: though raw, she hath the sweet ripe juice, O Agni. Though she is black of hue with milk she teemeth, nutritious, brightly shining, all-sustaining.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तेन॒ हि ष्मा॑ वृष॒भश्चि॑द॒क्तः पुमाँ॑ अ॒ग्निः पय॑सा पृ॒ष्ठ्ये॑न अस्प॑न्दमानो अचरद्वयो॒धा वृषा॑ शु॒क्रं दु॑दुहे॒ पृश्नि॒रूधः॑
verses.transliteration: r̥téna hí ṣmā vr̥ṣabháś cid aktáḥ  púmām̐ agníḥ páyasā pr̥ṣṭhyèna  áspandamāno acarad vayodhā́ḥ-  vŕ̥ṣā śukráṃ duduhe pŕ̥śnir ū́dhaḥ

translation.text: Agni the Bull, the manly, hath been sprinkled with oil upon his back, by Law eternal. He who gives vital power goes on unswerving. Pr̥iṣni the Bull hath milked the pure wiiite udder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तेनाद्रिं॒ व्य॑सन्भि॒दन्तः॒ समङ्गि॑रसो नवन्त॒ गोभिः॑ शु॒नं नरः॒ परि॑ षदन्नु॒षास॑मा॒विः स्व॑रभवज्जा॒ते अ॒ग्नौ
verses.transliteration: r̥ténā́driṃ vy àsan bhidántaḥ  sám áṅgiraso navanta góbhiḥ  śunáṃ náraḥ pári ṣadann uṣā́sam  āvíḥ svàr abhavaj jāté agnaú

translation.text: By Law the Angirases cleft the rock asunder, and sang their hymns together with the cattle. Bringing great bliss the men encompassed Morning: light was apparent at the birth of Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तेन॑ दे॒वीर॒मृता॒ अमृ॑क्ता॒ अर्णो॑भि॒रापो॒ मधु॑मद्भिरग्ने वा॒जी न सर्गे॑षु प्रस्तुभा॒नः प्र सद॒मित्स्रवि॑तवे दधन्युः
verses.transliteration: r̥téna devī́r amŕ̥tā ámr̥ktāḥ-  árṇobhir ā́po mádhumadbhir agne  vājī́ ná sárgeṣu prastubhānáḥ  prá sádam ít srávitave dadhanyuḥ

translation.text: By Law the Immortal Goddesses the Waters, with meath-rich waves, O Agni, and uninjured, Like a strong courser lauded in his running, sped to flow onward swiftly and for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा कस्य॑ य॒क्षं सद॒मिद्धु॒रो गा॒ मा वे॒शस्य॑ प्रमिन॒तो मापेः मा भ्रातु॑रग्ने॒ अनृ॑जोर्ऋ॒णं वे॒र्मा सख्यु॒र्दक्षं॑ रि॒पोर्भु॑जेम
verses.transliteration: mā́ kásya yakṣáṃ sádam íd dhuró gāḥ-  mā́ veśásya praminató mā́péḥ  mā́ bhrā́tur agne ánr̥jor r̥ṇáṃ ver  mā́ sákhyur dákṣaṃ ripór bhujema

translation.text: Go never to the feast of one who harms us, the treacherous neighbour or. unworthy kinsman. Punish us not for a false brother's trespass. Let us riot feel the might of friend or foeman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रक्षा॑ णो अग्ने॒ तव॒ रक्ष॑णेभी रारक्षा॒णः सु॑मख प्रीणा॒नः प्रति॑ ष्फुर॒ वि रु॑ज वी॒ड्वंहो॑ ज॒हि रक्षो॒ महि॑ चिद्वावृधा॒नम्
verses.transliteration: rákṣā ṇo agne táva rákṣaṇebhiḥ-  rārakṣāṇáḥ sumakha prīṇānáḥ  práti ṣphura ví ruja vīḍv áṃho  jahí rákṣo máhi cid vāvr̥dhānám

translation.text: O Agni, keep us safe with thy protection, loving us, honoured God! and ever guarding. Beat thou away, destory severe affliction slay e'en the demon when he waxes mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒भिर्भ॑व सु॒मना॑ अग्ने अ॒र्कैरि॒मान्त्स्पृ॑श॒ मन्म॑भिः शूर॒ वाजा॑न् उ॒त ब्रह्मा॑ण्यङ्गिरो जुषस्व॒ सं ते॑ श॒स्तिर्दे॒ववा॑ता जरेत
verses.transliteration: ebhír bhava sumánā agne arkaír  imā́n spr̥śa mánmabhiḥ śūra vā́jān  utá bráhmāṇy aṅgiro juṣasva  sáṃ te śastír devávātā jareta

translation.text: Through these our songs of praise be gracious, Agni; moved by ourprayers, O Hero, touch our viands. Accept, O Angiras, these our devotions, and let the praise which Gods desire address thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता विश्वा॑ वि॒दुषे॒ तुभ्यं॑ वेधो नी॒थान्य॑ग्ने नि॒ण्या वचां॑सि नि॒वच॑ना क॒वये॒ काव्या॒न्यशं॑सिषं म॒तिभि॒र्विप्र॑ उ॒क्थैः
verses.transliteration: etā́ víśvā vidúṣe túbhyaṃ vedho  nīthā́ny agne niṇyā́ vácāṃsi  nivácanā kaváye kā́vyāni-  áśaṃsiṣam matíbhir vípra ukthaíḥ

translation.text: To thee who knowest, Agni, thou Disposer, all these wise secret speeches have I uttered, Sung to thee, Sage, the charming words of wisdom, to thee, O Singer, with. my thoughts and Praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒णु॒ष्व पाजः॒ प्रसि॑तिं॒ न पृ॒थ्वीं या॒हि राजे॒वाम॑वाँ॒ इभे॑न तृ॒ष्वीमनु॒ प्रसि॑तिं द्रूणा॒नोऽस्ता॑सि॒ विध्य॑ र॒क्षस॒स्तपि॑ष्ठैः
verses.transliteration: kr̥ṇuṣvá pā́jaḥ prásitiṃ ná pr̥thvī́ṃ  yāhí rā́jevā́mavām̐ íbhena  tr̥ṣvī́m ánu prásitiṃ drūṇānó  -ástāsi vídhya rakṣásas tápiṣṭhaiḥ

translation.text: PUT forth like a wide-spreading net thy vigour; go like a mighty King with his attendants. Thou, following thy swift net, shootest arrows: transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॑ भ्र॒मास॑ आशु॒या प॑त॒न्त्यनु॑ स्पृश धृष॒ता शोशु॑चानः तपूं॑ष्यग्ने जु॒ह्वा॑ पतं॒गानसं॑दितो॒ वि सृ॑ज॒ विष्व॑गु॒ल्काः
verses.transliteration: táva bhramā́sa āśuyā́ patanti-  ánu spr̥śa dhr̥ṣatā́ śóśucānaḥ  tápūṃṣy agne juhvā̀ pataṃgā́n  ásaṃdito ví sr̥ja víṣvag ulkā́ḥ

translation.text: Forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons: follow them closely, glowing in thy fury. Spread with thy tongue the winged flames, O Agni; unfettered, cast thy firebrands all around thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॒ स्पशो॒ वि सृ॑ज॒ तूर्णि॑तमो॒ भवा॑ पा॒युर्वि॒शो अ॒स्या अद॑ब्धः यो नो॑ दू॒रे अ॒घशं॑सो॒ यो अन्त्यग्ने॒ माकि॑ष्टे॒ व्यथि॒रा द॑धर्षीत्
verses.transliteration: práti spáśo ví sr̥ja tū́rṇitamo  bhávā pāyúr viśó asyā́ ádabdhaḥ  yó no dūré agháśaṃso yó ánti-  ágne mā́kiṣ ṭe vyáthir ā́ dadharṣīt

translation.text: Send thy spies forward, flectest in thy motion; be, ne'er deceived, the guardian of this people From him who, near or far, is bent on evil, and let no trouble sent from thee o'ercome us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद॑ग्ने तिष्ठ॒ प्रत्या त॑नुष्व॒ न्य१॒॑मित्राँ॑ ओषतात्तिग्महेते यो नो॒ अरा॑तिं समिधान च॒क्रे नी॒चा तं ध॑क्ष्यत॒सं न शुष्क॑म्
verses.transliteration: úd agne tiṣṭha práty ā́ tanuṣva  ny àmítrām̐ oṣatāt tigmahete  yó no árātiṃ samidhāna cakré  nīcā́ táṃ dhakṣy atasáṃ ná śúṣkam

translation.text: Rise up, O Agni, spread thee out before us: burn down our foes, thou who hast sharpened arrows. Him, blazing Agni! who hath worked us mischief, consume thou utterly like dried-up stubble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वो भ॑व॒ प्रति॑ वि॒ध्याध्य॒स्मदा॒विष्कृ॑णुष्व॒ दैव्या॑न्यग्ने अव॑ स्थि॒रा त॑नुहि यातु॒जूनां॑ जा॒मिमजा॑मिं॒ प्र मृ॑णीहि॒ शत्रू॑न्
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvó bhava práti vidhyā́dhy asmád  āvíṣ kr̥ṇuṣva daívyāny agne  áva sthirā́ tanuhi yātujū́nāṃ  jāmím ájāmim prá mr̥ṇīhi śátrūn

translation.text: Rise, Agni, drive off those who fight against us: make manifest thine own celestial vigour. Slacken the strong bows of the demondriven: destroy our foemen whether kin or stranger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स ते॑ जानाति सुम॒तिं य॑विष्ठ॒ य ईव॑ते॒ ब्रह्म॑णे गा॒तुमैर॑त् विश्वा॑न्यस्मै सु॒दिना॑नि रा॒यो द्यु॒म्नान्य॒र्यो वि दुरो॑ अ॒भि द्यौ॑त्
verses.transliteration: sá te jānāti sumatíṃ yaviṣṭha  yá ī́vate bráhmaṇe gātúm aírat  víśvāny asmai sudínāni rāyó  dyumnā́ny aryó ví dúro abhí dyaut

translation.text: Most Youthful God, he knoweth well thy favour who gave an impulse to this high devotion. All fair days and magnificence of riches hast thou beamed forth upon the good man's portals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सेद॑ग्ने अस्तु सु॒भगः॑ सु॒दानु॒र्यस्त्वा॒ नित्ये॑न ह॒विषा॒ य उ॒क्थैः पिप्री॑षति॒ स्व आयु॑षि दुरो॒णे विश्वेद॑स्मै सु॒दिना॒ सास॑दि॒ष्टिः
verses.transliteration: séd agne astu subhágaḥ sudā́nur  yás tvā nítyena havíṣā yá ukthaíḥ  píprīṣati svá ā́yuṣi duroṇé  víśvéd asmai sudínā sā́sad iṣṭíḥ

translation.text: Blest, Agni, be the man, the liberal giver, who with his lauds and regular oblation Is fain to please thee for his life and dwelling. May all his days be bright: be this his longing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्चा॑मि ते सुम॒तिं घोष्य॒र्वाक्सं ते॑ वा॒वाता॑ जरतामि॒यं गीः स्वश्वा॑स्त्वा सु॒रथा॑ मर्जयेमा॒स्मे क्ष॒त्राणि॑ धारये॒रनु॒ द्यून्
verses.transliteration: árcāmi te sumatíṃ ghóṣy arvā́k  sáṃ te vāvā́tā jaratām iyáṃ gī́ḥ  sváśvās tvā suráthā marjayema-  -asmé kṣatrā́ṇi dhārayer ánu dyū́n

translation.text: I praise thy gracious favour: sing in answer. May this my song sing like a loved one with thee. Lords of good steeds and cars may we adorn thee, and day by day vouchsafe thou us dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ह त्वा॒ भूर्या च॑रे॒दुप॒ त्मन्दोषा॑वस्तर्दीदि॒वांस॒मनु॒ द्यून् क्रीळ॑न्तस्त्वा सु॒मन॑सः सपेमा॒भि द्यु॒म्ना त॑स्थि॒वांसो॒ जना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: ihá tvā bhū́ry ā́ cared úpa tmán  dóṣāvastar dīdivā́ṃsam ánu dyū́n  krī́ḷantas tvā sumánasaḥ sapema-  -abhí dyumnā́ tasthivā́ṃso jánānām

translation.text: Here of free choice let each one serve thee richly, resplendent day by day at eve and morning. So may we honour thee, content and joyous, passing beyond the glories of the people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त्वा॒ स्वश्वः॑ सुहिर॒ण्यो अ॑ग्न उप॒याति॒ वसु॑मता॒ रथे॑न तस्य॑ त्रा॒ता भ॑वसि॒ तस्य॒ सखा॒ यस्त॑ आति॒थ्यमा॑नु॒षग्जुजो॑षत्
verses.transliteration: yás tvā sváśvaḥ suhiraṇyó agne-  upayā́ti vásumatā ráthena  tásya trātā́ bhavasi tásya sákhā  yás ta ātithyám ānuṣág jújoṣat

translation.text: Whoso with good steeds and fine gold, O Agni, comes nigh thee on a car laden with trcasure, His Friend art thou, yea, thou art his Protector whose joy it is to entertain thee duly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हो रु॑जामि ब॒न्धुता॒ वचो॑भि॒स्तन्मा॑ पि॒तुर्गोत॑मा॒दन्वि॑याय त्वं नो॑ अ॒स्य वच॑सश्चिकिद्धि॒ होत॑र्यविष्ठ सुक्रतो॒ दमू॑नाः
verses.transliteration: mahó rujāmi bandhútā vácobhis  tán mā pitúr gótamād ánv iyāya  tváṃ no asyá vácasaś cikiddhi  hótar yaviṣṭha sukrato dámūnāḥ

translation.text: Through words and kinship I destroy the miglity: this power I have from Gotama my father. Mark thou this speech of ours, O thou Most Youthful, Friend of the House, exceeding wise, Invoker.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्व॑प्नजस्त॒रण॑यः सु॒शेवा॒ अत॑न्द्रासोऽवृ॒का अश्र॑मिष्ठाः ते पा॒यवः॑ स॒ध्र्य॑ञ्चो नि॒षद्याग्ने॒ तव॑ नः पान्त्वमूर
verses.transliteration: ásvapnajas taráṇayaḥ suśévāḥ-  átandrāso 'vr̥kā́ áśramiṣṭhāḥ  té pāyávaḥ sadhryàñco niṣádya-  -ágne táva naḥ pāntv amūra

translation.text: Knowing no slumber, speedy and propitious, alert and ever friendly, most unwearied, May thy protecting powers, unerring Agni, taking their places here, combined, preserve us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये पा॒यवो॑ मामते॒यं ते॑ अग्ने॒ पश्य॑न्तो अ॒न्धं दु॑रि॒तादर॑क्षन् र॒रक्ष॒ तान्त्सु॒कृतो॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दा॒ दिप्स॑न्त॒ इद्रि॒पवो॒ नाह॑ देभुः
verses.transliteration: yé pāyávo māmateyáṃ te agne  páśyanto andháṃ duritā́d árakṣan  rarákṣa tā́n sukŕ̥to viśvávedāḥ-  dípsanta íd ripávo nā́ha debhuḥ

translation.text: Thy guardian rays, O Agni, when they saw him, preserved blind Mâmateya from affliction. Lord of all riches, he preserved the pious: the fees who fain would harm them did no mischief

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वया॑ व॒यं स॑ध॒न्य१॒॑स्त्वोता॒स्तव॒ प्रणी॑त्यश्याम॒ वाजा॑न् उ॒भा शंसा॑ सूदय सत्यतातेऽनुष्ठु॒या कृ॑णुह्यह्रयाण
verses.transliteration: tváyā vayáṃ sadhanyàs tvótās  táva práṇīty aśyāma vā́jān  ubhā́ śáṃsā sūdaya satyatāte  -anuṣṭhuyā́ kr̥ṇuhy ahrayāṇa

translation.text: Aided by thee with thee may we be wealthy, may we gain strength with thee to guide us onward. Fulfil the words of both, O Ever Truthful: straightway do this, thou God whom power emboldens.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒या ते॑ अग्ने स॒मिधा॑ विधेम॒ प्रति॒ स्तोमं॑ श॒स्यमा॑नं गृभाय दहा॒शसो॑ र॒क्षसः॑ पा॒ह्य१॒॑स्मान्द्रु॒हो नि॒दो मि॑त्रमहो अव॒द्यात्
verses.transliteration: ayā́ te agne samídhā vidhema  práti stómaṃ śasyámānaṃ gr̥bhāya  dáhāśáso rakṣásaḥ pāhy àsmā́n  druhó nidó mitramaho avadyā́t

translation.text: O Agni, with this fuel will we serve thee; accept the laud we sing to thee with favour Destroy the cursing Raksasas: preserve us, O rich in friends, from guile and scorn and slander.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वै॒श्वा॒न॒राय॑ मी॒ळ्हुषे॑ स॒जोषाः॑ क॒था दा॑शेमा॒ग्नये॑ बृ॒हद्भाः अनू॑नेन बृह॒ता व॒क्षथे॒नोप॑ स्तभायदुप॒मिन्न रोधः॑
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarā́ya mīḷhúṣe sajóṣāḥ  kathā́ dāśemāgnáye br̥hád bhā́ḥ  ánūnena br̥hatā́ vakṣáthena-  -úpa stabhāyad upamín ná ródhaḥ

translation.text: How shall we give with one accord oblation to Agni, to Vaiṣvânara the Bounteous? Great light, with full high growth hath he uplifted, and, as a pillar bears the roof, sustains it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नि॑न्दत॒ य इ॒मां मह्यं॑ रा॒तिं दे॒वो द॒दौ मर्त्या॑य स्व॒धावा॑न् पाका॑य॒ गृत्सो॑ अ॒मृतो॒ विचे॑ता वैश्वान॒रो नृत॑मो य॒ह्वो अ॒ग्निः
verses.transliteration: mā́ nindata yá imā́m máhyaṃ rātíṃ  devó dadaú mártyāya svadhā́vān  pā́kāya gŕ̥tso amŕ̥to vícetāḥ-  vaiśvānaró nŕ̥tamo yahvó agníḥ

translation.text: Reproach not him who, God and selfreliant, vouchsafed this bounty unto me a mortal,– Deathless, discerner, wise, to me the simple, Vaiṣvânara most manly, youthful Aini.

verses.sanskrit_deva: साम॑ द्वि॒बर्हा॒ महि॑ ति॒ग्मभृ॑ष्टिः स॒हस्र॑रेता वृष॒भस्तुवि॑ष्मान् प॒दं न गोरप॑गूळ्हं विवि॒द्वान॒ग्निर्मह्यं॒ प्रेदु॑ वोचन्मनी॒षाम्
verses.transliteration: sā́ma dvibárhā máhi tigmábhr̥ṣṭiḥ  sahásraretā vr̥ṣabhás túviṣmān  padáṃ ná gór ápagūḷhaṃ vividvā́n  agnír máhyam préd u vocan manīṣā́m

translation.text: Sharp-pointed, powerful, strong, of boundless vigour, Agni who knows the lofty hymn, kept secret As the lost milch-cow's track, the doubly Mighty,– he hath declared to me this hidden knowledge.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ताँ अ॒ग्निर्ब॑भसत्ति॒ग्मज॑म्भ॒स्तपि॑ष्ठेन शो॒चिषा॒ यः सु॒राधाः॑ प्र ये मि॒नन्ति॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ धाम॑ प्रि॒या मि॒त्रस्य॒ चेत॑तो ध्रु॒वाणि॑
verses.transliteration: prá tā́m̐ agnír babhasat tigmájambhas  tápiṣṭhena śocíṣā yáḥ surā́dhāḥ  prá yé minánti váruṇasya dhā́ma  priyā́ mitrásya cétato dhruvā́ṇi

translation.text: May he with sharpened teeth, the Bounteous Giver, Agni, consume with flame most fiercely glowing. Those who regard not Varuṇa's commandments and the dear stedfast laws of sapient Mitra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भ्रा॒तरो॒ न योष॑णो॒ व्यन्तः॑ पति॒रिपो॒ न जन॑यो दु॒रेवाः॑ पा॒पासः॒ सन्तो॑ अनृ॒ता अ॑स॒त्या इ॒दं प॒दम॑जनता गभी॒रम्
verses.transliteration: abhrātáro ná yóṣaṇo vyántaḥ  patirípo ná jánayo durévāḥ  pāpā́saḥ sánto anr̥tā́ asatyā́ḥ-  idám padám ajanatā gabhīrám

translation.text: Like youthful women without brothers, straying, like dames who hate their lords, of evil conduct, They who are full of sin, untrue, unfaithful, they have engendered this abysmal station.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं मे॑ अग्ने॒ किय॑ते पाव॒कामि॑नते गु॒रुं भा॒रं न मन्म॑ बृ॒हद्द॑धाथ धृष॒ता ग॑भी॒रं य॒ह्वं पृ॒ष्ठं प्रय॑सा स॒प्तधा॑तु
verses.transliteration: idám me agne kíyate pāvaka-  -áminate gurúm bhāráṃ ná mánma  br̥hád dadhātha dhr̥ṣatā́ gabhīráṃ  yahvám pr̥ṣṭhám práyasā saptádhātu

translation.text: To me, weak, innocent, thou, luminous Agni, bast boldly given as 'twere a heavy burthen, This Prstha hymn, profound and strong and mighty, of seven elements, and with offered dainties.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमिन्न्वे॒३॒॑व स॑म॒ना स॑मा॒नम॒भि क्रत्वा॑ पुन॒ती धी॒तिर॑श्याः स॒सस्य॒ चर्म॒न्नधि॒ चारु॒ पृश्ने॒रग्रे॑ रु॒प आरु॑पितं॒ जबा॑रु
verses.transliteration: tám ín nv èvá samanā́ samānám  abhí krátvā punatī́ dhītír aśyāḥ  sasásya cármann ádhi cā́ru pŕ̥śner  ágre rupá ā́rupitaṃ jábāru

translation.text: So may our song that purifies, through wisdom reach in a moment him the Universal, Established on the height, on earth's best .station, above the beauteous grassy skin of Pr̥iṣni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒वाच्यं॒ वच॑सः॒ किं मे॑ अ॒स्य गुहा॑ हि॒तमुप॑ नि॒णिग्व॑दन्ति यदु॒स्रिया॑णा॒मप॒ वारि॑व॒ व्रन्पाति॑ प्रि॒यं रु॒पो अग्रं॑ प॒दं वेः
verses.transliteration: pravā́cyaṃ vácasaḥ kím me asyá  gúhā hitám úpa niṇíg vadanti  yád usríyāṇām ápa vā́r iva vrán  pā́ti priyáṃ rupó ágram padáṃ véḥ

translation.text: Of this my speech what shall I utter further? They indicate the milk stored up in secret When they have thrown as 'twere the cows' stalls open. The Bird protects earths' best and wellloved station.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दमु॒ त्यन्महि॑ म॒हामनी॑कं॒ यदु॒स्रिया॒ सच॑त पू॒र्व्यं गौः ऋ॒तस्य॑ प॒दे अधि॒ दीद्या॑नं॒ गुहा॑ रघु॒ष्यद्र॑घु॒यद्वि॑वेद
verses.transliteration: idám u tyán máhi mahā́m ánīkaṃ  yád usríyā sácata pūrvyáṃ gaúḥ  r̥tásya padé ádhi dī́dyānaṃ  gúhā raghuṣyád raghuyád viveda

translation.text: This is the Great Ones' mighty apparition which from of old the radiant Cow hath followed. This, shining brightly in the place of Order, swift, hasting on in secret, she discovered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॑ द्युता॒नः पि॒त्रोः सचा॒साम॑नुत॒ गुह्यं॒ चारु॒ पृश्नेः॑ मा॒तुष्प॒दे प॑र॒मे अन्ति॒ षद्गोर्वृष्णः॑ शो॒चिषः॒ प्रय॑तस्य जि॒ह्वा
verses.transliteration: ádha dyutānáḥ pitróḥ sácāsā́-  -ámanuta gúhyaṃ cā́ru pŕ̥śneḥ  mātúṣ padé paramé ánti ṣád gór  vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ śocíṣaḥ práyatasya jihvā́

translation.text: He then who shone together with his Parents remembered Pr̥iṣni's fair and secret treasure, Which, in the Mother Cow's most lofty station, the Bull's tongue, of the flame bent forward, tasted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तं वो॑चे॒ नम॑सा पृ॒च्छ्यमा॑न॒स्तवा॒शसा॑ जातवेदो॒ यदी॒दम् त्वम॒स्य क्ष॑यसि॒ यद्ध॒ विश्वं॑ दि॒वि यदु॒ द्रवि॑णं॒ यत्पृ॑थि॒व्याम्
verses.transliteration: r̥táṃ voce námasā pr̥chyámānas  távāśásā jātavedo yádīdám  tvám asyá kṣayasi yád dha víśvaṃ  diví yád u dráviṇaṃ yát pr̥thivyā́m

translation.text: With reverence I declare the Law, O Agni; what is, comes by thine order, Jâtavedas. Of this, whate'er it be, thou art the Sovran, yea, all the wealth that is in earth or heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किं नो॑ अ॒स्य द्रवि॑णं॒ कद्ध॒ रत्नं॒ वि नो॑ वोचो जातवेदश्चिकि॒त्वान् गुहाध्व॑नः पर॒मं यन्नो॑ अ॒स्य रेकु॑ प॒दं न नि॑दा॒ना अग॑न्म
verses.transliteration: kíṃ no asyá dráviṇaṃ kád dha rátnaṃ  ví no voco jātavedaś cikitvā́n  gúhā́dhvanaḥ paramáṃ yán no asyá  réku padáṃ ná nidānā́ áganma

translation.text: What is our wealth therefrom, and what our treasure? Tell us O Jâtavedas, for thou knowest, What is our best course in this secret passage: we, unreproached, have reached a t)lace far distant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: का म॒र्यादा॑ व॒युना॒ कद्ध॑ वा॒ममच्छा॑ गमेम र॒घवो॒ न वाज॑म् क॒दा नो॑ दे॒वीर॒मृत॑स्य॒ पत्नीः॒ सूरो॒ वर्णे॑न ततनन्नु॒षासः॑
verses.transliteration: kā́ maryā́dā vayúnā kád dha vāmám  áchā gamema raghávo ná vā́jam  kadā́ no devī́r amŕ̥tasya pátnīḥ  sū́ro várṇena tatanann uṣā́saḥ

translation.text: What is the limit, what the rules, the guerdon? Like fleet-foot coursers speed we to the contest. When will the Goddesses, the Immortal's Spouses, the Dawns, spread over us the Sun-God's splendour?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒नि॒रेण॒ वच॑सा फ॒ल्ग्वे॑न प्र॒तीत्ये॑न कृ॒धुना॑तृ॒पासः॑ अधा॒ ते अ॑ग्ने॒ किमि॒हा व॑दन्त्यनायु॒धास॒ आस॑ता सचन्ताम्
verses.transliteration: aniréṇa vácasā phalgvèna  pratī́tyena kr̥dhúnātr̥pā́saḥ  ádhā té agne kím ihā́ vadanti-  anāyudhā́sa ā́satā sacantām

translation.text: Unsatisfied, with speech devoid of vigour, scanty and frivolous and inconclusive, Wherefore do they address thee here, O Agni? Let these who have no weapons suffer sorrow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य श्रि॒ये स॑मिधा॒नस्य॒ वृष्णो॒ वसो॒रनी॑कं॒ दम॒ आ रु॑रोच रुश॒द्वसा॑नः सु॒दृशी॑करूपः क्षि॒तिर्न रा॒या पु॑रु॒वारो॑ अद्यौत्
verses.transliteration: asyá śriyé samidhānásya vŕ̥ṣṇo  vásor ánīkaṃ dáma ā́ ruroca  rúśad vásānaḥ sudŕ̥śīkarūpaḥ  kṣitír ná rāyā́ puruvā́ro adyaut

translation.text: The majesty of him the Good, the Mighty, aflame, hath shone for glory in the dwelling. He, clothed in light, hath shone most fair to look on, wealthy in boons, as a home shines with riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्व ऊ॒ षु णो॑ अध्वरस्य होत॒रग्ने॒ तिष्ठ॑ दे॒वता॑ता॒ यजी॑यान् त्वं हि विश्व॑म॒भ्यसि॒ मन्म॒ प्र वे॒धस॑श्चित्तिरसि मनी॒षाम्
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvá ū ṣú ṇo adhvarasya hotar  ágne tíṣṭha devátātā yájīyān  tváṃ hí víśvam abhy ási mánma  prá vedhásaś cit tirasi manīṣā́m

translation.text: PRIEST of our rite, stand up erect, O Agni, in the Gods' service best of sacrificers, For over evei y thought thou art the Ruler: thou furtherest e'en the wisdom of the pious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अमू॑रो॒ होता॒ न्य॑सादि वि॒क्ष्व१॒॑ग्निर्म॒न्द्रो वि॒दथे॑षु॒ प्रचे॑ताः ऊ॒र्ध्वं भा॒नुं स॑वि॒तेवा॑श्रे॒न्मेते॑व धू॒मं स्त॑भाय॒दुप॒ द्याम्
verses.transliteration: ámūro hótā ny àsādi vikṣú-  -agnír mandró vidátheṣu prácetāḥ  ūrdhvám bhānúṃ savitévāśret-  méteva dhūmáṃ stabhāyad úpa dyā́m

translation.text: He was set down mid men as Priest unerring, Agni, wise, welcome in our holy synods. Like Savitar he hath lifted up his splendour, and like a builder raised his smoke to heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ता सु॑जू॒र्णी रा॒तिनी॑ घृ॒ताची॑ प्रदक्षि॒णिद्दे॒वता॑तिमुरा॒णः उदु॒ स्वरु॑र्नव॒जा नाक्रः प॒श्वो अ॑नक्ति॒ सुधि॑तः सु॒मेकः॑
verses.transliteration: yatā́ sujūrṇī́ rātínī ghr̥tā́cī  pradakṣiṇíd devátātim urāṇáḥ  úd u svárur navajā́ nā́kráḥ  paśvó anakti súdhitaḥ sumékaḥ

translation.text: The glowing ladle, filled with oil, is lifted; choosing Gods' service to the right he circles. Eager he rises like the new-wrought pillar which, firmly set and fixed, anoints the victims.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्ती॒र्णे ब॒र्हिषि॑ समिधा॒ने अ॒ग्ना ऊ॒र्ध्वो अ॑ध्व॒र्युर्जु॑जुषा॒णो अ॑स्थात् पर्य॒ग्निः प॑शु॒पा न होता॑ त्रिवि॒ष्ट्ये॑ति प्र॒दिव॑ उरा॒णः
verses.transliteration: stīrṇé barhíṣi samidhāné agnaú-  ūrdhvó adhvaryúr jujuṣāṇó asthāt  páry agníḥ paśupā́ ná hótā  triviṣṭy èti pradíva urāṇáḥ

translation.text: When sacred grass is strewn and Agni kindled, the Adhvaryu rises to, his task rej o cing. Agni the Priest, like one who tends the cattle, goes three times round, as from of old he wills it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ त्मना॑ मि॒तद्रु॑रेति॒ होता॒ग्निर्म॒न्द्रो मधु॑वचा ऋ॒तावा॑ द्रव॑न्त्यस्य वा॒जिनो॒ न शोका॒ भय॑न्ते॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒ यदभ्रा॑ट्
verses.transliteration: pári tmánā mitádrur eti hótā-  -agnír mandró mádhuvacā r̥tā́vā  drávanty asya vājíno ná śókāḥ-  bháyante víśvā bhúvanā yád ábhrāṭ

translation.text: Agni himself, the Priest, with measured motion, goes round, with sweet speech, cheerful, true to Order. His fulgent flames run forth like vigorous horses; all creatures are affrighted when he blazes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रा ते॑ अग्ने स्वनीक सं॒दृग्घो॒रस्य॑ स॒तो विषु॑णस्य॒ चारुः॑ न यत्ते॑ शो॒चिस्तम॑सा॒ वर॑न्त॒ न ध्व॒स्मान॑स्त॒न्वी॒३॒॑ रेप॒ आ धुः॑
verses.transliteration: bhadrā́ te agne svanīka saṃdŕ̥g  ghorásya sató víṣuṇasya cā́ruḥ  ná yát te śocís támasā váranta  ná dhvasmā́nas tanvī̀ répa ā́ dhuḥ

translation.text: Beautiful and auspicious is thine aspect, O lovely Agni, terrible when spreading. Thy splendours are not covered by the darkness: detraction leaves no stain upon thy body.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यस्य॒ सातु॒र्जनि॑तो॒रवा॑रि॒ न मा॒तरा॑पि॒तरा॒ नू चि॑दि॒ष्टौ अधा॑ मि॒त्रो न सुधि॑तः पाव॒को॒३॒॑ऽग्निर्दी॑दाय॒ मानु॑षीषु वि॒क्षु
verses.transliteration: ná yásya sā́tur jánitor ávāri  ná mātárāpitárā nū́ cid iṣṭaú  ádhā mitró ná súdhitaḥ pāvakáḥ-  -agnír dīdāya mā́nuṣīṣu vikṣú

translation.text: Naught hindered his production, Bounteous Giver: his Mother and his Sire were free to send him. Then as Friend benevolent, refulgent, Agni shone forth in human habitations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्विर्यं पञ्च॒ जीज॑नन्त्सं॒वसा॑नाः॒ स्वसा॑रो अ॒ग्निं मानु॑षीषु वि॒क्षु उ॒ष॒र्बुध॑मथ॒र्यो॒३॒॑ न दन्तं॑ शु॒क्रं स्वासं॑ पर॒शुं न ति॒ग्मम्
verses.transliteration: dvír yám páñca jī́janan saṃvásānāḥ  svásāro agním mā́nuṣīṣu vikṣú  uṣarbúdham atharyò ná dántaṃ  śukráṃ svā́sam paraśúṃ ná tigmám

translation.text: He, Agni, whom the twice-five sisters, dwelling together, in the homes of men engendered, Bright like a spear's tooth, wakened in the morning, with powerful mouth and like an axe wellsharpened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॒ त्ये अ॑ग्ने ह॒रितो॑ घृत॒स्ना रोहि॑तास ऋ॒ज्वञ्चः॒ स्वञ्चः॑ अ॒रु॒षासो॒ वृष॑ण ऋजुमु॒ष्का आ दे॒वता॑तिमह्वन्त द॒स्माः
verses.transliteration: táva tyé agne haríto ghr̥tasnā́ḥ-  róhitāsa r̥jváñcaḥ sváñcaḥ  aruṣā́so vŕ̥ṣaṇa r̥jumuṣkā́ḥ-  ā́ devátātim ahvanta dasmā́ḥ

translation.text: These thy Bay Coursers, Agni, dropping fatness, ruddy vigorous, speeding straightly forward, And red steeds, wonderful, of mighty muscle, are to this service of the Gods invited:

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये ह॒ त्ये ते॒ सह॑माना अ॒यास॑स्त्वे॒षासो॑ अग्ने अ॒र्चय॒श्चर॑न्ति श्ये॒नासो॒ न दु॑वस॒नासो॒ अर्थं॑ तुविष्व॒णसो॒ मारु॑तं॒ न शर्धः॑
verses.transliteration: yé ha tyé te sáhamānā ayā́sas  tveṣā́so agne arcáyaś cáranti  śyenā́so ná duvasanā́so árthaṃ  tuviṣvaṇáso mā́rutaṃ ná śárdhaḥ

translation.text: These brightly-shining games of thine, O Agni, that move for ever restless, allsubduing, Like falcons hasting eagerly to the quarry, roar loudly like the army of the Maruts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अका॑रि॒ ब्रह्म॑ समिधान॒ तुभ्यं॒ शंसा॑त्यु॒क्थं यज॑ते॒ व्यू॑ धाः होता॑रम॒ग्निं मनु॑षो॒ नि षे॑दुर्नम॒स्यन्त॑ उ॒शिजः॒ शंस॑मा॒योः
verses.transliteration: ákāri bráhma samidhāna túbhyaṃ  śáṃsāty uktháṃ yájate vy ū̀ dhāḥ  hótāram agním mánuṣo ní ṣedur  namasyánta uśíjaḥ śáṃsam āyóḥ

translation.text: To thee, O flaming God, hath prayer been offered. Let the priest laud thee: give to him who worships. Men have established Agni as Invoker, fain to adore the glory of the living.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यमि॒ह प्र॑थ॒मो धा॑यि धा॒तृभि॒र्होता॒ यजि॑ष्ठो अध्व॒रेष्वीड्यः॑ यमप्न॑वानो॒ भृग॑वो विरुरु॒चुर्वने॑षु चि॒त्रं वि॒भ्वं॑ वि॒शेवि॑शे
verses.transliteration: ayám ihá prathamó dhāyi dhātŕ̥bhir  hótā yájiṣṭho adhvaréṣv ī́ḍyaḥ  yám ápnavāno bhŕ̥gavo virurucúr  váneṣu citráṃ vibhvàṃ viśé-viśe

translation.text: HERE by ordainers was this God appointed first Invoker, best at worship, to be praised at rites: Whom Apnavâna, and the Bhr̥igus caused to shine bright-coloured in the wood, spreading from home to home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ क॒दा त॑ आनु॒षग्भुव॑द्दे॒वस्य॒ चेत॑नम् अधा॒ हि त्वा॑ जगृभ्रि॒रे मर्ता॑सो वि॒क्ष्वीड्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ágne kadā́ ta ānuṣág  bhúvad devásya cétanam  ádhā hí tvā jagr̥bhriré  mártāso vikṣv ī́ḍyam

translation.text: When shall thy glory as a God, Agni, be suddenly shown forth. For mortal men have held thee fast, adorable in all their homes,

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तावा॑नं॒ विचे॑तसं॒ पश्य॑न्तो॒ द्यामि॑व॒ स्तृभिः॑ विश्वे॑षामध्व॒राणां॑ हस्क॒र्तारं॒ दमे॑दमे
verses.transliteration: r̥tā́vānaṃ vícetasam  páśyanto dyā́m iva stŕ̥bhiḥ  víśveṣām adhvarā́ṇāṃ  haskartā́raṃ dáme-dame

translation.text: Seeing thee faithful to the Law, most sapient, like the starry heaven, Illumining with cheerful ray each solemn rite in every house.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒शुं दू॒तं वि॒वस्व॑तो॒ विश्वा॒ यश्च॑र्ष॒णीर॒भि आ ज॑भ्रुः के॒तुमा॒यवो॒ भृग॑वाणं वि॒शेवि॑शे
verses.transliteration: āśúṃ dūtáṃ vivásvato  víśvā yáś carṣaṇī́r abhí  ā́ jabhruḥ ketúm āyávo  bhŕ̥gavāṇaṃ viśé-viśe

translation.text: Vivasvan's envoy living men have taken as their ensign, swift, The ruler over all mankind, moving like Bhr̥igu in each home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमीं॒ होता॑रमानु॒षक्चि॑कि॒त्वांसं॒ नि षे॑दिरे र॒ण्वं पा॑व॒कशो॑चिषं॒ यजि॑ष्ठं स॒प्त धाम॑भिः
verses.transliteration: tám īṃ hótāram ānuṣák  cikitvā́ṃsaṃ ní ṣedire  raṇvám pāvakáśociṣaṃ  yájiṣṭhaṃ saptá dhā́mabhiḥ

translation.text: Him the intelligent have they placed duly as Invoking Priest, Welcome, with sanctifying flame, best worshipper, with sevenfold might;

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं शश्व॑तीषु मा॒तृषु॒ वन॒ आ वी॒तमश्रि॑तम् चि॒त्रं सन्तं॒ गुहा॑ हि॒तं सु॒वेदं॑ कूचिद॒र्थिन॑म्
verses.transliteration: táṃ śáśvatīṣu mātŕ̥ṣu  vána ā́ vītám áśritam  citráṃ sántaṃ gúhā hitáṃ  suvédaṃ kūcidarthínam

translation.text: In his Eternal Mothers, in the wood, concealed and unapproached, Kept secret though his flames are bright seekingon all sides, quickly found.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒सस्य॒ यद्वियु॑ता॒ सस्मि॒न्नूध॑न्नृ॒तस्य॒ धाम॑न्र॒णय॑न्त दे॒वाः म॒हाँ अ॒ग्निर्नम॑सा रा॒तह॑व्यो॒ वेर॑ध्व॒राय॒ सद॒मिदृ॒तावा॑
verses.transliteration: sasásya yád víyutā sásminn ū́dhann  r̥tásya dhā́man raṇáyanta devā́ḥ  mahā́m̐ agnír námasā rātáhavyo  vér adhvarā́ya sádam íd r̥tā́vā

translation.text: That as food spreads forth in this earthly udder, Gods may rejoice them in the home of Order, Great Agni, served with reverence and oblation, flies ever to the sacrifice, the Faithful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वेर॑ध्व॒रस्य॑ दू॒त्या॑नि वि॒द्वानु॒भे अ॒न्ता रोद॑सी संचिकि॒त्वान् दू॒त ई॑यसे प्र॒दिव॑ उरा॒णो वि॒दुष्ट॑रो दि॒व आ॒रोध॑नानि
verses.transliteration: vér adhvarásya dūtyā̀ni vidvā́n  ubhé antā́ ródasī saṃcikitvā́n  dūtá īyase pradíva urāṇó  vidúṣṭaro divá āródhanāni

translation.text: Bird of each rite, skilled in an envoy's duties, knowing both worlds and that which lies between them, Thou goest from of old a willing Herald, knowing full well heaven's innermost recesses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒ष्णं त॒ एम॒ रुश॑तः पु॒रो भाश्च॑रि॒ष्ण्व१॒॑र्चिर्वपु॑षा॒मिदेक॑म् यदप्र॑वीता॒ दध॑ते ह॒ गर्भं॑ स॒द्यश्चि॑ज्जा॒तो भव॒सीदु॑ दू॒तः
verses.transliteration: kr̥ṣṇáṃ ta éma rúśataḥ puró bhā́ś  cariṣṇv àrcír vápuṣām íd ékam  yád ápravītā dádhate ha gárbhaṃ  sadyáś cij jātó bhávasī́d u dūtáḥ

translation.text: Bright God, thy path is black: light is before thee: thy moving splendour is the chief of wonders. When she, yet unimpregnate, hath conceived thee, even when newly born thou art an envoy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒द्यो जा॒तस्य॒ ददृ॑शान॒मोजो॒ यद॑स्य॒ वातो॑ अनु॒वाति॑ शो॒चिः वृ॒णक्ति॑ ति॒ग्माम॑त॒सेषु॑ जि॒ह्वां स्थि॒रा चि॒दन्ना॑ दयते॒ वि जम्भैः॑
verses.transliteration: sadyó jātásya dádr̥śānam ójo  yád asya vā́to anuvā́ti śocíḥ  vr̥ṇákti tigmā́m ataséṣu jihvā́ṃ  sthirā́ cid ánnā dayate ví jámbhaiḥ

translation.text: Yet newly born, his vigour is apparent when the wind blows upon his fiery splendour, His sharpened tongue he layeth on the brushwood, and with his teeth e'en solid food consumeth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तृ॒षु यदन्ना॑ तृ॒षुणा॑ व॒वक्ष॑ तृ॒षुं दू॒तं कृ॑णुते य॒ह्वो अ॒ग्निः वात॑स्य मे॒ळिं स॑चते नि॒जूर्व॑न्ना॒शुं न वा॑जयते हि॒न्वे अर्वा॑
verses.transliteration: tr̥ṣú yád ánnā tr̥ṣúṇā vavákṣa  tr̥ṣúṃ dūtáṃ kr̥ṇute yahvó agníḥ  vā́tasya meḷíṃ sacate nijū́rvann  āśúṃ ná vājayate hinvé árvā

translation.text: When he hath borne off food with swift flame swiftly, strong Agni makes himself a speedy envoy, Follows the rustling of the wind, consuming, and courser-like, speeds, drives the swift horse onward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दू॒तं वो॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दसं हव्य॒वाह॒मम॑र्त्यम् यजि॑ष्ठमृञ्जसे गि॒रा
verses.transliteration: dūtáṃ vo viśvávedasaṃ  havyavā́ham ámartyaṃ  yájiṣṭham r̥ñjase girā́

translation.text: YOUR envoy who possesses all, Immortal, bearer of your gifts, Best worshipper, I woo with song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि वेदा॒ वसु॑धितिं म॒हाँ आ॒रोध॑नं दि॒वः स दे॒वाँ एह व॑क्षति
verses.transliteration: sá hí védā vásudhitim  mahā́m̐ āródhanaṃ diváḥ  sá devā́m̐ éhá vakṣati

translation.text: He, Mighty, knows the gift of wealth, he knows the deep recess of heaven: He shall bring hitherward the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वे॑द दे॒व आ॒नमं॑ दे॒वाँ ऋ॑ताय॒ते दमे॑ दाति॑ प्रि॒याणि॑ चि॒द्वसु॑
verses.transliteration: sá veda devá ānámaṃ  devā́m̐ r̥tāyaté dáme  dā́ti priyā́ṇi cid vásu

translation.text: He knows, a God himself, to guide Gods to the righteous in his home: He gives e'en treasures that we love.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स होता॒ सेदु॑ दू॒त्यं॑ चिकि॒त्वाँ अ॒न्तरी॑यते वि॒द्वाँ आ॒रोध॑नं दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: sá hótā séd u dūtyàṃ  cikitvā́m̐ antár īyate  vidvā́m̐ āródhanaṃ diváḥ

translation.text: He is the Herald: well-informed, he doth his errand to and fro, Knowing the deep recess of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते स्या॑म॒ ये अ॒ग्नये॑ ददा॒शुर्ह॒व्यदा॑तिभिः य ईं॒ पुष्य॑न्त इन्ध॒ते
verses.transliteration: té syāma yé agnáye  dadāśúr havyádātibhiḥ  yá īm púṣyanta indhaté

translation.text: May we be they who gratify Agni with sacrificial gifts, Whocherish and enkindle him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते रा॒या ते सु॒वीर्यैः॑ सस॒वांसो॒ वि शृ॑ण्विरे ये अ॒ग्ना द॑धि॒रे दुवः॑
verses.transliteration: té rāyā́ té suvī́ryaiḥ  sasavā́ṃso ví śr̥ṇvire  yé agnā́ dadhiré dúvaḥ

translation.text: Illustrious for wealth are they, and hero deeds, victorious, Who have served Agni reverently.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे रायो॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ सं च॑रन्तु पुरु॒स्पृहः॑ अ॒स्मे वाजा॑स ईरताम्
verses.transliteration: asmé rā́yo divé-dive  sáṃ carantu puruspŕ̥haḥ  asmé vā́jāsa īratām

translation.text: So unto us, day after day, may riches craved by many come, And power and might spring up for us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स विप्र॑श्चर्षणी॒नां शव॑सा॒ मानु॑षाणाम् अति॑ क्षि॒प्रेव॑ विध्यति
verses.transliteration: sá vípraś carṣaṇīnā́ṃ  śávasā mā́nuṣāṇām  áti kṣipréva vidhyati

translation.text: That holy Singer in his strength shoots forth his arrows swifter than The swift shafts of the tribes of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ मृ॒ळ म॒हाँ अ॑सि॒ य ई॒मा दे॑व॒युं जन॑म् इ॒येथ॑ ब॒र्हिरा॒सद॑म्
verses.transliteration: ágne mr̥ḷá mahā́m̐ asi  yá īm ā́ devayúṃ jánam  iyétha barhír āsádam

translation.text: AGNI, show favour: great art thou who to this pious man art come, To seat thee on the sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स मानु॑षीषु दू॒ळभो॑ वि॒क्षु प्रा॒वीरम॑र्त्यः दू॒तो विश्वे॑षां भुवत्
verses.transliteration: sá mā́nuṣīṣu dūḷábho  vikṣú prāvī́r ámartyaḥ  dūtó víśveṣām bhuvat

translation.text: May he the Immortal, Helper, bard to be deceived among mankind, Become the messenger of all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सद्म॒ परि॑ णीयते॒ होता॑ म॒न्द्रो दिवि॑ष्टिषु उ॒त पोता॒ नि षी॑दति
verses.transliteration: sá sádma pári ṇīyate  hótā mandró díviṣṭiṣu  utá pótā ní ṣīdati

translation.text: Around the altar is he led, welcome Chief Priest at solemn rites, Or as the Potar sits him down.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त ग्ना अ॒ग्निर॑ध्व॒र उ॒तो गृ॒हप॑ति॒र्दमे॑ उ॒त ब्र॒ह्मा नि षी॑दति
verses.transliteration: utá gnā́ agnír adhvaré-  utó gr̥hápatir dáme  utá brahmā́ ní ṣīdati

translation.text: Agni in fire at sacrifice, and in the house as Lord thereof, And as a Brahman takes his seat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वेषि॒ ह्य॑ध्वरीय॒तामु॑पव॒क्ता जना॑नाम् ह॒व्या च॒ मानु॑षाणाम्
verses.transliteration: véṣi hy àdhvarīyatā́m  upavaktā́ jánānām  havyā́ ca mā́nuṣāṇām

translation.text: Thou comest as the guide of folk who celebrate a sacrifice, And to oblations brought by men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वेषीद्व॑स्य दू॒त्यं१॒॑ यस्य॒ जुजो॑षो अध्व॒रम् ह॒व्यं मर्त॑स्य॒ वोळ्ह॑वे
verses.transliteration: véṣī́d v asya dūtyàṃ  yásya jújoṣo adhvarám  havyám mártasya vóḷhave

translation.text: Thou servest as his messenger whose sacrifice thou lovest well, To bear the mortal's gifts to heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माकं॑ जोष्यध्व॒रम॒स्माकं॑ य॒ज्ञम॑ङ्गिरः अ॒स्माकं॑ शृणुधी॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: asmā́kaṃ joṣy adhvarám  asmā́kaṃ yajñám aṅgiraḥ  asmā́kaṃ śr̥ṇudhī hávam

translation.text: Accept our solemn rite; be pleased, Angiras, with our sacrifice: Give ear and listen to our call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ ते दू॒ळभो॒ रथो॒ऽस्माँ अ॑श्नोतु वि॒श्वतः॑ येन॒ रक्ष॑सि दा॒शुषः॑
verses.transliteration: pári te dūḷábho rátho  -asmā́m̐ aśnotu viśvátaḥ  yéna rákṣasi dāśúṣaḥ

translation.text: May thine inviolable car, wherewith thou guardest those who give, Come near to us from every side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ तम॒द्याश्वं॒ न स्तोमैः॒ क्रतुं॒ न भ॒द्रं हृ॑दि॒स्पृश॑म् ऋ॒ध्यामा॑ त॒ ओहैः॑
verses.transliteration: ágne tám adyá-  -áśvaṃ ná stómaiḥ  krátuṃ ná bhadráṃ  hr̥dispŕ̥śam r̥dhyā́mā ta óhaiḥ

translation.text: This day with praises, Agni, we bring thee that which thou lovest. Right judgment, like a horse, with our devotions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॒ ह्य॑ग्ने॒ क्रतो॑र्भ॒द्रस्य॒ दक्ष॑स्य सा॒धोः र॒थीर्ऋ॒तस्य॑ बृह॒तो ब॒भूथ॑
verses.transliteration: ádhā hy àgne  krátor bhadrásya  dákṣasya sādhóḥ  rathī́r r̥tásya br̥ható babhū́tha

translation.text: For thou hast ever been the Car-driver, Agni, of noble Strength, lofty sacrifice, and rightful judgment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒भिर्नो॑ अ॒र्कैर्भवा॑ नो अ॒र्वाङ्स्व१॒॑र्ण ज्योतिः॑ अग्ने॒ विश्वे॑भिः सु॒मना॒ अनी॑कैः
verses.transliteration: ebhír no arkaír  bhávā no arvā́ṅ  svàr ṇá jyótiḥ  ágne víśvebhiḥ sumánā ánīkaiḥ

translation.text: Through these our praises come thou to meet us, bright as the sunlight, O Agni, well disposed, with all thine aspects.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒भिष्टे॑ अ॒द्य गी॒र्भिर्गृ॒णन्तोऽग्ने॒ दाशे॑म प्र ते॑ दि॒वो न स्त॑नयन्ति॒ शुष्माः॑
verses.transliteration: ābhíṣ ṭe adyá  gīrbhír gr̥ṇántaḥ-  -ágne dā́śema  prá te divó ná stanayanti śúṣmāḥ

translation.text: Now may we serve thee singing these lauds this day to thee, Agni. Loud as the voice of Heaven thy blasts are roaring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॒ स्वादि॒ष्ठाग्ने॒ संदृ॑ष्टिरि॒दा चि॒दह्न॑ इ॒दा चि॑द॒क्तोः श्रि॒ये रु॒क्मो न रो॑चत उपा॒के
verses.transliteration: táva svā́diṣṭhā-  -ágne sáṃdr̥ṣṭir  idā́ cid áhnaḥ-  idā́ cid aktóḥ  śriyé rukmó ná rocata upāké

translation.text: just at this time of the day and the night thy look is the sweetest . It shineth near us even as gold for glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृ॒तं न पू॒तं त॒नूर॑रे॒पाः शुचि॒ हिर॑ण्यम् तत्ते॑ रु॒क्मो न रो॑चत स्वधावः
verses.transliteration: ghr̥táṃ ná pūtáṃ  tanū́r arepā́ḥ  śúci híraṇyam  tát te rukmó ná rocata svadhāvaḥ

translation.text: Spotless thy body, brilliant as gold, like clarified butter: This gleams like gold on thee, O Self. dependent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒तं चि॒द्धि ष्मा॒ सने॑मि॒ द्वेषोऽग्न॑ इ॒नोषि॒ मर्ता॑त् इ॒त्था यज॑मानादृतावः
verses.transliteration: kr̥táṃ cid dhí ṣmā  sánemi dvéṣaḥ-  -ágna inóṣi  mártāt itthā́ yájamānād r̥tāvaḥ

translation.text: All hate and mischief, yea, if committed, Agni, thou turnest, Holy One, from the man who rightly worships.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शि॒वा नः॑ स॒ख्या सन्तु॑ भ्रा॒त्राग्ने॑ दे॒वेषु॑ यु॒ष्मे सा नो॒ नाभिः॒ सद॑ने॒ सस्मि॒न्नूध॑न्
verses.transliteration: śivā́ naḥ sakhyā́  sántu bhrātrā́gne  devéṣu yuṣmé  sā́ no nā́bhiḥ sádane sásminn ū́dhan

translation.text: Agni, with you Gods, prosperous be our friendships and kinships. Be this our bond here by this place, thine al tar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रं ते॑ अग्ने सहसि॒न्ननी॑कमुपा॒क आ रो॑चते॒ सूर्य॑स्य रुश॑द्दृ॒शे द॑दृशे नक्त॒या चि॒दरू॑क्षितं दृ॒श आ रू॒पे अन्न॑म्
verses.transliteration: bhadráṃ te agne sahasinn ánīkam  upāká ā́ rocate sū́ryasya  rúśad dr̥śé dadr̥śe naktayā́ cid  árūkṣitaṃ dr̥śá ā́ rūpé ánnam

translation.text: THY blessed majesty, victorious Agni, shines brightly in the neighbourhood of Sûrya. Splendid to see, it shows even at nighttime, and food is fair to look on in thy beauty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि षा॑ह्यग्ने गृण॒ते म॑नी॒षां खं वेप॑सा तुविजात॒ स्तवा॑नः विश्वे॑भि॒र्यद्वा॒वनः॑ शुक्र दे॒वैस्तन्नो॑ रास्व सुमहो॒ भूरि॒ मन्म॑
verses.transliteration: ví ṣāhy agne gr̥ṇaté manīṣā́ṃ  kháṃ vépasā tuvijāta stávānaḥ  víśvebhir yád vāvánaḥ śukra devaís  tán no rāsva sumaho bhū́ri mánma

translation.text: Agni, disclose his thought for him who singeth, the well, Strong God! while thou art praised with fervour. Vouchsafe to us that powerful hymn, O Mighty, which, Radiant One! with all the Gods thou lovest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वद॑ग्ने॒ काव्या॒ त्वन्म॑नी॒षास्त्वदु॒क्था जा॑यन्ते॒ राध्या॑नि त्वदे॑ति॒ द्रवि॑णं वी॒रपे॑शा इ॒त्थाधि॑ये दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य
verses.transliteration: tvád agne kā́vyā tván manīṣā́s  tvád ukthā́ jāyante rā́dhyāni  tvád eti dráviṇaṃ vīrápeśāḥ-  itthā́dhiye dāśúṣe mártyāya

translation.text: From thee, O Agni, springs poetic wisdom, from thee come thoughts and hymns of praise that prosper; From thee flows wealth, with heroes to adorn it, to the true-hearted man who gives oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वद्वा॒जी वा॑जम्भ॒रो विहा॑या अभिष्टि॒कृज्जा॑यते स॒त्यशु॑ष्मः त्वद्र॒यिर्दे॒वजू॑तो मयो॒भुस्त्वदा॒शुर्जू॑जु॒वाँ अ॑ग्ने॒ अर्वा॑
verses.transliteration: tvád vājī́ vājambharó víhāyāḥ-  abhiṣṭikŕ̥j jāyate satyáśuṣmaḥ  tvád rayír devájūto mayobhús  tvád āśúr jūjuvā́m̐ agne árvā

translation.text: From thee the hero springs who wins the booty, bringer of help, mighty, of real courage. From thee comes wealth, sent by the Gods, bliss-giving; Agni, from thee the fleet impetuous charger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वाम॑ग्ने प्रथ॒मं दे॑व॒यन्तो॑ दे॒वं मर्ता॑ अमृत म॒न्द्रजि॑ह्वम् द्वे॒षो॒युत॒मा वि॑वासन्ति धी॒भिर्दमू॑नसं गृ॒हप॑ति॒ममू॑रम्
verses.transliteration: tvā́m agne prathamáṃ devayánto  devám mártā amr̥ta mandrájihvam  dveṣoyútam ā́ vivāsanti dhībhír  dámūnasaṃ gr̥hápatim ámūram

translation.text: Immortal Agni, thee whose voice is pleasant, as first in rank, as God, religious mortals Invite with hyrnns; thee who removest hatred, Friend of the Home, the household's Lord, unerring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒रे अ॒स्मदम॑तिमा॒रे अंह॑ आ॒रे विश्वां॑ दुर्म॒तिं यन्नि॒पासि॑ दो॒षा शि॒वः स॑हसः सूनो अग्ने॒ यं दे॒व आ चि॒त्सच॑से स्व॒स्ति
verses.transliteration: āré asmád ámatim āré áṃhaḥ-  āré víśvāṃ durmatíṃ yán nipā́si  doṣā́ śiváḥ sahasaḥ sūno agne  yáṃ devá ā́ cit sácase svastí

translation.text: Far from us thou removest want and sorrow, far from us all ill-will when thou protectest. Son of Strength, Agni, blest is he at evening, whom thou as God attendest for his welfare.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त्वाम॑ग्न इ॒नध॑ते य॒तस्रु॒क्त्रिस्ते॒ अन्नं॑ कृ॒णव॒त्सस्मि॒न्नह॑न् स सु द्यु॒म्नैर॒भ्य॑स्तु प्र॒सक्ष॒त्तव॒ क्रत्वा॑ जातवेदश्चिकि॒त्वान्
verses.transliteration: yás tvā́m agna inádhate yatásruk  trís te ánnaṃ kr̥ṇávat sásminn áhan  sá sú dyumnaír abhy àstu prasákṣat  táva krátvā jātavedaś cikitvā́n

translation.text: WHOSO enkindles thee, with lifted ladle, and thrice this day offers thee food, O Agni, May he excel, triumphant through thy splendours, wise through thy mental power, O Jâtavedas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ध्मं यस्ते॑ ज॒भर॑च्छश्रमा॒णो म॒हो अ॑ग्ने॒ अनी॑क॒मा स॑प॒र्यन् स इ॑धा॒नः प्रति॑ दो॒षामु॒षासं॒ पुष्य॑न्र॒यिं स॑चते॒ घ्नन्न॒मित्रा॑न्
verses.transliteration: idhmáṃ yás te jabhárac chaśramāṇó  mahó agne ánīkam ā́ saparyán  sá idhānáḥ práti doṣā́m uṣā́sam  púṣyan rayíṃ sacate ghnánn amítrān

translation.text: Whoso with toil and trouble brings thee fuel, serving the majesty of mighty Agni, He, kindling thee at evening and at morning, prospers, and comes to wealth, and slays his foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निरी॑शे बृह॒तः क्ष॒त्रिय॑स्या॒ग्निर्वाज॑स्य पर॒मस्य॑ रा॒यः दधा॑ति॒ रत्नं॑ विध॒ते यवि॑ष्ठो॒ व्या॑नु॒षङ्मर्त्या॑य स्व॒धावा॑न्
verses.transliteration: agnír īśe br̥hatáḥ kṣatríyasya-  -agnír vā́jasya paramásya rāyáḥ  dádhāti rátnaṃ vidhaté yáviṣṭho  vy ā̀nuṣáṅ mártyāya svadhā́vān

translation.text: Agni is Master of sublime dominion, Agni is Lord of strength and lofty riches. Straightway the self-reliant God, Most Youthful, gives treasures to the mortal who adores him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यच्चि॒द्धि ते॑ पुरुष॒त्रा य॑वि॒ष्ठाचि॑त्तिभिश्चकृ॒मा कच्चि॒दागः॑ कृ॒धी ष्व१॒॑स्माँ अदि॑ते॒रना॑गा॒न्व्येनां॑सि शिश्रथो॒ विष्व॑गग्ने
verses.transliteration: yác cid dhí te puruṣatrā́ yaviṣṭha-  -ácittibhiś cakr̥mā́ kác cid ā́gaḥ  kr̥dhī́ ṣv àsmā́m̐ áditer ánāgān  vy énāṃsi śiśratho víṣvag agne

translation.text: Most Youthful God, whatever sin, through folly, we here, as human beings, have committed, In sight of Aditi make thou us sinless remit, entirely, Agni, our offences.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हश्चि॑दग्न॒ एन॑सो अ॒भीक॑ ऊ॒र्वाद्दे॒वाना॑मु॒त मर्त्या॑नाम् मा ते॒ सखा॑यः॒ सद॒मिद्रि॑षाम॒ यच्छा॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय॒ शं योः
verses.transliteration: maháś cid agna énaso abhī́ke-  ūrvā́d devā́nām utá mártyānām  mā́ te sákhāyaḥ sádam íd riṣāma  yáchā tokā́ya tánayāya śáṃ yóḥ

translation.text: Even in the presence of great sin, O Agni, free us from prison of the Gods or mortals. Never may we who are thy friends be injured: grant health and strength unto our seed and offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ ह॒ त्यद्व॑सवो गौ॒र्यं॑ चित्प॒दि षि॒ताममु॑ञ्चता यजत्राः ए॒वो ष्व१॒॑स्मन्मु॑ञ्चता॒ व्यंहः॒ प्र ता॑र्यग्ने प्रत॒रं न॒ आयुः॑
verses.transliteration: yáthā ha tyád vasavo gauryàṃ cit  padí ṣitā́m ámuñcatā yajatrāḥ  evó ṣv àsmán muñcatā vy áṃhaḥ  prá tāry agne prataráṃ na ā́yuḥ

translation.text: Even as ye here, Gods Excellent and Holy, have loosed the cow that by the foot was tethered, So also set us free from this affliction long let our life, O Agni, be extended.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रत्य॒ग्निरु॒षसा॒मग्र॑मख्यद्विभाती॒नां सु॒मना॑ रत्न॒धेय॑म् या॒तम॑श्विना सु॒कृतो॑ दुरो॒णमुत्सूर्यो॒ ज्योति॑षा दे॒व ए॑ति
verses.transliteration: práty agnír uṣásām ágram akhyad  vibhātīnā́ṃ sumánā ratnadhéyam  yātám aśvinā sukŕ̥to duroṇám  út sū́ryo jyótiṣā devá eti

translation.text: AGNI hath looked, benevolently-minded, on the wealth-giving spring of radiant Mornings. Come, Aṣvins, to the dwelling of the pious: Sûrya the God is rising with his splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वं भा॒नुं स॑वि॒ता दे॒वो अ॑श्रेद्द्र॒प्सं दवि॑ध्वद्गवि॒षो न सत्वा॑ अनु॑ व्र॒तं वरु॑णो यन्ति मि॒त्रो यत्सूर्यं॑ दि॒व्या॑रो॒हय॑न्ति
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvám bhānúṃ savitā́ devó aśred  drapsáṃ dávidhvad gaviṣó ná sátvā  ánu vratáṃ váruṇo yanti mitró  yát sū́ryaṃ divy ā̀roháyanti

translation.text: Savitar, God, hath spread on high his lustre, waving his flag like a spoil-seeking hero. Their stablished way go Varuṇa and Mitra, what time they make the Sun ascend the heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं सी॒मकृ॑ण्व॒न्तम॑से वि॒पृचे॑ ध्रु॒वक्षे॑मा॒ अन॑वस्यन्तो॒ अर्थ॑म् तं सूर्यं॑ ह॒रितः॑ स॒प्त य॒ह्वीः स्पशं॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ जग॑तो वहन्ति
verses.transliteration: yáṃ sīm ákr̥ṇvan támase vipŕ̥ce  dhruvákṣemā ánavasyanto ártham  táṃ sū́ryaṃ harítaḥ saptá yahvī́ḥ-  spáśaṃ víśvasya jágato vahanti

translation.text: Him whom they made to drive away the darkness, Lords of sure mansions, constant to their object, Him who beholds the universe, the Sun-God, seven strong and youthful Coursers carry onward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वहि॑ष्ठेभिर्वि॒हर॑न्यासि॒ तन्तु॑मव॒व्यय॒न्नसि॑तं देव॒ वस्म॑ दवि॑ध्वतो र॒श्मयः॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ चर्मे॒वावा॑धु॒स्तमो॑ अ॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तः
verses.transliteration: váhiṣṭhebhir viháran yāsi tántum  avavyáyann ásitaṃ deva vásma  dávidhvato raśmáyaḥ sū́ryasya  cármevā́vādhus támo apsv àntáḥ

translation.text: Spreading thy web with mightiest Steeds thou comest, rending apart, thou God, the black-hued mantle. The rays of Sûrya tremulously shining sink, like a hide, the darkness in the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अना॑यतो॒ अनि॑बद्धः क॒थायं न्य॑ङ्ङुत्ता॒नोऽव॑ पद्यते॒ न कया॑ याति स्व॒धया॒ को द॑दर्श दि॒वः स्क॒म्भः समृ॑तः पाति॒ नाक॑म्
verses.transliteration: ánāyato ánibaddhaḥ kathā́yáṃ  nyàṅṅ uttānó 'va padyate ná  káyā yāti svadháyā kó dadarśa  divá skambháḥ sámr̥taḥ pāti nā́kam

translation.text: How is it that, unbound and not supported, he falleth not although directed downward? By what self power moves he? Who liath seen it? He guards the vault of heaven, a close-set pillar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रत्य॒ग्निरु॒षसो॑ जा॒तवे॑दा॒ अख्य॑द्दे॒वो रोच॑माना॒ महो॑भिः आ ना॑सत्योरुगा॒या रथे॑ने॒मं य॒ज्ञमुप॑ नो यात॒मच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: práty agnír uṣáso jātávedāḥ-  ákhyad devó rócamānā máhobhiḥ  ā́ nāsatyorugāyā́ ráthena-  -imáṃ yajñám úpa no yātam ácha

translation.text: THE God hath looked, even Agni Jâtavedas, to meet the Dawns refulgent in their glories. Come on your chariot, ye who travel widely, come to this sacrifice of ours, Nâsatyas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वं के॒तुं स॑वि॒ता दे॒वो अ॑श्रे॒ज्ज्योति॒र्विश्व॑स्मै॒ भुव॑नाय कृ॒ण्वन् आप्रा॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षं॒ वि सूर्यो॑ र॒श्मिभि॒श्चेकि॑तानः
verses.transliteration: ūrdhváṃ ketúṃ savitā́ devó aśrej  jyótir víśvasmai bhúvanāya kr̥ṇván  ā́prā dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ antárikṣaṃ  ví sū́ryo raśmíbhiś cékitānaḥ

translation.text: Producing light for all the world of creatures, God Savitar hath raised aloft his banner. Making his presence known by sunbeams, Sûrya hath filled the firmament and earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒वह॑न्त्यरु॒णीर्ज्योति॒षागा॑न्म॒ही चि॒त्रा र॒श्मिभि॒श्चेकि॑ताना प्र॒बो॒धय॑न्ती सुवि॒ताय॑ दे॒व्यु१॒॑षा ई॑यते सु॒युजा॒ रथे॑न
verses.transliteration: āváhanty aruṇī́r jyótiṣā́gāt-  mahī́ citrā́ raśmíbhiś cékitānā  prabodháyantī suvitā́ya devī́-  -uṣā́ īyate suyújā ráthena

translation.text: Red Dawn.is come, riding with brightness onward, distinguished by her beams, gay-hued and mighty. Dawn on her nobly-harnessed car, the Goddess, awaking men to happiness, approacheth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ वहि॑ष्ठा इ॒ह ते व॑हन्तु॒ रथा॒ अश्वा॑स उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ इ॒मे हि वां॑ मधु॒पेया॑य॒ सोमा॑ अ॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे वृ॑षणा मादयेथाम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ váhiṣṭhā ihá té vahantu  ráthā áśvāsa uṣáso vyùṣṭau  imé hí vām madhupéyāya sómāḥ-  asmín yajñé vr̥ṣaṇā mādayethām

translation.text: May those most powerful steeds and chariot bring you, O Aṣvins, hither at the break of morning. Here for your drauglit of meath are Soma juices: at this our sacrifice rejoice, ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अना॑यतो॒ अनि॑बद्धः क॒थायं न्य॑ङ्ङुत्ता॒नोऽव॑ पद्यते॒ न कया॑ याति स्व॒धया॒ को द॑दर्श दि॒वः स्क॒म्भः समृ॑तः पाति॒ नाक॑म्
verses.transliteration: ánāyato ánibaddhaḥ kathā́yáṃ  nyàṅṅ uttānó 'va padyate ná  káyā yāti svadháyā kó dadarśa  divá skambháḥ sámr̥taḥ pāti nā́kam

translation.text: How is it that, unbound and unsupported, he falleth not although directed downward? By what self-power moves he? Who hath seen it? He guards the vault of heaven, a close-set pillar?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्होता॑ नो अध्व॒रे वा॒जी सन्परि॑ णीयते दे॒वो दे॒वेषु॑ य॒ज्ञियः॑
verses.transliteration: agnír hótā no adhvaré  vājī́ sán pári ṇīyate  devó devéṣu yajñíyaḥ

translation.text: AGNI the Herald, like a horse, is led forth at our solemn rite, God among Gods adorable.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ त्रिवि॒ष्ट्य॑ध्व॒रं यात्य॒ग्नी र॒थीरि॑व आ दे॒वेषु॒ प्रयो॒ दध॑त्
verses.transliteration: pári triviṣṭy àdhvaráṃ  yā́ty agnī́ rathī́r iva  ā́ devéṣu práyo dádhat

translation.text: Three times unto our solemn rite comes Agni like a charioteer, Bearing the viands to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ वाज॑पतिः क॒विर॒ग्निर्ह॒व्यान्य॑क्रमीत् दध॒द्रत्ना॑नि दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: pári vā́japatiḥ kavír  agnír havyā́ny akramīt  dádhad rátnāni dāśúṣe

translation.text: Round the oblations hath he paced, Agni the Wise, the Lord of Strength, Giving the offerer precious boons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं यः सृञ्ज॑ये पु॒रो दै॑ववा॒ते स॑मि॒ध्यते॑ द्यु॒माँ अ॑मित्र॒दम्भ॑नः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ yáḥ sŕ̥ñjaye puró  daivavāté samidhyáte  dyumā́m̐ amitradámbhanaḥ

translation.text: He who is kindled eastward for Sr̥injaya, Devavâta's son, Resplendent, tamer of the foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्य॑ घा वी॒र ईव॑तो॒ऽग्नेरी॑शीत॒ मर्त्यः॑ ति॒ग्मज॑म्भस्य मी॒ळ्हुषः॑
verses.transliteration: ásya ghā vīrá ī́vato  -agnér īśīta mártyaḥ  tigmájambhasya mīḷhúṣaḥ

translation.text: So mighty be the Agni whom the mortal hero shall command, With sharpened teeth and bountiful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमर्व॑न्तं॒ न सा॑न॒सिम॑रु॒षं न दि॒वः शिशु॑म् म॒र्मृ॒ज्यन्ते॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे
verses.transliteration: tám árvantaṃ ná sānasím  aruṣáṃ ná diváḥ śíśum  marmr̥jyánte divé-dive

translation.text: Day after day they dress him, as they clean a horse who wins the prize. Dress the red Scion of the Sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बोध॒द्यन्मा॒ हरि॑भ्यां कुमा॒रः सा॑हदे॒व्यः अच्छा॒ न हू॒त उद॑रम्
verses.transliteration: bódhad yán mā háribhyāṃ  kumāráḥ sāhadevyáḥ  áchā ná hūtá úd aram

translation.text: When Sahadeva's princely son with two bay horses thought of me, Summoned by him I drew not back.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्या य॑ज॒ता हरी॑ कुमा॒रात्सा॑हदे॒व्यात् प्रय॑ता स॒द्य आ द॑दे
verses.transliteration: utá tyā́ yajatā́ hárī  kumārā́t sāhadevyā́t  práyatā sadyá ā́ dade

translation.text: And truly those two noble bays I straightway took when offered me, From Sahadeva's princely son.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष वां॑ देवावश्विना कुमा॒रः सा॑हदे॒व्यः दी॒र्घायु॑रस्तु॒ सोम॑कः
verses.transliteration: eṣá vāṃ devāv aśvinā  kumāráḥ sāhadevyáḥ  dīrghā́yur astu sómakaḥ

translation.text: Long, O ye Aṣvins, may he live, your care, ye Gods, the princely son. Of Sahadeva, Somaka.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं यु॒वं दे॑वावश्विना कुमा॒रं सा॑हदे॒व्यम् दी॒र्घायु॑षं कृणोतन
verses.transliteration: táṃ yuváṃ devāv aśvinā  kumāráṃ sāhadevyám  dīrghā́yuṣaṃ kr̥ṇotana

translation.text: Cause him the youthful prince, the son of Sahadeva, to enjoy Long life, O Aṣvins, O ye Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ स॒त्यो या॑तु म॒घवाँ॑ ऋजी॒षी द्रव॑न्त्वस्य॒ हर॑य॒ उप॑ नः तस्मा॒ इदन्धः॑ सुषुमा सु॒दक्ष॑मि॒हाभि॑पि॒त्वं क॑रते गृणा॒नः
verses.transliteration: ā́ satyó yātu maghávām̐ r̥jīṣī́  drávantv asya háraya úpa naḥ  tásmā íd ándhaḥ suṣumā sudákṣam  ihā́bhipitváṃ karate gr̥ṇānáḥ

translation.text: IMPETUOUS, true, let Maghavan come hither, and let his Tawny Coursers speed to reach us. For him have we pressed juice exceeding potent: here, praised with song, let him effect his visit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑ स्य शू॒राध्व॑नो॒ नान्ते॒ऽस्मिन्नो॑ अ॒द्य सव॑ने म॒न्दध्यै॑ शंसा॑त्यु॒क्थमु॒शने॑व वे॒धाश्चि॑कि॒तुषे॑ असु॒र्या॑य॒ मन्म॑
verses.transliteration: áva sya śūrā́dhvano nā́nte  -asmín no adyá sávane mandádhyai  śáṃsāty ukthám uśáneva vedhā́ś  cikitúṣe asuryā̀ya mánma

translation.text: Unyoke, as at thy journey's end, O Hero, to gladden thee today at this libation. Like Uṣanâ, the priest a laud shall utter, a hymn to thee, the Lord Divine, who markest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒विर्न नि॒ण्यं वि॒दथा॑नि॒ साध॒न्वृषा॒ यत्सेकं॑ विपिपा॒नो अर्चा॑त् दि॒व इ॒त्था जी॑जनत्स॒प्त का॒रूनह्ना॑ चिच्चक्रुर्व॒युना॑ गृ॒णन्तः॑
verses.transliteration: kavír ná niṇyáṃ vidáthāni sā́dhan  vŕ̥ṣā yát sékaṃ vipipānó árcāt  divá itthā́ jījanat saptá kārū́n  áhnā cic cakrur vayúnā gr̥ṇántaḥ

translation.text: When the Bull, quaffing, praises our Iibation, as a sage paying holy rites in secret, Seven singers here from heaven hath he begotten, who e'en by day have wrought their works while singing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व१॒॑र्यद्वेदि॑ सु॒दृशी॑कम॒र्कैर्महि॒ ज्योती॑ रुरुचु॒र्यद्ध॒ वस्तोः॑ अ॒न्धा तमां॑सि॒ दुधि॑ता वि॒चक्षे॒ नृभ्य॑श्चकार॒ नृत॑मो अ॒भिष्टौ॑
verses.transliteration: svàr yád védi sudŕ̥śīkam arkaír  máhi jyótī rurucur yád dha vástoḥ  andhā́ támāṃsi dúdhitā vicákṣe  nŕ̥bhyaś cakāra nŕ̥tamo abhíṣṭau

translation.text: When heaven's fair light by hymns was made apparent (they made great splendour shine at break of morning), He with his succour, best of Heroes, scattered the blinding darkness so that men saw clearly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒व॒क्ष इन्द्रो॒ अमि॑तमृजी॒ष्यु१॒॑भे आ प॑प्रौ॒ रोद॑सी महि॒त्वा अत॑श्चिदस्य महि॒मा वि रे॑च्य॒भि यो विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना ब॒भूव॑
verses.transliteration: vavakṣá índro ámitam r̥jīṣī́-  ubhé ā́ paprau ródasī mahitvā́  átaś cid asya mahimā́ ví reci-  abhí yó víśvā bhúvanā babhū́va

translation.text: Indra, Impetuous One, hath waxed immensely: he with his vastness hath filled earth and heaven. E'en beyond this his majesty extendeth who hath exceeded all the worlds in greatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑नि श॒क्रो नर्या॑णि वि॒द्वान॒पो रि॑रेच॒ सखि॑भि॒र्निका॑मैः अश्मा॑नं चि॒द्ये बि॑भि॒दुर्वचो॑भिर्व्र॒जं गोम॑न्तमु॒शिजो॒ वि व॑व्रुः
verses.transliteration: víśvāni śakró náryāṇi vidvā́n  apó rireca sákhibhir níkāmaiḥ  áśmānaṃ cid yé bibhidúr vácobhir  vrajáṃ gómantam uśíjo ví vavruḥ

translation.text: Ṣakra who knoweth well all human actions hath with his eager Friends let loose the waters. They with their songs cleft e'en the mountain open and willingly disclosed the stall of cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पो वृ॒त्रं व॑व्रि॒वांसं॒ परा॑ह॒न्प्राव॑त्ते॒ वज्रं॑ पृथि॒वी सचे॑ताः प्रार्णां॑सि समु॒द्रिया॑ण्यैनोः॒ पति॒र्भव॒ञ्छव॑सा शूर धृष्णो
verses.transliteration: apó vr̥tráṃ vavrivā́ṃsam párāhan  prā́vat te vájram pr̥thivī́ sácetāḥ  prā́rṇāṃsi samudríyāṇy ainoḥ  pátir bhávañ chávasā śūra dhr̥ṣṇo

translation.text: He smote away the floods' obstructer, Vr̥itra; Earth, conscious, lent her aid to speed thy thunder. Thou sentest forth the waters of the ocean, as Lord through power and might, O daring Hero.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पो यदद्रिं॑ पुरुहूत॒ दर्द॑रा॒विर्भु॑वत्स॒रमा॑ पू॒र्व्यं ते॑ स नो॑ ने॒ता वाज॒मा द॑र्षि॒ भूरिं॑ गो॒त्रा रु॒जन्नङ्गि॑रोभिर्गृणा॒नः
verses.transliteration: apó yád ádrim puruhūta dárdar  āvír bhuvat sarámā pūrvyáṃ te  sá no netā́ vā́jam ā́ darṣi bhū́riṃ  gotrā́ rujánn áṅgirobhir gr̥ṇānáḥ

translation.text: When, Much-invoked! the water's rock thou cleftest, Saramâ showed herself and went before thee. Hymned by Angirases, bursting the cowstalls, much strength thou foundest for us as our leader.
