verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भी षु णः॒ सखी॑नामवि॒ता ज॑रितॄ॒णाम् श॒तं भ॑वास्यू॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: abhī́ ṣú ṇaḥ sákhīnām  avitā́ jaritr̥̄ṇā́m  śatám bhavāsy ūtíbhiḥ

translation.text: Do thou who art Protector of us thy friends who praise thee With hundred aids approach us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भी न॒ आ व॑वृत्स्व च॒क्रं न वृ॒त्तमर्व॑तः नि॒युद्भि॑श्चर्षणी॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: abhī́ na ā́ vavr̥tsva  cakráṃ ná vr̥ttám árvataḥ  niyúdbhiś carṣaṇīnā́m

translation.text: Like as a courser's circling wheel, so turn thee hitherward to us, Attracted by the hymns of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒वता॒ हि क्रतू॑ना॒मा हा॑ प॒देव॒ गच्छ॑सि अभ॑क्षि॒ सूर्ये॒ सचा॑
verses.transliteration: pravátā hí krátūnām  ā́ hā padéva gáchasi  ábhakṣi sū́rye sácā

translation.text: Thou seekest as it were thine own stations with swift descent of powers: I share thee even with the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं यत्त॑ इन्द्र म॒न्यवः॒ सं च॒क्राणि॑ दधन्वि॒रे अध॒ त्वे अध॒ सूर्ये॑
verses.transliteration: sáṃ yát ta indra manyávaḥ  sáṃ cakrā́ṇi dadhanviré  ádha tvé ádha sū́rye

translation.text: What time thy courage and his wheels together, Indra, run their course With thee and with the Sun alike,

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्मा॒ हि त्वामा॒हुरिन्म॒घवा॑नं शचीपते दाता॑र॒मवि॑दीधयुम्
verses.transliteration: utá smā hí tvā́m āhúr ín  maghávānaṃ śacīpate  dā́tāram ávidīdhayum

translation.text: So even, Lord of Power and Might, the people call thee Maghavan, Giver, who pauses not to think.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्मा॑ स॒द्य इत्परि॑ शशमा॒नाय॑ सुन्व॒ते पु॒रू चि॑न्मंहसे॒ वसु॑
verses.transliteration: utá smā sadyá ít pári  śaśamānā́ya sunvaté  purū́ cin maṃhase vásu

translation.text: And verily to him who toils and presses Soma juice for thee Thou quickly givest ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि ष्मा॑ ते श॒तं च॒न राधो॒ वर॑न्त आ॒मुरः॑ न च्यौ॒त्नानि॑ करिष्य॒तः
verses.transliteration: nahí ṣmā te śatáṃ caná  rā́dho váranta āmúraḥ  ná cyautnā́ni kariṣyatáḥ

translation.text: No, not a hundred hinderers can check thy gracious bounty's flow, Nor thy great deeds when thou wilt act.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माँ अ॑वन्तु ते श॒तम॒स्मान्त्स॒हस्र॑मू॒तयः॑ अ॒स्मान्विश्वा॑ अ॒भिष्ट॑यः
verses.transliteration: asmā́m̐ avantu te śatám  asmā́n sahásram ūtáyaḥ  asmā́n víśvā abhíṣṭayaḥ

translation.text: May thine assistance keep us safe, thy hundred and thy thousand aids: May all thy favours strengthen us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माँ इ॒हा वृ॑णीष्व स॒ख्याय॑ स्व॒स्तये॑ म॒हो रा॒ये दि॒वित्म॑ते
verses.transliteration: asmā́m̐ ihā́ vr̥ṇīṣva  sakhyā́ya svastáye  mahó rāyé divítmate

translation.text: Do thou elect us this place for friendship and prosperity, And great celestial opulence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माँ अ॑विड्ढि वि॒श्वहेन्द्र॑ रा॒या परी॑णसा अ॒स्मान्विश्वा॑भिरू॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: asmā́m̐ aviḍḍhi viśváhā-  -índra rāyā́ párīṇasā  asmā́n víśvābhir ūtíbhiḥ

translation.text: Favour us, Indra, evermore with overflowing store of wealth: With all thy succours aid thou us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ ताँ अपा॑ वृधि व्र॒जाँ अस्ते॑व॒ गोम॑तः नवा॑भिरिन्द्रो॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ tā́m̐ ápā vr̥dhi  vrajā́m̐ ásteva gómataḥ  návābhir indrotíbhiḥ

translation.text: With new protections, Indra, like an archer, open thou forus The stables that are filled with kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माकं॑ धृष्णु॒या रथो॑ द्यु॒माँ इ॒न्द्रान॑पच्युतः ग॒व्युर॑श्व॒युरी॑यते
verses.transliteration: asmā́kaṃ dhr̥ṣṇuyā́ rátho  dyumā́m̐ indrā́napacyutaḥ  gavyúr aśvayúr īyate

translation.text: Our chariot, Indra, boldly moves endued with splendour, ne'er repulsed, Winning for us both kine andsteeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माक॑मुत्त॒मं कृ॑धि॒ श्रवो॑ दे॒वेषु॑ सूर्य वर्षि॑ष्ठं॒ द्यामि॑वो॒परि॑
verses.transliteration: asmā́kam uttamáṃ kr̥dhi  śrávo devéṣu sūrya  várṣiṣṭhaṃ dyā́m ivopári

translation.text: O Sûrya, make our fame to be most excellent among the Gods, Most lofty as the heaven on high.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ तू न॑ इन्द्र वृत्रहन्न॒स्माक॑म॒र्धमा ग॑हि म॒हान्म॒हीभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ tū́ na indra vr̥trahann  asmā́kam ardhám ā́ gahi  mahā́n mahī́bhir ūtíbhiḥ

translation.text: O THOU who slewest Vr̥itra, come, O Indra, hither to our side, Mighty One with thy mighty aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भृमि॑श्चिद्घासि॒ तूतु॑जि॒रा चि॑त्र चि॒त्रिणी॒ष्वा चि॒त्रं कृ॑णोष्यू॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: bhŕ̥miś cid ghāsi tū́tujir  ā́ citra citríṇīṣv ā́  citráṃ kr̥ṇoṣy ūtáye

translation.text: Swift and impetuous art thou, wondrous amid the well-dressed folk: Thou doest marvels for our help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒भ्रेभि॑श्चि॒च्छशी॑यांसं॒ हंसि॒ व्राध॑न्त॒मोज॑सा सखि॑भि॒र्ये त्वे सचा॑
verses.transliteration: dabhrébhiś cic cháśīyāṃsaṃ  háṃsi vrā́dhantam ójasā  sákhibhir yé tvé sácā

translation.text: Even with the weak thou smitest down him who is stronger, with thy strength The mighty, with the Friends thou hast.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यमि॑न्द्र॒ त्वे सचा॑ व॒यं त्वा॒भि नो॑नुमः अ॒स्मा॑स्माँ॒ इदुद॑व
verses.transliteration: vayám indra tvé sácā  vayáṃ tvābhí nonumaḥ  asmā́m̐-asmām̐ íd úd ava

translation.text: O Indra, we are close to thee; to thee we sing aloud our songs: Help hnd defend us, even us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स न॑श्चि॒त्राभि॑रद्रिवोऽनव॒द्याभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ अना॑धृष्टाभि॒रा ग॑हि
verses.transliteration: sá naś citrā́bhir adrivo  -anavadyā́bhir ūtíbhiḥ  ánādhr̥ṣṭābhir ā́ gahi

translation.text: As such, O Caster of the Stone, come with thy succours wonderful, Blameless, and irresistible.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भू॒यामो॒ षु त्वाव॑तः॒ सखा॑य इन्द्र॒ गोम॑तः युजो॒ वाजा॑य॒ घृष्व॑ये
verses.transliteration: bhūyā́mo ṣú tvā́vataḥ  sákhāya indra gómataḥ  yújo vā́jāya ghŕ̥ṣvaye

translation.text: May we be friends of one like thee, O Indra, with the wealth of kine, Comrades for lively energy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ह्येक॒ ईशि॑ष॒ इन्द्र॒ वाज॑स्य॒ गोम॑तः स नो॑ यन्धि म॒हीमिष॑म्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ hy éka ī́śiṣe-  índra vā́jasya gómataḥ  sá no yandhi mahī́m íṣam

translation.text: For thou, O Indra, art alone the Lord of strength that comes from kine So grant thou us abundant food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न त्वा॑ वरन्ते अ॒न्यथा॒ यद्दित्स॑सि स्तु॒तो म॒घम् स्तो॒तृभ्य॑ इन्द्र गिर्वणः
verses.transliteration: ná tvā varante anyáthā  yád dítsasi stutó maghám  stotŕ̥bhya indra girvaṇaḥ

translation.text: They turn thee not another way, when, lauded, Lover of the Song, Thou wilt give wealth to those who praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्वा॒ गोत॑मा गि॒रानू॑षत॒ प्र दा॒वने॑ इन्द्र॒ वाजा॑य॒ घृष्व॑ये
verses.transliteration: abhí tvā gótamā girā́  -ánūṣata prá dāváne  índra vā́jāya ghŕ̥ṣvaye

translation.text: The Gotamas have sung their song of praise to thee that thou mayst give, Indra, for lively energy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॑ वोचाम वी॒र्या॒३॒॑ या म॑न्दसा॒न आरु॑जः पुरो॒ दासी॑र॒भीत्य॑
verses.transliteration: prá te vocāma vīryā̀  yā́ mandasāná ā́rujaḥ  púro dā́sīr abhī́tya

translation.text: We will declare thy hero deeds, what Disa forts thou brakest down, Attacking them in rapturous joy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता ते॑ गृणन्ति वे॒धसो॒ यानि॑ च॒कर्थ॒ पौंस्या॑ सु॒तेष्वि॑न्द्र गिर्वणः
verses.transliteration: tā́ te gr̥ṇanti vedháso  yā́ni cakártha paúṃsyā  sutéṣv indra girvaṇaḥ

translation.text: The sages sing those manly deeds which, Indra, Lover of the Song, Thou wrougbtest when the Soma flowed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवी॑वृधन्त॒ गोत॑मा॒ इन्द्र॒ त्वे स्तोम॑वाहसः ऐषु॑ धा वी॒रव॒द्यशः॑
verses.transliteration: ávīvr̥dhanta gótamāḥ-  índra tvé stómavāhasaḥ  aíṣu dhā vīrávad yáśaḥ

translation.text: Indra, the Gotamas who bring thee praises have grown strong by thee. Give them renown with hero sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यच्चि॒द्धि शश्व॑ता॒मसीन्द्र॒ साधा॑रण॒स्त्वम् तं त्वा॑ व॒यं ह॑वामहे
verses.transliteration: yác cid dhí śáśvatām ási-  -índra sā́dhāraṇas tvám  táṃ tvā vayáṃ havāmahe

translation.text: For, Indra, verily thou art the general treasure even of all . Thee, therefore, do we invocate.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वा॒ची॒नो व॑सो भवा॒स्मे सु म॒त्स्वान्ध॑सः सोमा॑नामिन्द्र सोमपाः
verses.transliteration: arvācīnó vaso bhava-  -asmé sú matsvā́ndhasaḥ  sómānām indra somapāḥ

translation.text: Excellent Indra, turn to us: glad thee among us with the juice Of Somas, Soma-drinker thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माकं॑ त्वा मती॒नामा स्तोम॑ इन्द्र यच्छतु अ॒र्वागा व॑र्तया॒ हरी॑
verses.transliteration: asmā́kaṃ tvā matīnā́m  ā́ stóma indra yachatu  arvā́g ā́ vartayā hárī

translation.text: May praise from us who think Qn thee, O Indra, bring thee near to us. Turn thy two Bay Steeds hitherward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रो॒ळाशं॑ च नो॒ घसो॑ जो॒षया॑से॒ गिर॑श्च नः व॒धू॒युरि॑व॒ योष॑णाम्
verses.transliteration: puroḷā́śaṃ ca no gháso  joṣáyāse gíraś ca naḥ  vadhūyúr iva yóṣaṇām

translation.text: Eat of our sacrificial cake: rejoice thee in the songs we sing. Even as a lover in his bride.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्रं॒ व्यती॑नां यु॒क्ताना॒मिन्द्र॑मीमहे श॒तं सोम॑स्य खा॒र्यः॑
verses.transliteration: sahásraṃ vyátīnāṃ  yuktā́nām índram īmahe  śatáṃ sómasya khāryàḥ

translation.text: To India for a thousand steeds well-trained and fleet of foot we pray, And hundred jars of Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्रा॑ ते श॒ता व॒यं गवा॒मा च्या॑वयामसि अ॒स्म॒त्रा राध॑ एतु ते
verses.transliteration: sahásrā te śatā́ vayáṃ  gávām ā́ cyāvayāmasi  asmatrā́ rā́dha etu te

translation.text: We make a hundred of thy kine, yea, and a thousand, hasten nigh: So let thy bounty come to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दश॑ ते क॒लशा॑नां॒ हिर॑ण्यानामधीमहि भू॒रि॒दा अ॑सि वृत्रहन्
verses.transliteration: dáśa te kaláśānāṃ  híraṇyānām adhīmahi  bhūridā́ asi vr̥trahan

translation.text: We have obtained, a gift from thee, ten water-ewers wrought of gold: Thou, Vr̥itra-slayer, givest much.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरि॑दा॒ भूरि॑ देहि नो॒ मा द॒भ्रं भूर्या भ॑र भूरि॒ घेदि॑न्द्र दित्ससि
verses.transliteration: bhū́ridā bhū́ri dehi no  mā́ dabhrám bhū́ry ā́ bhara  bhū́ri ghéd indra ditsasi

translation.text: A bounteous Giver, give us much, bring much and not a trifling gift: Much, Indra, wilt thou fain bestow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भू॒रि॒दा ह्यसि॑ श्रु॒तः पु॑रु॒त्रा शू॑र वृत्रहन् आ नो॑ भजस्व॒ राध॑सि
verses.transliteration: bhūridā́ hy ási śrutáḥ  purutrā́ śūra vr̥trahan  ā́ no bhajasva rā́dhasi

translation.text: O Vr̥itra-slayer, thou art famed in many a place as bountiful Hero, thy bounty let us share.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ते॑ ब॒भ्रू वि॑चक्षण॒ शंसा॑मि गोषणो नपात् माभ्यां॒ गा अनु॑ शिश्रथः
verses.transliteration: prá te babhrū́ vicakṣaṇa  śáṃsāmi goṣaṇo napāt  mā́bhyāṃ gā́ ánu śiśrathaḥ

translation.text: I praise thy pair of Tawny Steeds, wise Son of him who giveth kine Terrify not the cows with these.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒नी॒न॒केव॑ विद्र॒धे नवे॑ द्रुप॒दे अ॑र्भ॒के ब॒भ्रू यामे॑षु शोभेते
verses.transliteration: kanīnakéva vidradhé  náve drupadé arbhaké  babhrū́ yā́meṣu śobhete

translation.text: Like two slight images of girls, unrobed, upon a new-wrought post, So shine the Bay Steeds in their course.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरं॑ म उ॒स्रया॒म्णेऽर॒मनु॑स्रयाम्णे ब॒भ्रू यामे॑ष्व॒स्रिधा॑
verses.transliteration: áram ma usráyāmṇe-  -áram ánusrayāmṇe  babhrū́ yā́meṣv asrídhā

translation.text: For me the Bays are ready when I start, or start not, with the dawn, Innocuous in the ways they take.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ऋ॒भुभ्यो॑ दू॒तमि॑व॒ वाच॑मिष्य उप॒स्तिरे॒ श्वैत॑रीं धे॒नुमी॑ळे ये वात॑जूतास्त॒रणि॑भि॒रेवैः॒ परि॒ द्यां स॒द्यो अ॒पसो॑ बभू॒वुः
verses.transliteration: prá r̥bhúbhyo dūtám iva vā́cam iṣye-  upastíre śvaítarīṃ dhenúm īḷe  yé vā́tajūtās taráṇibhir évaiḥ  pári dyā́ṃ sadyó apáso babhūvúḥ

translation.text: I SEND my voice as herald to the R̥ibhus; I crave the white cow for the overspreading. Wind-sped, the Skillful Ones in rapid motion have in an instant compassed round the heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒दार॒मक्र॑न्नृ॒भवः॑ पि॒तृभ्यां॒ परि॑विष्टी वे॒षणा॑ दं॒सना॑भिः आदिद्दे॒वाना॒मुप॑ स॒ख्यमा॑य॒न्धीरा॑सः पु॒ष्टिम॑वहन्म॒नायै॑
verses.transliteration: yadā́ram ákrann r̥bhávaḥ pitŕ̥bhyām  páriviṣṭī veṣáṇā daṃsánābhiḥ  ā́d íd devā́nām úpa sakhyám āyan  dhī́rāsaḥ puṣṭím avahan manā́yai

translation.text: What time the Rbus had with care and marvels done proper service to assist their Parents, They won the friendship of the Gods; the Sages carried away the fruit of their devotion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुन॒र्ये च॒क्रुः पि॒तरा॒ युवा॑ना॒ सना॒ यूपे॑व जर॒णा शया॑ना ते वाजो॒ विभ्वाँ॑ ऋ॒भुरिन्द्र॑वन्तो॒ मधु॑प्सरसो नोऽवन्तु य॒ज्ञम्
verses.transliteration: púnar yé cakrúḥ pitárā yúvānā  sánā yū́peva jaraṇā́ śáyānā  té vā́jo víbhvām̐ r̥bhúr índravanto  mádhupsaraso no 'vantu yajñám

translation.text: May they who made their Parents, who were lying like posts that moulder, young again for ever,– May Vâja, Vibhvan, R̥ibhu, joined with Indra , protect our sacrifice, the Soma-lovers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्सं॒वत्स॑मृ॒भवो॒ गामर॑क्ष॒न्यत्सं॒वत्स॑मृ॒भवो॒ मा अपिं॑शन् यत्सं॒वत्स॒मभ॑र॒न्भासो॑ अस्या॒स्ताभिः॒ शमी॑भिरमृत॒त्वमा॑शुः
verses.transliteration: yát saṃvátsam r̥bhávo gā́m árakṣan  yát saṃvátsam r̥bhávo mā́ ápiṃśan  yát saṃvátsam ábharan bhā́so asyās  tā́bhiḥ śámībhir amr̥tatvám āśuḥ

translation.text: As for a year the R̥ibhus kept the Milch-cow, throughout a year fashioned and formed her body, And through a year's space still sustained her brightness, through these their labours they were made immortal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज्ये॒ष्ठ आ॑ह चम॒सा द्वा क॒रेति॒ कनी॑या॒न्त्रीन्कृ॑णवा॒मेत्या॑ह क॒नि॒ष्ठ आ॑ह च॒तुर॑स्क॒रेति॒ त्वष्ट॑ ऋभव॒स्तत्प॑नय॒द्वचो॑ वः
verses.transliteration: jyeṣṭhá āha camasā́ dvā́ karéti  kánīyān trī́n kr̥ṇavāméty āha  kaniṣṭhá āha catúras karéti  tváṣṭa r̥bhavas tát panayad váco vaḥ

translation.text: Two beakers let us make,– thus said the eldest. Lct us make three,– this was the younger's sentence. Four beakers let us make,– thus spoke the youngest. Tvashṭar approved this rede of yours, O R̥ibhus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्यमू॑चु॒र्नर॑ ए॒वा हि च॒क्रुरनु॑ स्व॒धामृ॒भवो॑ जग्मुरे॒ताम् वि॒भ्राज॑मानाँश्चम॒साँ अहे॒वावे॑न॒त्त्वष्टा॑ च॒तुरो॑ ददृ॒श्वान्
verses.transliteration: satyám ūcur nára evā́ hí cakrúr  ánu svadhā́m r̥bhávo jagmur etā́m  vibhrā́jamānāṃś camasā́m̐ áheva-  -ávenat tváṣṭā catúro dadr̥śvā́n

translation.text: The men spake truth and even so they acted: this Godlike way of theirs the R̥ibhus followed. And Tvashṭar, when he looked on the four beakers resplendent as the day, was moved with envy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वाद॑श॒ द्यून्यदगो॑ह्यस्याति॒थ्ये रण॑न्नृ॒भवः॑ स॒सन्तः॑ सु॒क्षेत्रा॑कृण्व॒न्नन॑यन्त॒ सिन्धू॒न्धन्वाति॑ष्ठ॒न्नोष॑धीर्नि॒म्नमापः॑
verses.transliteration: dvā́daśa dyū́n yád ágohyasya-  -ātithyé ráṇann r̥bhávaḥ sasántaḥ  sukṣétrākr̥ṇvann ánayanta síndhūn  dhánvā́tiṣṭhann óṣadhīr nimnám ā́paḥ

translation.text: When for twelve days the R̥ibhus joyed reposing as guests of him who never may be hidden, lley made fair fertile fields, they brought the rivers. Plants spread o'er deserts, waters filled the hollows.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथं॒ ये च॒क्रुः सु॒वृतं॑ नरे॒ष्ठां ये धे॒नुं वि॑श्व॒जुवं॑ वि॒श्वरू॑पाम् त आ त॑क्षन्त्वृ॒भवो॑ र॒यिं नः॒ स्वव॑सः॒ स्वप॑सः सु॒हस्ताः॑
verses.transliteration: ráthaṃ yé cakrúḥ suvŕ̥taṃ nareṣṭhā́ṃ  yé dhenúṃ viśvajúvaṃ viśvárūpām  tá ā́ takṣantv r̥bhávo rayíṃ naḥ  svávasaḥ svápasaḥ suhástāḥ

translation.text: May they who formed the swift car, bearing Heroes, and the Cow omniform and all-impelling, Even may they form wealth for us,– the R̥ibhus, dexterous-handed, deft in work and gracious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपो॒ ह्ये॑षा॒मजु॑षन्त दे॒वा अ॒भि क्रत्वा॒ मन॑सा॒ दीध्या॑नाः वाजो॑ दे॒वाना॑मभवत्सु॒कर्मेन्द्र॑स्य ऋभु॒क्षा वरु॑णस्य॒ विभ्वा॑
verses.transliteration: ápo hy èṣām ájuṣanta devā́ḥ-  abhí krátvā mánasā dī́dhyānāḥ  vā́jo devā́nām abhavat sukármā-  -índrasya r̥bhukṣā́ váruṇasya víbhvā

translation.text: So in their work the Gods had satisfaction, pondering it with thought and mental insight. The Gods' expert artificer was Vâja, Indra's R̥ibhukshan, Varuṇa's was Vibhvan.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये हरी॑ मे॒धयो॒क्था मद॑न्त॒ इन्द्रा॑य च॒क्रुः सु॒युजा॒ ये अश्वा॑ ते रा॒यस्पोषं॒ द्रवि॑णान्य॒स्मे ध॒त्त ऋ॑भवः क्षेम॒यन्तो॒ न मि॒त्रम्
verses.transliteration: yé hárī medháyokthā́ mádantaḥ-  índrāya cakrúḥ suyújā yé áśvā  té rāyás póṣaṃ dráviṇāny asmé  dhattá r̥bhavaḥ kṣemayánto ná mitrám

translation.text: They whol made glad with sacrifice and praises, wrought the two Bays, his docile Steeds, for Indra,– R̥ibhus, as those who wish a friend to prosper, bestow upon us gear and growth of riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दाह्नः॑ पी॒तिमु॒त वो॒ मदं॑ धु॒र्न ऋ॒ते श्रा॒न्तस्य॑ स॒ख्याय॑ दे॒वाः ते नू॒नम॒स्मे ऋ॑भवो॒ वसू॑नि तृ॒तीये॑ अ॒स्मिन्त्सव॑ने दधात
verses.transliteration: idā́hnaḥ pītím utá vo mádaṃ dhur  ná r̥té śrāntásya sakhyā́ya devā́ḥ  té nūnám asmé r̥bhavo vásūni  tr̥tī́ye asmín sávane dadhāta

translation.text: This day have they set gladdening drink before you. Not without toil are Gods inclined to friendship. Therefore do ye who are so great, O R̥ibhus, vouchsafe us treasures at this third libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒भुर्विभ्वा॒ वाज॒ इन्द्रो॑ नो॒ अच्छे॒मं य॒ज्ञं र॑त्न॒धेयोप॑ यात इ॒दा हि वो॑ धि॒षणा॑ दे॒व्यह्ना॒मधा॑त्पी॒तिं सं मदा॑ अग्मता वः
verses.transliteration: r̥bhúr víbhvā vā́ja índro no ácha-  -imáṃ yajñáṃ ratnadhéyópa yāta  idā́ hí vo dhiṣáṇā devy áhnām  ádhāt pītíṃ sám mádā agmatā vaḥ

translation.text: To this our sacrifice come R̥ibhu, Vibhvan, Vâja, and Indra with the gift of riches, Because this day hath Dhishaṇâ the Goddess set drink for you: the gladdening draughts have reached you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒दा॒नासो॒ जन्म॑नो वाजरत्ना उ॒त ऋ॒तुभि॑र्ऋभवो मादयध्वम् सं वो॒ मदा॒ अग्म॑त॒ सं पुरं॑धिः सु॒वीरा॑म॒स्मे र॒यिमेर॑यध्वम्
verses.transliteration: vidānā́so jánmano vājaratnāḥ-  utá r̥túbhir r̥bhavo mādayadhvam  sáṃ vo mádā ágmata sám púraṃdhiḥ  suvī́rām asmé rayím érayadhvam

translation.text: Knowing your birth and rich in gathered treasure, R̥ibhus, rejoice together with the Rtus. The gladdening draughts and wisdom have approached you: send ye us riches with good store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं वो॑ य॒ज्ञ ऋ॑भवोऽकारि॒ यमा म॑नु॒ष्वत्प्र॒दिवो॑ दधि॒ध्वे प्र वोऽच्छा॑ जुजुषा॒णासो॑ अस्थु॒रभू॑त॒ विश्वे॑ अग्रि॒योत वा॑जाः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ vo yajñá r̥bhavo 'kāri  yám ā́ manuṣvát pradívo dadhidhvé  prá vó 'chā jujuṣāṇā́so asthur  ábhūta víśve agriyótá vājāḥ

translation.text: For you was made this sacrifice, O R̥ibhus, which ye, like men, won for yourselves aforetime. To you come all who find in you their pleasure: ye all were-even the two elder-Vâjas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अभू॑दु वो विध॒ते र॑त्न॒धेय॑मि॒दा न॑रो दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य पिब॑त वाजा ऋभवो द॒दे वो॒ महि॑ तृ॒तीयं॒ सव॑नं॒ मदा॑य
verses.transliteration: ábhūd u vo vidhaté ratnadhéyam  idā́ naro dāśúṣe mártyāya  píbata vājā r̥bhavo dadé vo  máhi tr̥tī́yaṃ sávanam mádāya

translation.text: Now for the mortal worshipper, O Heroes, for him who served you, was the gift of riches. Drink, Vâjas, R̥ibhus! unto you is offered, to gladden you, the third and great libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वा॑जा या॒तोप॑ न ऋभुक्षा म॒हो न॑रो॒ द्रवि॑णसो गृणा॒नाः आ वः॑ पी॒तयो॑ऽभिपि॒त्वे अह्ना॑मि॒मा अस्तं॑ नव॒स्व॑ इव ग्मन्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vājā yātópa na r̥bhukṣāḥ-  mahó naro dráviṇaso gr̥ṇānā́ḥ  ā́ vaḥ pītáyo 'bhipitvé áhnām  imā́ ástaṃ navasvà iva gman

translation.text: Come to us, Heroes, Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans, glorified for the sake of mighty treasure. These draughts approach you as the day is closing, as cows, whose calves are newly-born, their stable.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ न॑पातः शवसो यात॒नोपे॒मं य॒ज्ञं नम॑सा हू॒यमा॑नाः स॒जोष॑सः सूरयो॒ यस्य॑ च॒ स्थ मध्वः॑ पात रत्न॒धा इन्द्र॑वन्तः
verses.transliteration: ā́ napātaḥ śavaso yātanópa-  -imáṃ yajñáṃ námasā hūyámānāḥ  sajóṣasaḥ sūrayo yásya ca sthá  mádhvaḥ pāta ratnadhā́ índravantaḥ

translation.text: Come to this sacrifice of ours, ye Children of Strength, invoked with humble adoration. Drink of this meath, Wealth-givers, joined with Indra with whom ye are in full accord, ye Princes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒जोषा॑ इन्द्र॒ वरु॑णेन॒ सोमं॑ स॒जोषाः॑ पाहि गिर्वणो म॒रुद्भिः॑ अ॒ग्रे॒पाभि॑र्ऋतु॒पाभिः॑ स॒जोषा॒ ग्नास्पत्नी॑भी रत्न॒धाभिः॑ स॒जोषाः॑
verses.transliteration: sajóṣā indra váruṇena sómaṃ  sajóṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇo marúdbhiḥ  agrepā́bhir r̥tupā́bhiḥ sajóṣāḥ-  gnā́spátnībhī ratnadhā́bhiḥ sajóṣāḥ

translation.text: Close knit with Varuṇa drink the Soma, Indra; close-knit, ilymn-lover! with the Maruts drink it: Close-knit with drinkers first, who drink in season; close-knit with heavenly Dames who give us treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒जोष॑स आदि॒त्यैर्मा॑दयध्वं स॒जोष॑स ऋभवः॒ पर्व॑तेभिः स॒जोष॑सो॒ दैव्ये॑ना सवि॒त्रा स॒जोष॑सः॒ सिन्धु॑भी रत्न॒धेभिः॑
verses.transliteration: sajóṣasa ādityaír mādayadhvaṃ  sajóṣasa r̥bhavaḥ párvatebhiḥ  sajóṣaso daívyenā savitrā́  sajóṣasaḥ síndhubhī ratnadhébhiḥ

translation.text: Rejoice in full accord with the Âdityas, in concord with the Parvatas, O R̥ibhus; In full accord with Savitar, Divine One; in full accord with floods that pour forth riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये अ॒श्विना॒ ये पि॒तरा॒ य ऊ॒ती धे॒नुं त॑त॒क्षुर्ऋ॒भवो॒ ये अश्वा॑ ये अंस॑त्रा॒ य ऋध॒ग्रोद॑सी॒ ये विभ्वो॒ नरः॑ स्वप॒त्यानि॑ च॒क्रुः
verses.transliteration: yé aśvínā yé pitárā yá ūtī́  dhenúṃ tatakṣúr r̥bhávo yé áśvā  yé áṃsatrā yá ŕ̥dhag ródasī yé  víbhvo náraḥ svapatyā́ni cakrúḥ

translation.text: R̥ibhus, who helped their Parents and the Aṣvins, who formed the Milch-cow and the pair of horses, Made armour, set the heaven and earth asunder,– far- reaching Heroes, they have made good offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये गोम॑न्तं॒ वाज॑वन्तं सु॒वीरं॑ र॒यिं ध॒त्थ वसु॑मन्तं पुरु॒क्षुम् ते अ॑ग्रे॒पा ऋ॑भवो मन्दसा॒ना अ॒स्मे ध॑त्त॒ ये च॑ रा॒तिं गृ॒णन्ति॑
verses.transliteration: yé gómantaṃ vā́javantaṃ suvī́raṃ  rayíṃ dhatthá vásumantam purukṣúm  té agrepā́ r̥bhavo mandasānā́ḥ-  asmé dhatta yé ca rātíṃ gr̥ṇánti

translation.text: Ye who have wealth in cattle and in booty, in heroes, in rich sustenance and treasure, Such, O ye R̥ibhus, first to drink, rejoicing, give unto us and those who laud our present.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नापा॑भूत॒ न वो॑ऽतीतृषा॒मानिः॑शस्ता ऋभवो य॒ज्ञे अ॒स्मिन् समिन्द्रे॑ण॒ मद॑थ॒ सं म॒रुद्भिः॒ सं राज॑भी रत्न॒धेया॑य देवाः
verses.transliteration: nā́pābhūta ná vo 'tītr̥ṣāma-  -ániḥśastā r̥bhavo yajñé asmín  sám índreṇa mádatha sám marúdbhiḥ  sáṃ rā́jabhī ratnadhéyāya devāḥ

translation.text: Ye were not far: we have not left you thirsting, blameless in this our sacrifice, O R̥ibhus. Rejoice you with the Maruts and with Indra, with the Kings, Gods! that ye may give us riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒होप॑ यात शवसो नपातः॒ सौध॑न्वना ऋभवो॒ माप॑ भूत अ॒स्मिन्हि वः॒ सव॑ने रत्न॒धेयं॒ गम॒न्त्विन्द्र॒मनु॑ वो॒ मदा॑सः
verses.transliteration: ihópa yāta śavaso napātaḥ  saúdhanvanā r̥bhavo mā́pa bhūta  asmín hí vaḥ sávane ratnadhéyaṃ  gámantv índram ánu vo mádāsaḥ

translation.text: Come hither, O ye Sons of Strength, ye R̥ibhus; stay not afar, ye Children of Sudhanvan. At this libation is your gift of treasure. Let gladdening draughts approach you after Indra's.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आग॑न्नृभू॒णामि॒ह र॑त्न॒धेय॒मभू॒त्सोम॑स्य॒ सुषु॑तस्य पी॒तिः सु॒कृ॒त्यया॒ यत्स्व॑प॒स्यया॑ चँ॒ एकं॑ विच॒क्र च॑म॒सं च॑तु॒र्धा
verses.transliteration: ā́gann r̥bhūṇā́m ihá ratnadhéyam  ábhūt sómasya súṣutasya pītíḥ  sukr̥tyáyā yát svapasyáyā cam̐  ékaṃ vicakrá camasáṃ caturdhā́

translation.text: Hither is come the R̥ibhus' gift of riches; here was the drinking of the well-pressed Soma, Since by dexterity and skill as craftsmen ye made the single chalice to be fourfold

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्य॑कृणोत चम॒सं च॑तु॒र्धा सखे॒ वि शि॒क्षेत्य॑ब्रवीत अथै॑त वाजा अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ पन्थां॑ ग॒णं दे॒वाना॑मृभवः सुहस्ताः
verses.transliteration: vy àkr̥ṇota camasáṃ caturdhā́  sákhe ví śikṣéty abravīta  áthaita vājā amŕ̥tasya pánthāṃ  gaṇáṃ devā́nām r̥bhavaḥ suhastāḥ

translation.text: Ye made fourfold the chalice that wag single: ye spake these words and said, O Friend, assist us; Then, Vâjas! gained the path of life eternal, deft-handed R̥ibhus, to the Gods' assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कि॒म्मयः॑ स्विच्चम॒स ए॒ष आ॑स॒ यं काव्ये॑न च॒तुरो॑ विच॒क्र अथा॑ सुनुध्वं॒ सव॑नं॒ मदा॑य पा॒त ऋ॑भवो॒ मधु॑नः सो॒म्यस्य॑
verses.transliteration: kimmáyaḥ svic camasá eṣá āsa  yáṃ kā́vyena catúro vicakrá  áthā sunudhvaṃ sávanam mádāya  pātá r̥bhavo mádhunaḥ somyásya

translation.text: Out of what substance was that chalice fashioned which ye made fourfold by your art and wisdom? Now for the gladdening draught press out the liquor, and drink, O R̥ibhus, of die meath of Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शच्या॑कर्त पि॒तरा॒ युवा॑ना॒ शच्या॑कर्त चम॒सं दे॑व॒पान॑म् शच्या॒ हरी॒ धनु॑तरावतष्टेन्द्र॒वाहा॑वृभवो वाजरत्नाः
verses.transliteration: śácyākarta pitárā yúvānā  śácyākarta camasáṃ devapā́nam  śácyā hárī dhánutarāv ataṣṭa-  -indravā́hāv r̥bhavo vājaratnāḥ

translation.text: Ye with your cunning made your Parents youthful; the cup, for Gods to drink, ye formed with cunning; With cunning, R̥ibhus, rich in treasure, fashioned the two swift Tawny Steeds who carry Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वः॑ सु॒नोत्य॑भिपि॒त्वे अह्नां॑ ती॒व्रं वा॑जासः॒ सव॑नं॒ मदा॑य तस्मै॑ र॒यिमृ॑भवः॒ सर्व॑वीर॒मा त॑क्षत वृषणो मन्दसा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: yó vaḥ sunóty abhipitvé áhnāṃ  tīvráṃ vājāsaḥ sávanam mádāya  tásmai rayím r̥bhavaḥ sárvavīram  ā́ takṣata vr̥ṣaṇo mandasānā́ḥ

translation.text: Whoso pours out for you, when days are closing, the sharp libation for your joy, O Vâjas, For him, O mighty R̥ibhus, ye, rejoicing, have fashioned wealth with plenteous store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒तः सु॒तम॑पिबो हर्यश्व॒ माध्यं॑दिनं॒ सव॑नं॒ केव॑लं ते समृ॒भुभिः॑ पिबस्व रत्न॒धेभिः॒ सखीँ॒र्याँ इ॑न्द्र चकृ॒षे सु॑कृ॒त्या
verses.transliteration: prātáḥ sutám apibo haryaśva  mā́dhyaṃdinaṃ sávanaṃ kévalaṃ te  sám r̥bhúbhiḥ pibasva ratnadhébhiḥ  sákhīm̐r yā́m̐ indra cakr̥ṣé sukr̥tyā́

translation.text: Lord of Bay Steeds, at dawn thejuice thou drankest: thine, only thine, is the noonday libation. Now drink thou with the wealth-bestowing R̥ibhus, whom for their skill thou madest friends, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये दे॒वासो॒ अभ॑वता सुकृ॒त्या श्ये॒ना इ॒वेदधि॑ दि॒वि नि॑षे॒द ते रत्नं॑ धात शवसो नपातः॒ सौध॑न्वना॒ अभ॑वता॒मृता॑सः
verses.transliteration: yé devā́so ábhavatā sukr̥tyā́  śyenā́ ivéd ádhi diví niṣedá  té rátnaṃ dhāta śavaso napātaḥ  saúdhanvanā ábhavatāmŕ̥tāsaḥ

translation.text: Ye, whom your artist skill hath raised to Godhead have set you down above in heaven like falcons. So give us riches, Children of Sudhanvan, O Sons of Strength; ye have become immortal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्तृ॒तीयं॒ सव॑नं रत्न॒धेय॒मकृ॑णुध्वं स्वप॒स्या सु॑हस्ताः तदृ॑भवः॒ परि॑षिक्तं व ए॒तत्सं मदे॑भिरिन्द्रि॒येभिः॑ पिबध्वम्
verses.transliteration: yát tr̥tī́yaṃ sávanaṃ ratnadhéyam  ákr̥ṇudhvaṃ svapasyā́ suhastāḥ  tád r̥bhavaḥ páriṣiktaṃ va etát  sám mádebhir indriyébhiḥ pibadhvam

translation.text: The third libation, that bestoweth treasure, which ye have won by skill, ye dexterous-handed,– This drink hath been effused for you, O R̥ibhus . drink it with high delight, with joy like Indra's.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न॒श्वो जा॒तो अ॑नभी॒शुरु॒क्थ्यो॒३॒॑ रथ॑स्त्रिच॒क्रः परि॑ वर्तते॒ रजः॑ म॒हत्तद्वो॑ दे॒व्य॑स्य प्र॒वाच॑नं॒ द्यामृ॑भवः पृथि॒वीं यच्च॒ पुष्य॑थ
verses.transliteration: anaśvó jātó anabhīśúr ukthyò  ráthas tricakráḥ pári vartate rájaḥ  mahát tád vo devyàsya pravā́canaṃ  dyā́m r̥bhavaḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ yác ca púṣyatha

translation.text: THia car that was not made for horses or for reins, three-wheeled, worthy of lauds, rolls round the firmament. That is the great announcement of your Deity, that, O ye R̥ibhus, ye sustain the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथं॒ ये च॒क्रुः सु॒वृतं॑ सु॒चेत॒सोऽवि॑ह्वरन्तं॒ मन॑स॒स्परि॒ ध्यया॑ ताँ ऊ॒ न्व१॒॑स्य सव॑नस्य पी॒तय॒ आ वो॑ वाजा ऋभवो वेदयामसि
verses.transliteration: ráthaṃ yé cakrúḥ suvŕ̥taṃ sucétasaḥ-  -ávihvarantam mánasas pári dhyáyā  tā́m̐ ū nv àsyá sávanasya pītáye-  ā́ vo vājā r̥bhavo vedayāmasi

translation.text: Ye Sapient Ones who made the lightly-rolling car out of your mind, by thought, the car that never errs, You, being such, to drink of this drinkoffering, you, O ye Vâjas, and ye R̥ibhus, we invoke.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वो॑ वाजा ऋभवः सुप्रवाच॒नं दे॒वेषु॑ विभ्वो अभवन्महित्व॒नम् जिव्री॒ यत्सन्ता॑ पि॒तरा॑ सना॒जुरा॒ पुन॒र्युवा॑ना च॒रथा॑य॒ तक्ष॑थ
verses.transliteration: tád vo vājā r̥bhavaḥ supravācanáṃ  devéṣu vibhvo abhavan mahitvanám  jívrī yát sántā pitárā sanājúrā  púnar yúvānā caráthāya tákṣatha

translation.text: O Vâjas, R̥ibhus, reaching far, among the Gods this was your exaltation gloriously declared, In that your aged Parents, worn with length of days, ye wrought again to youth so that they moved at will.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एकं॒ वि च॑क्र चम॒सं चतु॑र्वयं॒ निश्चर्म॑णो॒ गाम॑रिणीत धी॒तिभिः॑ अथा॑ दे॒वेष्व॑मृत॒त्वमा॑नश श्रु॒ष्टी वा॑जा ऋभव॒स्तद्व॑ उ॒क्थ्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ékaṃ ví cakra camasáṃ cáturvayaṃ  níś cármaṇo gā́m ariṇīta dhītíbhir  áthā devéṣv amr̥tatvám ānaśa  śruṣṭī́ vājā r̥bhavas tád va ukthyàm

translation.text: The chalice that wag single ye have made fourfold, and by your wisdom brought the Cow forth from the hide. So quickly, mid the Gods, ye gained immortal life. Vâjas and R̥ibhus, your great work must be extolled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒भु॒तो र॒यिः प्र॑थ॒मश्र॑वस्तमो॒ वाज॑श्रुतासो॒ यमजी॑जन॒न्नरः॑ वि॒भ्व॒त॒ष्टो वि॒दथे॑षु प्र॒वाच्यो॒ यं दे॑वा॒सोऽव॑था॒ स विच॑र्षणिः
verses.transliteration: r̥bhutó rayíḥ prathamáśravastamo  vā́jaśrutāso yám ájījanan náraḥ  vibhvataṣṭó vidátheṣu pravā́cyo  yáṃ devāsó 'vathā sá vícarṣaṇiḥ

translation.text: Wealth from the R̥ibhus is most glorious in renown, that which the Heroes, famed for vigour, have produced. In synods must be sung the car which Vibhvan wrought: that which ye favour, Gods! is famed among mankind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वा॒ज्यर्वा॒ स ऋषि॑र्वच॒स्यया॒ स शूरो॒ अस्ता॒ पृत॑नासु दु॒ष्टरः॑ स रा॒यस्पोषं॒ स सु॒वीर्यं॑ दधे॒ यं वाजो॒ विभ्वाँ॑ ऋ॒भवो॒ यमावि॑षुः
verses.transliteration: sá vājy árvā sá ŕ̥ṣir vacasyáyā  sá śū́ro ástā pŕ̥tanāsu duṣṭáraḥ  sá rāyás póṣaṃ sá suvī́ryaṃ dadhe  yáṃ vā́jo víbhvām̐ r̥bhávo yám ā́viṣuḥ

translation.text: Strong is the steed, the man a sage in eloquence, the bowman is a hero hard to beat in fight, Great store of wealth and manly power hath he obtained whom Vâja, Vibhvan, R̥ibhus have looked kindly on.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रेष्ठं॑ वः॒ पेशो॒ अधि॑ धायि दर्श॒तं स्तोमो॑ वाजा ऋभव॒स्तं जु॑जुष्टन धीरा॑सो॒ हि ष्ठा क॒वयो॑ विप॒श्चित॒स्तान्व॑ ए॒ना ब्रह्म॒णा वे॑दयामसि
verses.transliteration: śréṣṭhaṃ vaḥ péśo ádhi dhāyi darśatáṃ  stómo vājā r̥bhavas táṃ jujuṣṭana  dhī́rāso hí ṣṭhā́ kaváyo vipaścítas  tā́n va enā́ bráhmaṇā́ vedayāmasi

translation.text: To you hath been assigned the fairest ornament, the hymn of praise: Vâjas and R̥ibhus, joy therein; For ye have lore and wisdom and poetic skill: as such, with this our prayer we call on you to come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यम॒स्मभ्यं॑ धि॒षणा॑भ्य॒स्परि॑ वि॒द्वांसो॒ विश्वा॒ नर्या॑णि॒ भोज॑ना द्यु॒मन्तं॒ वाजं॒ वृष॑शुष्ममुत्त॒ममा नो॑ र॒यिमृ॑भवस्तक्ष॒ता वयः॑
verses.transliteration: yūyám asmábhyaṃ dhiṣáṇābhyas pári  vidvā́ṃso víśvā náryāṇi bhójanā  dyumántaṃ vā́jaṃ vŕ̥ṣaśuṣmam uttamám  ā́ no rayím r̥bhavas takṣatā́ váyaḥ

translation.text: According to the wishes of our hearts may ye, who have full knowledge of all the delights of men, Fashion for us, O R̥ibhus, power and splendid wealth, rich in high courage, excellent, and vital strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ह प्र॒जामि॒ह र॒यिं ररा॑णा इ॒ह श्रवो॑ वी॒रव॑त्तक्षता नः येन॑ व॒यं चि॒तये॒मात्य॒न्यान्तं वाजं॑ चि॒त्रमृ॑भवो ददा नः
verses.transliteration: ihá prajā́m ihá rayíṃ rárāṇāḥ-  ihá śrávo vīrávat takṣatā naḥ  yéna vayáṃ citáyemā́ty anyā́n  táṃ vā́jaṃ citrám r̥bhavo dadā naḥ

translation.text: Bestowing on us here riches and offspring, here fashion fame for us befitting heroes. Vouchsafe us wealth of splendid sort, O R̥ibhus, that we may make us more renowned than others.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ नो वाजा अध्व॒रमृ॑भुक्षा॒ देवा॑ या॒त प॒थिभि॑र्देव॒यानैः॑ यथा॑ य॒ज्ञं मनु॑षो वि॒क्ष्वा॒३॒॑सु द॑धि॒ध्वे र॑ण्वाः सु॒दिने॒ष्वह्ना॑म्
verses.transliteration: úpa no vājā adhvarám r̥bhukṣāḥ-  dévā yātá pathíbhir devayā́naiḥ  yáthā yajñám mánuṣo vikṣv ā̀sú  dadhidhvé raṇvāḥ sudíneṣv áhnām

translation.text: COME to our sacrifice, Vâjas, R̥ibhukshans, Gods, by the paths which Gods are wont to travel, As ye, gay Gods, accept in splendid weather the sacrifice among these folk of Manus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते वो॑ हृ॒दे मन॑से सन्तु य॒ज्ञा जुष्टा॑सो अ॒द्य घृ॒तनि॑र्णिजो गुः प्र वः॑ सु॒तासो॑ हरयन्त पू॒र्णाः क्रत्वे॒ दक्षा॑य हर्षयन्त पी॒ताः
verses.transliteration: té vo hr̥dé mánase santu yajñā́ḥ-  júṣṭāso adyá ghr̥tánirṇijo guḥ  prá vaḥ sutā́so harayanta pūrṇā́ḥ  krátve dákṣāya harṣayanta pītā́ḥ

translation.text: May these rites please you in your heart and spirit; may the drops clothed in oil this day approach you. May the abundant juices bear you onward to power and strength, and, when imbibed, delight you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्र्यु॒दा॒यं दे॒वहि॑तं॒ यथा॑ वः॒ स्तोमो॑ वाजा ऋभुक्षणो द॒दे वः॑ जु॒ह्वे म॑नु॒ष्वदुप॑रासु वि॒क्षु यु॒ष्मे सचा॑ बृ॒हद्दि॑वेषु॒ सोम॑म्
verses.transliteration: tryudāyáṃ deváhitaṃ yáthā vaḥ-  stómo vājā r̥bhukṣaṇo dadé vaḥ  juhvé manuṣvád úparāsu vikṣú  yuṣmé sácā br̥háddiveṣu sómam

translation.text: Your threefold going near is God-appointed, so praise is given you, Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans. So, Manus-like, mid younger folk I offer, to you who are aloft in heaven, the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पीवो॑अश्वाः शु॒चद्र॑था॒ हि भू॒तायः॑शिप्रा वाजिनः सुनि॒ष्काः इन्द्र॑स्य सूनो शवसो नपा॒तोऽनु॑ वश्चेत्यग्रि॒यं मदा॑य
verses.transliteration: pī́voaśvāḥ śucádrathā hí bhūtá-  -áyaḥśiprā vājinaḥ suniṣkā́ḥ  índrasya sūno śavaso napātaḥ-  -ánu vaś cety agriyám mádāya

translation.text: Strong, with fair chains of gold and jaws of iron, ye have a splendid car and well-fed horses. Ye Sons of Strength, ye progeny of Indra, to you the best is offered to delight you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒भुमृ॑भुक्षणो र॒यिं वाजे॑ वा॒जिन्त॑मं॒ युज॑म् इन्द्र॑स्वन्तं हवामहे सदा॒सात॑मम॒श्विन॑म्
verses.transliteration: r̥bhúm r̥bhukṣaṇo rayíṃ  vā́je vājíntamaṃ yújam  índrasvantaṃ havāmahe  sadāsā́tamam aśvínam

translation.text: R̥ibhukshans! him, for handy wealth, the mightiest comrade in the fight, Him, Indra's equal, we invoke, most bounteous ever, rich in steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सेदृ॑भवो॒ यमव॑थ यू॒यमिन्द्र॑श्च॒ मर्त्य॑म् स धी॒भिर॑स्तु॒ सनि॑ता मे॒धसा॑ता॒ सो अर्व॑ता
verses.transliteration: séd r̥bhavo yám ávatha  yūyám índraś ca mártyam  sá dhībhír astu sánitā  medhásātā só árvatā

translation.text: The mortal man whom, R̥ibhus, ye and Indra favour with your help, Must be successful, by his thoughts, at sacrifice and with the steed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि नो॑ वाजा ऋभुक्षणः प॒थश्चि॑तन॒ यष्ट॑वे अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ सूरयः स्तु॒ता विश्वा॒ आशा॑स्तरी॒षणि॑
verses.transliteration: ví no vājā r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ  patháś citana yáṣṭave  asmábhyaṃ sūraya stutā́ḥ-  víśvā ā́śās tarīṣáṇi

translation.text: O Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans, free for us the paths to sacrifice, Ye Princes, lauded, that we may press forward to each point of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं नो॑ वाजा ऋभुक्षण॒ इन्द्र॒ नास॑त्या र॒यिम् समश्वं॑ चर्ष॒णिभ्य॒ आ पु॒रु श॑स्त म॒घत्त॑ये
verses.transliteration: táṃ no vājā r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ-  índra nā́satyā rayím  sám áśvaṃ carṣaṇíbhya~ā́  purú śasta magháttaye

translation.text: O Vâjas and R̥ibhukshans, ye Nâsatyas, Indra, bless this wealth, And, before other men's, the steed, that ample riches may be won.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒तो हि वां॑ दा॒त्रा सन्ति॒ पूर्वा॒ या पू॒रुभ्य॑स्त्र॒सद॑स्युर्नितो॒शे क्षे॒त्रा॒सां द॑दथुरुर्वरा॒सां घ॒नं दस्यु॑भ्यो अ॒भिभू॑तिमु॒ग्रम्
verses.transliteration: utó hí vāṃ dātrā́ sánti pū́rvā  yā́ pūrúbhyas trasádasyur nitośé  kṣetrāsā́ṃ dadathur urvarāsā́ṃ  ghanáṃ dásyubhyo abhíbhūtim ugrám

translation.text: FROM you two came the gifts in days aforetime which Trasadasyu granted to the Pûrus. Ye gave the winner of our fields and plough-lands, and the strong smiter who subdued the Dasytis.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त वा॒जिनं॑ पुरुनि॒ष्षिध्वा॑नं दधि॒क्रामु॑ ददथुर्वि॒श्वकृ॑ष्टिम् ऋ॒जि॒प्यं श्ये॒नं प्रु॑षि॒तप्सु॑मा॒शुं च॒र्कृत्य॑म॒र्यो नृ॒पतिं॒ न शूर॑म्
verses.transliteration: utá vājínam puruniṣṣídhvānaṃ  dadhikrā́m u dadathur viśvákr̥ṣṭim  r̥jipyáṃ śyenám pruṣitápsum āśúṃ  carkŕ̥tyam aryó nr̥pátiṃ ná śū́ram

translation.text: And ye gave mighty Dadhikrâs, the giver of many gifts, who visiteth all people, Impetuous hawk, swift and of varied colour, like a brave King whom each true man must honour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं सी॒मनु॑ प्र॒वते॑व॒ द्रव॑न्तं॒ विश्वः॑ पू॒रुर्मद॑ति॒ हर्ष॑माणः प॒ड्भिर्गृध्य॑न्तं मेध॒युं न शूरं॑ रथ॒तुरं॒ वात॑मिव॒ ध्रज॑न्तम्
verses.transliteration: yáṃ sīm ánu praváteva drávantaṃ  víśvaḥ pūrúr mádati hárṣamāṇaḥ  paḍbhír gŕ̥dhyantam medhayúṃ ná śū́raṃ  rathatúraṃ vā́tam iva dhrájantam

translation.text: Whom, as 'twere down a precipice, swift rushing, each Pûru praises and his heart rejoices,– Springing forth like a hero fain for battle, whirling the car and flying like the tempest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः स्मा॑रुन्धा॒नो गध्या॑ स॒मत्सु॒ सनु॑तर॒श्चर॑ति॒ गोषु॒ गच्छ॑न् आ॒विर्ऋ॑जीको वि॒दथा॑ नि॒चिक्य॑त्ति॒रो अ॑र॒तिं पर्याप॑ आ॒योः
verses.transliteration: yáḥ smārundhānó gádhyā samátsu  sánutaraś cárati góṣu gáchan  āvírr̥jīko vidáthā nicíkyat  tiró aratím páry ā́pa āyóḥ

translation.text: Who gaineth precious booty in the combats and moveth, winning spoil, among the cattle; Shown in bright colour, looking on the assemblies, beyond the churl, to worship of the living.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्मै॑नं वस्त्र॒मथिं॒ न ता॒युमनु॑ क्रोशन्ति क्षि॒तयो॒ भरे॑षु नी॒चाय॑मानं॒ जसु॑रिं॒ न श्ये॒नं श्रव॒श्चाच्छा॑ पशु॒मच्च॑ यू॒थम्
verses.transliteration: utá smainaṃ vastramáthiṃ ná tāyúm  ánu krośanti kṣitáyo bháreṣu  nīcā́yamānaṃ jásuriṃ ná śyenáṃ  śrávaś cā́chā paśumác ca yūthám

translation.text: Loudly the folk cry after him in battles, as 'twere a thief who steals away a garment; Speeding to glory, or a herd of cattle, even as a hungry falcon swooping downward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्मा॑सु प्रथ॒मः स॑रि॒ष्यन्नि वे॑वेति॒ श्रेणि॑भी॒ रथा॑नाम् स्रजं॑ कृण्वा॒नो जन्यो॒ न शुभ्वा॑ रे॒णुं रेरि॑हत्कि॒रणं॑ दद॒श्वान्
verses.transliteration: utá smāsu prathamáḥ sariṣyán  ní veveti śréṇibhī ráthānām  srájaṃ kr̥ṇvānó jányo ná śúbhvā  reṇúṃ rérihat kiráṇaṃ dadaśvā́n

translation.text: And, fain to come forth first amid these armies, this way and that with rows of cars he rushes, Gay like a bridesman, making him a garland, tossing the dust, champing the rein that holds him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्य वा॒जी सहु॑रिर्ऋ॒तावा॒ शुश्रू॑षमाणस्त॒न्वा॑ सम॒र्ये तुरं॑ य॒तीषु॑ तु॒रय॑न्नृजि॒प्योऽधि॑ भ्रु॒वोः कि॑रते रे॒णुमृ॒ञ्जन्
verses.transliteration: utá syá vājī́ sáhurir r̥tā́vā  śúśrūṣamāṇas tanvā̀ samaryé  túraṃ yatī́ṣu turáyann r̥jipyó  -ádhi bhruvóḥ kirate reṇúm r̥ñján

translation.text: And that strong Steed, victorious and faithful, obedient with his body in the combat, Speeding straight on amid the swiftly ressing, casts o'er his brows the dust he tosses upward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्मा॑स्य तन्य॒तोरि॑व॒ द्योर्ऋ॑घाय॒तो अ॑भि॒युजो॑ भयन्ते य॒दा स॒हस्र॑म॒भि षी॒मयो॑धीद्दु॒र्वर्तुः॑ स्मा भवति भी॒म ऋ॒ञ्जन्
verses.transliteration: utá smāsya tanyatór iva dyór  r̥ghāyató abhiyújo bhayante  yadā́ sahásram abhí ṣīm áyodhīd  durvártuḥ smā bhavati bhīmá r̥ñján

translation.text: And at his thunder, like the roar of heaven, those who attack tremble and are affrighted; For when he fights against embattled thousands, dread is he in his striving; none may stay him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्मा॑स्य पनयन्ति॒ जना॑ जू॒तिं कृ॑ष्टि॒प्रो अ॒भिभू॑तिमा॒शोः उ॒तैन॑माहुः समि॒थे वि॒यन्तः॒ परा॑ दधि॒क्रा अ॑सरत्स॒हस्रैः॑
verses.transliteration: utá smāsya panayanti jánāḥ-  jūtíṃ kr̥ṣṭipró abhíbhūtim āśóḥ  utaínam āhuḥ samithé viyántaḥ  párā dadhikrā́ asarat sahásraiḥ

translation.text: The people praise the overpowering swiftness of this fleet Steed who giveth men abundance. Of him they say when drawing back from battle. Dadhikrâs hath sped forward with his thousands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ द॑धि॒क्राः शव॑सा॒ पञ्च॑ कृ॒ष्टीः सूर्य॑ इव॒ ज्योति॑षा॒पस्त॑तान स॒ह॒स्र॒साः श॑त॒सा वा॒ज्यर्वा॑ पृ॒णक्तु॒ मध्वा॒ समि॒मा वचां॑सि
verses.transliteration: ā́ dadhikrā́ḥ śávasā páñca kr̥ṣṭī́ḥ  sū́rya iva jyótiṣāpás tatāna  sahasrasā́ḥ śatasā́ vājy árvā  pr̥ṇáktu mádhvā sám imā́ vácāṃsi

translation.text: Dadhikrâs hath o'erspread the Fivefold People with vigour, as the Sun lightens the waters. May the strong Steed who winneth bundreds, thousands, requite with sweetness these my words and praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒शुं द॑धि॒क्रां तमु॒ नु ष्ट॑वाम दि॒वस्पृ॑थि॒व्या उ॒त च॑र्किराम उ॒च्छन्ती॒र्मामु॒षसः॑ सूदय॒न्त्वति॒ विश्वा॑नि दुरि॒तानि॑ पर्षन्
verses.transliteration: āśúṃ dadhikrā́ṃ tám u nú ṣṭavāma  divás pr̥thivyā́ utá carkirāma  uchántīr mā́m uṣásaḥ sūdayantu-  áti víśvāni duritā́ni parṣan

translation.text: Now give we praise to Dadhikrâs the rapid, and mention in our laud the Earth and Heaven. May the Dawns flushing move me to exertion, and bear me safely over every trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हश्च॑र्क॒र्म्यर्व॑तः क्रतु॒प्रा द॑धि॒क्राव्णः॑ पुरु॒वार॑स्य॒ वृष्णः॑ यं पू॒रुभ्यो॑ दीदि॒वांसं॒ नाग्निं द॒दथु॑र्मित्रावरुणा॒ ततु॑रिम्
verses.transliteration: maháś carkarmy árvataḥ kratuprā́ḥ-  dadhikrā́vṇaḥ puruvā́rasya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ  yám pūrúbhyo dīdivā́ṃsaṃ nā́gníṃ  dadáthur mitrāvaruṇā táturim

translation.text: I praise the mighty Steed who fills my spirit, the Stallion Dadhikrâvan rich in bounties, Whom, swift of foot aind shining bright as Agni, ye, Varuṇa and Mitra, gave to Pûrus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अश्व॑स्य दधि॒क्राव्णो॒ अका॑री॒त्समि॑द्धे अ॒ग्ना उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ अना॑गसं॒ तमदि॑तिः कृणोतु॒ स मि॒त्रेण॒ वरु॑णेना स॒जोषाः॑
verses.transliteration: yó áśvasya dadhikrā́vṇo ákārīt  sámiddhe agnā́ uṣáso vyùṣṭau  ánāgasaṃ tám áditiḥ kr̥ṇotu  sá mitréṇa váruṇenā sajóṣāḥ

translation.text: Him who hath honoured, when the flame is kindled at break of dawn, the Courser Dadhikrâvan, Him, of one mind with Varuṇa and Mitra may Aditi make free from all transgression.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒धि॒क्राव्ण॑ इ॒ष ऊ॒र्जो म॒हो यदम॑न्महि म॒रुतां॒ नाम॑ भ॒द्रम् स्व॒स्तये॒ वरु॑णं मि॒त्रम॒ग्निं हवा॑मह॒ इन्द्रं॒ वज्र॑बाहुम्
verses.transliteration: dadhikrā́vṇa iṣá ūrjó mahó yád  ámanmahi marútāṃ nā́ma bhadrám  svastáye váruṇam mitrám agníṃ  hávāmaha índraṃ vájrabāhum

translation.text: When we remember mighty Dadhikrâvan our food and strength, then the blest name of Maruts, Varuṇa, Mitra, we invoke for welfare, and Agni, and the thunder-wielding Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑मि॒वेदु॒भये॒ वि ह्व॑यन्त उ॒दीरा॑णा य॒ज्ञमु॑पप्र॒यन्तः॑ द॒धि॒क्रामु॒ सूद॑नं॒ मर्त्या॑य द॒दथु॑र्मित्रावरुणा नो॒ अश्व॑म्
verses.transliteration: índram ivéd ubháye ví hvayante-  udī́rāṇā yajñám upaprayántaḥ  dadhikrā́m u sū́danam mártyāya  dadáthur mitrāvaruṇā no áśvam

translation.text: Both sides invoke him as they call on Indra when they stir forth and turn to sacrificing. To us have Varuṇa and Mitra granted the Courser Dadhikrâs, a guide for mortals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒धि॒क्राव्णो॑ अकारिषं जि॒ष्णोरश्व॑स्य वा॒जिनः॑ सु॒र॒भि नो॒ मुखा॑ कर॒त्प्र ण॒ आयूं॑षि तारिषत्
verses.transliteration: dadhikrā́vṇo akāriṣaṃ  jiṣṇór áśvasya vājínaḥ  surabhí no múkhā karat  prá ṇa ā́yūṃṣi tāriṣat

translation.text: So have I glorified with praise strong Dadhikrâvan, conquering Steed. Sweet may he make our mouths; may he prolong the days we have to live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒धि॒क्राव्ण॒ इदु॒ नु च॑र्किराम॒ विश्वा॒ इन्मामु॒षसः॑ सूदयन्तु अ॒पाम॒ग्नेरु॒षसः॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ बृह॒स्पते॑राङ्गिर॒सस्य॑ जि॒ष्णोः
verses.transliteration: dadhikrā́vṇa íd u nú carkirāma  víśvā ín mā́m uṣásaḥ sūdayantu  apā́m agnér uṣásaḥ sū́ryasya  bŕ̥haspáter āṅgirasásya jiṣṇóḥ

translation.text: LET us recite the praise of Dadhikrâvan: may all the Mornings move me to exertion; Praise of the Lord of Waters, Dawn, and Agni, Br̥ihaspati Son of Angiras, and Sûrya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सत्वा॑ भरि॒षो ग॑वि॒षो दु॑वन्य॒सच्छ्र॑व॒स्यादि॒ष उ॒षस॑स्तुरण्य॒सत् स॒त्यो द्र॒वो द्र॑व॒रः प॑तंग॒रो द॑धि॒क्रावेष॒मूर्जं॒ स्व॑र्जनत्
verses.transliteration: sátvā bhariṣó gaviṣó duvanyasác  -śravasyā́d iṣá uṣásas turaṇyasát  satyó dravó dravaráḥ pataṃgaró  dadhikrā́véṣam ū́rjaṃ svàr janat

translation.text: Brave, seeking war and booty, dwelling with the good and with the swift, may he hasten the food of Dawn. May he the true, the fleet, the lover of the course, the bird-like Dadhikrâvan, bring food, strength, and light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्मा॑स्य॒ द्रव॑तस्तुरण्य॒तः प॒र्णं न वेरनु॑ वाति प्रग॒र्धिनः॑ श्ये॒नस्ये॑व॒ ध्रज॑तो अङ्क॒सं परि॑ दधि॒क्राव्णः॑ स॒होर्जा तरि॑त्रतः
verses.transliteration: utá smāsya drávatas turaṇyatáḥ  parṇáṃ ná vér ánu vāti pragardhínaḥ  śyenásyeva dhrájato aṅkasám pári  dadhikrā́vṇaḥ sahórjā́ táritrataḥ

translation.text: His pinion, rapid runner, fans him m his way, as of a bird that hastens onward to its aim, And, as it were a falcon's gliding through the air, strikes Dadhikrâvan's side as he speeds on with might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्य वा॒जी क्षि॑प॒णिं तु॑रण्यति ग्री॒वायां॑ ब॒द्धो अ॑पिक॒क्ष आ॒सनि॑ क्रतुं॑ दधि॒क्रा अनु॑ सं॒तवी॑त्वत्प॒थामङ्कां॒स्यन्वा॒पनी॑फणत्
verses.transliteration: utá syá vājī́ kṣipaṇíṃ turaṇyati  grīvā́yām baddhó apikakṣá āsáni  krátuṃ dadhikrā́ ánu saṃtávītvat  pathā́m áṅkāṃsy ánv āpánīphaṇat

translation.text: Bound by the neck and by the flanks and by the mouth, the vigorous Courser lends new swiftness to his speed. Drawing himself together, as his strength allows, Dadhikrâs springs along the windings of the paths.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हं॒सः शु॑चि॒षद्वसु॑रन्तरिक्ष॒सद्धोता॑ वेदि॒षदति॑थिर्दुरोण॒सत् नृ॒षद्व॑र॒सदृ॑त॒सद्व्यो॑म॒सद॒ब्जा गो॒जा ऋ॑त॒जा अ॑द्रि॒जा ऋ॒तम्
verses.transliteration: haṃsáḥ śuciṣád vásur antarikṣasád  -hótā vediṣád átithir duroṇasát  nr̥ṣád varasád r̥tasád vyomasád  abjā́ gojā́ r̥tajā́ adrijā́ r̥tám

translation.text: The Hamsa homed in light, the Vasu in mid-air, the priest beside the altar, in the house the guest, Dweller in noblest place, mid men, in truth, in sky, born of flood, kine, truth, mountain, he is holy Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॒ को वां॑ वरुणा सु॒म्नमा॑प॒ स्तोमो॑ ह॒विष्माँ॑ अ॒मृतो॒ न होता॑ यो वां॑ हृ॒दि क्रतु॑माँ अ॒स्मदु॒क्तः प॒स्पर्श॑दिन्द्रावरुणा॒ नम॑स्वान्
verses.transliteration: índrā kó vāṃ varuṇā sumnám āpa  stómo havíṣmām̐ amŕ̥to ná hótā  yó vāṃ hr̥dí krátumām̐ asmád uktáḥ  paspárśad indrāvaruṇā námasvān

translation.text: WHAT laud, O Indra-Varuṇa, with oblation, hath like the Immortal Priest obtained your favour? Hath our effectual laud, addressed with homage, touched you, O Indra-Varuṇa, in spirit?

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ ह॒ यो वरु॑णा च॒क्र आ॒पी दे॒वौ मर्तः॑ स॒ख्याय॒ प्रय॑स्वान् स ह॑न्ति वृ॒त्रा स॑मि॒थेषु॒ शत्रू॒नवो॑भिर्वा म॒हद्भिः॒ स प्र शृ॑ण्वे
verses.transliteration: índrā ha yó váruṇā cakrá āpī́  devaú mártaḥ sakhyā́ya práyasvān  sá hanti vr̥trā́ samithéṣu śátrūn  ávobhir vā mahádbhiḥ sá prá śr̥ṇve

translation.text: He who with dainty food hath won you, Indra and Varuṇa, Gods, as his allies to friendship, Jayeth the Vr̥itras and his foes in battles, and through your mighty favours is made famous.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ ह॒ रत्नं॒ वरु॑णा॒ धेष्ठे॒त्था नृभ्यः॑ शशमा॒नेभ्य॒स्ता यदी॒ सखा॑या स॒ख्याय॒ सोमैः॑ सु॒तेभिः॑ सुप्र॒यसा॑ मा॒दयै॑ते
verses.transliteration: índrā ha rátnaṃ váruṇā dhéṣṭhā-  -itthā́ nŕ̥bhyaḥ śaśamānébhyas tā́  yádī sákhāyā sakhyā́ya sómaiḥ  sutébhiḥ suprayásā mādáyaite

translation.text: Indra and Varuṇa are most liberal givers of treasure to the men who toil to serve them, When they, as Friends inclined to friendship, honoured with dainty food, delight in flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ यु॒वं व॑रुणा दि॒द्युम॑स्मि॒न्नोजि॑ष्ठमुग्रा॒ नि व॑धिष्टं॒ वज्र॑म् यो नो॑ दु॒रेवो॑ वृ॒कति॑र्द॒भीति॒स्तस्मि॑न्मिमाथाम॒भिभू॒त्योजः॑
verses.transliteration: índrā yuváṃ varuṇā didyúm asminn  ójiṣṭham ugrā ní vadhiṣṭaṃ vájram  yó no durévo vr̥kátir dabhī́tis  tásmin mimāthām abhíbhūty ójaḥ

translation.text: Indra and Varuṇa, ye hurl, O Mighty, on him your strongest flashing bolt of thunder Who treats us ill, the robber and oppressor: measure on him your overwhelming vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ यु॒वं व॑रुणा भू॒तम॒स्या धि॒यः प्रे॒तारा॑ वृष॒भेव॑ धे॒नोः सा नो॑ दुहीय॒द्यव॑सेव ग॒त्वी स॒हस्र॑धारा॒ पय॑सा म॒ही गौः
verses.transliteration: índrā yuváṃ varuṇā bhūtám asyā́ḥ-  dhiyáḥ pretā́rā vr̥ṣabhéva dhenóḥ  sā́ no duhīyad yávaseva gatvī́  sahásradhārā páyasā mahī́ gaúḥ

translation.text: O Indra-Varuṇa, be ye the lovers of this my song, as steers who love the milch-Cow. Milk may it yield us as, gone forth to pasture, the great Cow pouring out her thousand rivers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तो॒के हि॒ते तन॑य उ॒र्वरा॑सु॒ सूरो॒ दृशी॑के॒ वृष॑णश्च॒ पौंस्ये॑ इन्द्रा॑ नो॒ अत्र॒ वरु॑णा स्याता॒मवो॑भिर्द॒स्मा परि॑तक्म्यायाम्
verses.transliteration: toké hité tánaya urvárāsu  sū́ro dŕ̥śīke vŕ̥ṣaṇaś ca paúṃsye  índrā no átra váruṇā syātām  ávobhir dasmā́ páritakmyāyām

translation.text: For fertile fields, for worthy sons and grandsons, for the Sun's beauty and for steer-like vigour, May Indra-Varuṇa with gracious favours work marvels for us in the stress of battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वामिद्ध्यव॑से पू॒र्व्याय॒ परि॒ प्रभू॑ती ग॒विषः॑ स्वापी वृ॒णी॒महे॑ स॒ख्याय॑ प्रि॒याय॒ शूरा॒ मंहि॑ष्ठा पि॒तरे॑व श॒म्भू
verses.transliteration: yuvā́m íd dhy ávase pūrvyā́ya  pári prábhūtī gavíṣaḥ svāpī  vr̥ṇīmáhe sakhyā́ya priyā́ya  śū́rā máṃhiṣṭhā pitáreva śambhū́

translation.text: For you, as Princes, for your ancient kindness, good comrades of the man who seeks for booty, We choose to us for the dear bond of friendship, most liberal Heroes bringing bliss like parents.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वां॒ धियोऽव॑से वाज॒यन्ती॑रा॒जिं न ज॑ग्मुर्युव॒यूः सु॑दानू श्रि॒ये न गाव॒ उप॒ सोम॑मस्थु॒रिन्द्रं॒ गिरो॒ वरु॑णं मे मनी॒षाः
verses.transliteration: tā́ vāṃ dhíyó 'vase vājayántīr  ājíṃ ná jagmur yuvayū́ḥ sudānū  śriyé ná gā́va úpa sómam asthur  índraṃ gíro váruṇam me manīṣā́ḥ

translation.text: Showing their strength, these hymns for grace, Free-givers I have gone to you, devoted, as to battle. For glory have they gone, as milk to Soma, to Indra-Varuṇa my thoughts and praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा इन्द्रं॒ वरु॑णं मे मनी॒षा अग्म॒न्नुप॒ द्रवि॑णमि॒च्छमा॑नाः उपे॑मस्थुर्जो॒ष्टार॑ इव॒ वस्वो॑ र॒घ्वीरि॑व॒ श्रव॑सो॒ भिक्ष॑माणाः
verses.transliteration: imā́ índraṃ váruṇam me manīṣā́ḥ-  ágmann úpa dráviṇam ichámānāḥ  úpem asthur joṣṭā́ra iva vásvo  raghvī́r iva śrávaso bhíkṣamāṇāḥ

translation.text: To Indra and to Varuṇa, desirous of gaining wealth have these my thoughts proceeded. They have come nigh to you as treasurelovers, like mares, fleet-footed, eager for the glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्व्य॑स्य॒ त्मना॒ रथ्य॑स्य पु॒ष्टेर्नित्य॑स्य रा॒यः पत॑यः स्याम ता च॑क्रा॒णा ऊ॒तिभि॒र्नव्य॑सीभिरस्म॒त्रा रायो॑ नि॒युतः॑ सचन्ताम्
verses.transliteration: áśvyasya tmánā ráthyasya puṣṭér  nítyasya rāyáḥ pátayaḥ syāma  tā́ cakrāṇā́ ūtíbhir návyasībhir  asmatrā́ rā́yo niyútaḥ sacantām

translation.text: May we ourselves be lords of during riches, of ample sustenance for car and hones. So may the Twain who work with newest succours bring yoked teams hitherward to us and riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ बृहन्ता बृह॒तीभि॑रू॒ती इन्द्र॑ या॒तं व॑रुण॒ वाज॑सातौ यद्दि॒द्यवः॒ पृत॑नासु प्र॒क्रीळा॒न्तस्य॑ वां स्याम सनि॒तार॑ आ॒जेः
verses.transliteration: ā́ no br̥hantā br̥hatī́bhir ūtī́  índra yātáṃ varuṇa vā́jasātau  yád didyávaḥ pŕ̥tanāsu prakrī́ḷān  tásya vāṃ syāma sanitā́ra ājéḥ

translation.text: Come with your mighty succours, O ye Mighty; come, Indra-Varuṇa, to us in battle. What time the flashing arrows play in combat, may we through you be winners in the contest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मम॑ द्वि॒ता रा॒ष्ट्रं क्ष॒त्रिय॑स्य वि॒श्वायो॒र्विश्वे॑ अ॒मृता॒ यथा॑ नः क्रतुं॑ सचन्ते॒ वरु॑णस्य दे॒वा राजा॑मि कृ॒ष्टेरु॑प॒मस्य॑ व॒व्रेः
verses.transliteration: máma dvitā́ rāṣṭráṃ kṣatríyasya  viśvā́yor víśve amŕ̥tā yáthā naḥ  krátuṃ sacante váruṇasya devā́ḥ-  rā́jāmi kr̥ṣṭér upamásya vavréḥ

translation.text: I AM the royal Ruler, mine is empire, as mine who sway all life are all Immortals. Varuṇa's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं राजा॒ वरु॑णो॒ मह्यं॒ तान्य॑सु॒र्या॑णि प्रथ॒मा धा॑रयन्त क्रतुं॑ सचन्ते॒ वरु॑णस्य दे॒वा राजा॑मि कृ॒ष्टेरु॑प॒मस्य॑ व॒व्रेः
verses.transliteration: aháṃ rā́jā váruṇo máhyaṃ tā́ni-  asuryā̀ṇi prathamā́ dhārayanta  krátuṃ sacante váruṇasya devā́ḥ-  rā́jāmi kr̥ṣṭér upamásya vavréḥ

translation.text: I am King Varuṇa. To me were given these first existinghigh celestial powers. Varuṇa's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हमिन्द्रो॒ वरु॑ण॒स्ते म॑हि॒त्वोर्वी ग॑भी॒रे रज॑सी सु॒मेके॑ त्वष्टे॑व॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि वि॒द्वान्त्समै॑रयं॒ रोद॑सी धा॒रयं॑ च
verses.transliteration: ahám índro váruṇas té mahitvā́-  -urvī́ gabhīré rájasī suméke  tváṣṭeva víśvā bhúvanāni vidvā́n  sám airayaṃ ródasī dhāráyaṃ ca

translation.text: I Varuṇa am Indra: in their greatness, these the two wide deep fairly-fashioned regions, These the two world-halves have I, even as Tvashṭar knowing all beings, joined and held together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हम॒पो अ॑पिन्वमु॒क्षमा॑णा धा॒रयं॒ दिवं॒ सद॑न ऋ॒तस्य॑ ऋ॒तेन॑ पु॒त्रो अदि॑तेर्ऋ॒तावो॒त त्रि॒धातु॑ प्रथय॒द्वि भूम॑
verses.transliteration: ahám apó apinvam ukṣámāṇāḥ-  dhāráyaṃ dívaṃ sádana r̥tásya  r̥téna putró áditer r̥tā́vā-  -utá tridhā́tu prathayad ví bhū́ma

translation.text: I made to flow the moisture-shedding waters, and set the heaven firm in the scat of Order. By Law the Son of Aditi, Law Observer, hath spread abroad the world in threefold measure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मां नरः॒ स्वश्वा॑ वा॒जय॑न्तो॒ मां वृ॒ताः स॒मर॑णे हवन्ते कृ॒णोम्या॒जिं म॒घवा॒हमिन्द्र॒ इय॑र्मि रे॒णुम॒भिभू॑त्योजाः
verses.transliteration: mā́ṃ náraḥ sváśvā vājáyanto  mā́ṃ vr̥tā́ḥ samáraṇe havante  kr̥ṇómy ājím maghávāhám índraḥ-  íyarmi reṇúm abhíbhūtyojāḥ

translation.text: Heroes with noble horses, fain for battle, selected warriors, call on me in combat. I Indra Maghavan, excite the conflict; I stir the dust, Lord of surpassing vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं ता विश्वा॑ चकरं॒ नकि॑र्मा॒ दैव्यं॒ सहो॑ वरते॒ अप्र॑तीतम् यन्मा॒ सोमा॑सो म॒मद॒न्यदु॒क्थोभे भ॑येते॒ रज॑सी अपा॒रे
verses.transliteration: aháṃ tā́ víśvā cakaraṃ nákir mā  daívyaṃ sáho varate ápratītam  yán mā sómāso mamádan yád ukthā́-  -ubhé bhayete rájasī apāré

translation.text: All this I did. The Gods' own conquering power never impedeth me whom none opposeth. When lauds and Soma juice have made me joyful, both the unbounded regions are affrighted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒दुष्टे॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि॒ तस्य॒ ता प्र ब्र॑वीषि॒ वरु॑णाय वेधः त्वं वृ॒त्राणि॑ शृण्विषे जघ॒न्वान्त्वं वृ॒ताँ अ॑रिणा इन्द्र॒ सिन्धू॑न्
verses.transliteration: vidúṣ ṭe víśvā bhúvanāni tásya  tā́ prá bravīṣi váruṇāya vedhaḥ  tváṃ vr̥trā́ṇi śr̥ṇviṣe jaghanvā́n  tváṃ vr̥tā́m̐ ariṇā indra síndhūn

translation.text: All beings know these deeds of thine thou tellest this unto Varuṇa, thou great Disposer! Thou art renowned as having slain the Vr̥itras. Thou madest flow the floods that were obstructed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माक॒मत्र॑ पि॒तर॒स्त आ॑सन्त्स॒प्त ऋष॑यो दौर्ग॒हे ब॒ध्यमा॑ने त आय॑जन्त त्र॒सद॑स्युमस्या॒ इन्द्रं॒ न वृ॑त्र॒तुर॑मर्धदे॒वम्
verses.transliteration: asmā́kam átra pitáras tá āsan  saptá ŕ̥ṣayo daurgahé badhyámāne  tá ā́yajanta trasádasyum asyāḥ-  índraṃ ná vr̥tratúram ardhadevám

translation.text: Our fathers then were these, the Seven his, what time the son of Durgaha was captive. For her they gained by sacrifice Trasadasyu, a demi-god, like Indra, conquering foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रु॒कुत्सा॑नी॒ हि वा॒मदा॑शद्ध॒व्येभि॑रिन्द्रावरुणा॒ नमो॑भिः अथा॒ राजा॑नं त्र॒सद॑स्युमस्या वृत्र॒हणं॑ ददथुरर्धदे॒वम्
verses.transliteration: purukútsānī hí vām ádāśad  -havyébhir indrāvaruṇā námobhiḥ  áthā rā́jānaṃ trasádasyum asyāḥ-  vr̥traháṇaṃ dadathur ardhadevám

translation.text: The spouse of Purukutsa gave oblations to you, O Indra-Varuṇa, with homage. Then unto her ye gave King Trasadasyu, the demi-god, the slayer of the foeman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रा॒या व॒यं स॑स॒वांसो॑ मदेम ह॒व्येन॑ दे॒वा यव॑सेन॒ गावः॑ तां धे॒नुमि॑न्द्रावरुणा यु॒वं नो॑ वि॒श्वाहा॑ धत्त॒मन॑पस्फुरन्तीम्
verses.transliteration: rāyā́ vayáṃ sasavā́ṃso madema  havyéna devā́ yávasena gā́vaḥ  tā́ṃ dhenúm indrāvaruṇā yuváṃ no  viśvā́hā dhattam ánapasphurantīm

translation.text: May we, possessing much, delight in riches, Gods in oblations and the kine in pasture; And that Milch-cow who ahrinks not from the milking, O Indra-Varuṇa, give to us daily.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क उ॑ श्रवत्कत॒मो य॒ज्ञिया॑नां व॒न्दारु॑ दे॒वः क॑त॒मो जु॑षाते कस्ये॒मां दे॒वीम॒मृते॑षु॒ प्रेष्ठां॑ हृ॒दि श्रे॑षाम सुष्टु॒तिं सु॑ह॒व्याम्
verses.transliteration: ká u śravat katamó yajñíyānāṃ  vandā́ru deváḥ katamó juṣāte  kásyemā́ṃ devī́m amŕ̥teṣu préṣṭhāṃ  hr̥dí śreṣāma suṣṭutíṃ suhavyā́m

translation.text: WHO will hear, who of those who merit worship, which of all Gods take pleasure in our homage? On whose heart shall we lay this laud celestial, rich with fair offerings, dearest to Immortals?

verses.sanskrit_deva: को मृ॑ळाति कत॒म आग॑मिष्ठो दे॒वाना॑मु कत॒मः शम्भ॑विष्ठः रथं॒ कमा॑हुर्द्र॒वद॑श्वमा॒शुं यं सूर्य॑स्य दुहि॒तावृ॑णीत
verses.transliteration: kó mr̥ḷāti katamá ā́gamiṣṭho  devā́nām u katamáḥ śámbhaviṣṭhaḥ  ráthaṃ kám āhur dravádaśvam āśúṃ  yáṃ sū́ryasya duhitā́vr̥ṇīta

translation.text: Who will be gracious? Who will come most uickly of all the Gods? Who will bring liss most largely? What car do they call swift with rapid coursers? That which the Daughter of the Sun elected.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒क्षू हि ष्मा॒ गच्छ॑थ॒ ईव॑तो॒ द्यूनिन्द्रो॒ न श॒क्तिं परि॑तक्म्यायाम् दि॒व आजा॑ता दि॒व्या सु॑प॒र्णा कया॒ शची॑नां भवथः॒ शचि॑ष्ठा
verses.transliteration: makṣū́ hí ṣmā gáchatha ī́vato dyū́n  índro ná śaktím páritakmyāyām  divá ā́jātā divyā́ suparṇā́  káyā śácīnām bhavathaḥ śáciṣṭhā

translation.text: So many days do ye come swiftly hither, as Indra to give help in stress of battle. Descended from the sky, divine, strong-pinioned, by which of all your powers are ye most mighty?

verses.sanskrit_deva: का वां॑ भू॒दुप॑मातिः॒ कया॑ न॒ आश्वि॑ना गमथो हू॒यमा॑ना को वां॑ म॒हश्चि॒त्त्यज॑सो अ॒भीक॑ उरु॒ष्यतं॑ माध्वी दस्रा न ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: kā́ vām bhūd úpamātiḥ káyā naḥ-  ā́śvinā gamatho hūyámānā  kó vām maháś cit tyájaso abhī́ke-  uruṣyátam mādhvī dasrā na ūtī́

translation.text: What is the prayer that we should bring you, Aṣvins, whereby ye come to us when invocated? Whether of you confronts e'en great betrayal? Lovers of sweetness, Dasras, help and save us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रु वां॒ रथः॒ परि॑ नक्षति॒ द्यामा यत्स॑मु॒द्राद॒भि वर्त॑ते वाम् मध्वा॑ माध्वी॒ मधु॑ वां प्रुषाय॒न्यत्सीं॑ वां॒ पृक्षो॑ भु॒रज॑न्त प॒क्वाः
verses.transliteration: urú vāṃ ráthaḥ pári nakṣati dyā́m  ā́ yát samudrā́d abhí vártate vām  mádhvā mādhvī mádhu vām pruṣāyan  yát sīṃ vām pŕ̥kṣo bhurájanta pakvā́ḥ

translation.text: In the wide space your chariot reacheth heaven, what time it turneth hither from the ocean. Sweets from your sweet shall drop, lovers of sweetness! These have they dressed for you as dainty viands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सिन्धु॑र्ह वां र॒सया॑ सिञ्च॒दश्वा॑न्घृ॒णा वयो॑ऽरु॒षासः॒ परि॑ ग्मन् तदू॒ षु वा॑मजि॒रं चे॑ति॒ यानं॒ येन॒ पती॒ भव॑थः सू॒र्यायाः॑
verses.transliteration: síndhur ha vāṃ rasáyā siñcad áśvān  ghr̥ṇā́ váyo 'ruṣā́saḥ pári gman  tád ū ṣú vām ajiráṃ ceti yā́naṃ  yéna pátī bhávathaḥ sūryā́yāḥ

translation.text: Let Sindhu with his wave bedew your horses: in fiery glow have the red birds come hither. Observed of all was that your rapid going, whereby ye were the Lords of Siirya's Daughter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒हेह॒ यद्वां॑ सम॒ना प॑पृ॒क्षे सेयम॒स्मे सु॑म॒तिर्वा॑जरत्ना उ॒रु॒ष्यतं॑ जरि॒तारं॑ यु॒वं ह॑ श्रि॒तः कामो॑ नासत्या युव॒द्रिक्
verses.transliteration: ihéha yád vāṃ samanā́ papr̥kṣé  séyám asmé sumatír vājaratnā  uruṣyátaṃ jaritā́raṃ yuváṃ ha  śritáḥ kā́mo nāsatyā yuvadrík

translation.text: Whene'er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty. Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nâsatyas, is my wish directed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वां॒ रथं॑ व॒यम॒द्या हु॑वेम पृथु॒ज्रय॑मश्विना॒ संग॑तिं॒ गोः यः सू॒र्यां वह॑ति वन्धुरा॒युर्गिर्वा॑हसं पुरु॒तमं॑ वसू॒युम्
verses.transliteration: táṃ vāṃ ráthaṃ vayám adyā́ huvema  pr̥thujráyam aśvinā sáṃgatiṃ góḥ  yáḥ sūryā́ṃ váhati vandhurāyúr  gírvāhasam purutámaṃ vasūyúm

translation.text: WE will invoke this day your car, farspreading, O Aṣvins, even the gathering, of the sunlight,– Car praised in hymns, most ample, rich in treasure, fitted with seats, the car that beareth Sûrya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं श्रिय॑मश्विना दे॒वता॒ तां दिवो॑ नपाता वनथः॒ शची॑भिः यु॒वोर्वपु॑र॒भि पृक्षः॑ सचन्ते॒ वह॑न्ति॒ यत्क॑कु॒हासो॒ रथे॑ वाम्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ śríyam aśvinā devátā tā́ṃ  dívo napātā vanathaḥ śácībhiḥ  yuvór vápur abhí pŕ̥kṣaḥ sacante  váhanti yát kakuhā́so ráthe vām

translation.text: Aṣvins, ye gained that glory by your Godhead, ye Sons of Heaven, by your own might and power. Food followeth close upon your bright appearing when stately horses in your chariot draw you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को वा॑म॒द्या क॑रते रा॒तह॑व्य ऊ॒तये॑ वा सुत॒पेया॑य वा॒र्कैः ऋ॒तस्य॑ वा व॒नुषे॑ पू॒र्व्याय॒ नमो॑ येमा॒नो अ॑श्वि॒ना व॑वर्तत्
verses.transliteration: kó vām adyā́ karate rātáhavyaḥ-  ūtáye vā sutapéyāya vārkaíḥ  r̥tásya vā vanúṣe pūrvyā́ya  námo yemānó aśvinā́ vavartat

translation.text: Who bringeth you to-day for help with offered oblation, or with hymns to drink the juices? Who, for the sacrifice's ancient lover, turneth you hither, Aṣvins, offering homage?

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒र॒ण्यये॑न पुरुभू॒ रथे॑ने॒मं य॒ज्ञं ना॑स॒त्योप॑ यातम् पिबा॑थ॒ इन्मधु॑नः सो॒म्यस्य॒ दध॑थो॒ रत्नं॑ विध॒ते जना॑य
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyáyena purubhū ráthena-  -imáṃ yajñáṃ nāsatyópa yātam  píbātha ín mádhunaḥ somyásya  dádhatho rátnaṃ vidhaté jánāya

translation.text: Borne on your golden car, ye omnipresent! come to this sacrifice of ours, Nâsatyas. Drink of the pleasant liquor of the Soma give riches to the people who adore you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ यातं दि॒वो अच्छा॑ पृथि॒व्या हि॑र॒ण्यये॑न सु॒वृता॒ रथे॑न मा वा॑म॒न्ये नि य॑मन्देव॒यन्तः॒ सं यद्द॒दे नाभिः॑ पू॒र्व्या वा॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no yātaṃ divó áchā pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  hiraṇyáyena suvŕ̥tā ráthena  mā́ vām anyé ní yaman devayántaḥ  sáṃ yád dadé nā́bhiḥ pūrvyā́ vām

translation.text: Come hitherward to us from earth, from heaven, borne on your golden chariot rolling lightly. Suffer not other worshippers to stay you here are ye bound by earlier bonds of friendship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू नो॑ र॒यिं पु॑रु॒वीरं॑ बृ॒हन्तं॒ दस्रा॒ मिमा॑थामु॒भये॑ष्व॒स्मे नरो॒ यद्वा॑मश्विना॒ स्तोम॒माव॑न्त्स॒धस्तु॑तिमाजमी॒ळ्हासो॑ अग्मन्
verses.transliteration: nū́ no rayím puruvī́ram br̥hántaṃ  dásrā mímāthām ubháyeṣv asmé  náro yád vām aśvinā stómam ā́van  sadhástutim ājamīḷhā́so agman

translation.text: Now for us both, mete out, O WonderWorkers, riches exceeding great with store of heroes, Because the men have sent you praise, O Aṣvins, and Ajamîḷhas come to the laudation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒हेह॒ यद्वां॑ सम॒ना प॑पृ॒क्षे सेयम॒स्मे सु॑म॒तिर्वा॑जरत्ना उ॒रु॒ष्यतं॑ जरि॒तारं॑ यु॒वं ह॑ श्रि॒तः कामो॑ नासत्या युव॒द्रिक्
verses.transliteration: ihéha yád vāṃ samanā́ papr̥kṣé  séyám asmé sumatír vājaratnā  uruṣyátaṃ jaritā́raṃ yuváṃ ha  śritáḥ kā́mo nāsatyā yuvadrík

translation.text: Whene'er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty. Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nâsatyas, is my wish directed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्य भा॒नुरुदि॑यर्ति यु॒ज्यते॒ रथः॒ परि॑ज्मा दि॒वो अ॒स्य सान॑वि पृ॒क्षासो॑ अस्मिन्मिथु॒ना अधि॒ त्रयो॒ दृति॑स्तु॒रीयो॒ मधु॑नो॒ वि र॑प्शते
verses.transliteration: eṣá syá bhānúr úd iyarti yujyáte  ráthaḥ párijmā divó asyá sā́navi  pr̥kṣā́so asmin mithunā́ ádhi tráyo  dŕ̥tis turī́yo mádhuno ví rapśate

translation.text: YONDER goes up that light: your chariot is yoked that travels round upon the summit of this heaven. Within this car are stored three kindred shares of food, and a skin filled with meath is rustling as the fourth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्वां॑ पृ॒क्षासो॒ मधु॑मन्त ईरते॒ रथा॒ अश्वा॑स उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टिषु अ॒पो॒र्णु॒वन्त॒स्तम॒ आ परी॑वृतं॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण शु॒क्रं त॒न्वन्त॒ आ रजः॑
verses.transliteration: úd vām pr̥kṣā́so mádhumanta īrate  ráthā áśvāsa uṣáso vyùṣṭiṣu  aporṇuvántas táma ā́ párīvr̥taṃ  svàr ṇá śukráṃ tanvánta ā́ rájaḥ

translation.text: Forth come your viands rich with store of pleasant meath, and cars and horses at the flushing of the dawn, Stripping the covering from the surrounded gloom, and spreading through mid-air bright radiance like the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मध्वः॑ पिबतं मधु॒पेभि॑रा॒सभि॑रु॒त प्रि॒यं मधु॑ने युञ्जाथां॒ रथ॑म् आ व॑र्त॒निं मधु॑ना जिन्वथस्प॒थो दृतिं॑ वहेथे॒ मधु॑मन्तमश्विना
verses.transliteration: mádhvaḥ pibatam madhupébhir āsábhiḥ  utá priyám mádhune yuñjāthāṃ rátham  ā́ vartaním mádhunā jinvathas pathó  dŕ̥tiṃ vahethe mádhumantam aśvinā

translation.text: Drink of the meath with lips accustomed to the draught; harness for the meath's sake the chariot that ye love. Refresh the way ye go, refresh the paths with meath: hither, O Aṣvins, bring the skin that holds the meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हं॒सासो॒ ये वां॒ मधु॑मन्तो अ॒स्रिधो॒ हिर॑ण्यपर्णा उ॒हुव॑ उष॒र्बुधः॑ उ॒द॒प्रुतो॑ म॒न्दिनो॑ मन्दिनि॒स्पृशो॒ मध्वो॒ न मक्षः॒ सव॑नानि गच्छथः
verses.transliteration: haṃsā́so yé vām mádhumanto asrídho  híraṇyaparṇā uhúva uṣarbúdhaḥ  udaprúto mandíno mandinispŕ̥śo  mádhvo ná mákṣaḥ sávanāni gachathaḥ

translation.text: The swans ye have are friendly, rich in store of mcath, gold-pinioned, strong to draw, awake at early morn, Swimming the flood, exultant, fain for draughts that cheer: ye come like flies to our libations of-the meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒ध्व॒रासो॒ मधु॑मन्तो अ॒ग्नय॑ उ॒स्रा ज॑रन्ते॒ प्रति॒ वस्तो॑र॒श्विना॑ यन्नि॒क्तह॑स्तस्त॒रणि॑र्विचक्ष॒णः सोमं॑ सु॒षाव॒ मधु॑मन्त॒मद्रि॑भिः
verses.transliteration: svadhvarā́so mádhumanto agnáyaḥ-  usrā́ jarante práti vástor aśvínā  yán niktáhastas taráṇir vicakṣaṇáḥ  sómaṃ suṣā́va mádhumantam ádribhiḥ

translation.text: Well knowing solemn rites and rich in meath, the fires sing to the morning Aṣvins at the break of day, When with pure hands the prudent energetic priest hath with the stones pressed out the Soma rich in meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒के॒नि॒पासो॒ अह॑भि॒र्दवि॑ध्वतः॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण शु॒क्रं त॒न्वन्त॒ आ रजः॑ सूर॑श्चि॒दश्वा॑न्युयुजा॒न ई॑यते॒ विश्वाँ॒ अनु॑ स्व॒धया॑ चेतथस्प॒थः
verses.transliteration: ākenipā́so áhabhir dávidhvataḥ  svàr ṇá śukráṃ tanvánta ā́ rájaḥ  sū́raś cid áśvān yuyujāná īyate  víśvām̐ ánu svadháyā cetathas patháḥ

translation.text: The rays advancing nigh, chasing with day the gloom, spread through the firmament bright radiance like the Sun; And the Sun harnessing his horses goeth forth: ye through your Godlike nature let his paths be known.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वा॑मवोचमश्विना धियं॒धा रथः॒ स्वश्वो॑ अ॒जरो॒ यो अस्ति॑ येन॑ स॒द्यः परि॒ रजां॑सि या॒थो ह॒विष्म॑न्तं त॒रणिं॑ भो॒जमच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: prá vām avocam aśvinā dhiyaṃdhā́ḥ-  ráthaḥ sváśvo ajáro yó ásti  yéna sadyáḥ pári rájāṃsi yāthó  havíṣmantaṃ taráṇim bhojám ácha

translation.text: Devout in thought I have declared, O Aṣvins, your chariot with good steeds, which lasts for ever, Wherewith ye travel swiftly through the regions to the prompt worshipper who brings oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्रं॑ पिबा॒ मधू॑नां सु॒तं वा॑यो॒ दिवि॑ष्टिषु त्वं हि पू॑र्व॒पा असि॑
verses.transliteration: ágram pibā mádhūnāṃ  sutáṃ vāyo díviṣṭiṣu  tváṃ hí pūrvapā́ ási

translation.text: DRINK the best draught of Soma-juice, O Vâyu, at our holy rites: For thou art he who drinketh first.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तेना॑ नो अ॒भिष्टि॑भिर्नि॒युत्वाँ॒ इन्द्र॑सारथिः वायो॑ सु॒तस्य॑ तृम्पतम्
verses.transliteration: śaténā no abhíṣṭibhir  niyútvām̐ índrasārathiḥ  vā́yo sutásya tr̥mpatam

translation.text: Come, team-drawn, with thy hundred helps, with Indra, seated in the car, Vaya, and drink your fill of juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॑ स॒हस्रं॒ हर॑य॒ इन्द्र॑वायू अ॒भि प्रयः॑ वह॑न्तु॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ sahásraṃ hárayaḥ-  índravāyū abhí práyaḥ  váhantu sómapītaye

translation.text: May steeds a thousand bring you both, Indra. and Vâyu, hitherward To drink the Soma, to the feagt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथं॒ हिर॑ण्यवन्धुर॒मिन्द्र॑वायू स्वध्व॒रम् आ हि स्थाथो॑ दिवि॒स्पृश॑म्
verses.transliteration: ráthaṃ híraṇyavandhuram  índravāyū svadhvarám  ā́ hí sthā́tho divispŕ̥śam

translation.text: For ye, O Indra-Vâyu, mount the goldenseated car that aids The sacrifice, that reaches heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथे॑न पृथु॒पाज॑सा दा॒श्वांस॒मुप॑ गच्छतम् इन्द्र॑वायू इ॒हा ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: ráthena pr̥thupā́jasā  dāśvā́ṃsam úpa gachatam  índravāyū ihā́ gatam

translation.text: On far-refulgent chariot come unto the man who offers gifts: Come, Indra-Vâyu, hitherward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑वायू अ॒यं सु॒तस्तं दे॒वेभिः॑ स॒जोष॑सा पिब॑तं दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हे
verses.transliteration: índravāyū ayáṃ sutás  táṃ devébhiḥ sajóṣasā  píbataṃ dāśúṣo gr̥hé

translation.text: Here, Indra-Vâyu, is the juice: drink it, accordant with the Gods, Within the giver's dwelling-place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ह प्र॒याण॑मस्तु वा॒मिन्द्र॑वायू वि॒मोच॑नम् इ॒ह वां॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: ihá prayā́ṇam astu vām  índravāyū vimócanam  ihá vāṃ sómapītaye

translation.text: Hither, O Indra-Vâyu, be your journey here unyoke your steeds, Here for your draught of Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वायो॑ शु॒क्रो अ॑यामि ते॒ मध्वो॒ अग्रं॒ दिवि॑ष्टिषु आ या॑हि॒ सोम॑पीतये स्पा॒र्हो दे॑व नि॒युत्व॑ता
verses.transliteration: vā́yo śukró ayāmi te  mádhvo ágraṃ díviṣṭiṣu  ā́ yāhi sómapītaye  spārhó deva niyútvatā

translation.text: Vâyu, the bright is offered thee, best of the meath at holy rites. Come thou to drink the Soma juice, God, longed-for, on thy team-drawn car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑श्च वायवेषां॒ सोमा॑नां पी॒तिम॑र्हथः यु॒वां हि यन्तीन्द॑वो नि॒म्नमापो॒ न स॒ध्र्य॑क्
verses.transliteration: índraś ca vāyav eṣāṃ  sómānām pītím arhathaḥ  yuvā́ṃ hí yántī́ndavo  nimnám ā́po ná sadhryàk

translation.text: O Vâyu, thou and Indra are meet drinkers of these Soma-draughts, For unto you the drops proceed as waters gather to the vale.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वाय॒विन्द्र॑श्च शु॒ष्मिणा॑ स॒रथं॑ शवसस्पती नि॒युत्व॑न्ता न ऊ॒तय॒ आ या॑तं॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: vā́yav índraś ca śuṣmíṇā  saráthaṃ śavasas patī  niyútvantā na ūtáye-  ā́ yātaṃ sómapītaye

translation.text: O Indra-Vâyu, mighty Twain, speeding together, Lords of Strength, Come to our succour with your team, that ye may drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या वां॒ सन्ति॑ पुरु॒स्पृहो॑ नि॒युतो॑ दा॒शुषे॑ नरा अ॒स्मे ता य॑ज्ञवाह॒सेन्द्र॑वायू॒ नि य॑च्छतम्
verses.transliteration: yā́ vāṃ sánti puruspŕ̥ho  niyúto dāśúṣe narā  asmé tā́ yajñavāhasā-  -índravāyū ní yachatam

translation.text: The longed-for teams which ye possess, O Heroes, for the worshipper, Turn to us, Indra-Vâyu, ye to whom the sacrifice is paid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒हि होत्रा॒ अवी॑ता॒ विपो॒ न रायो॑ अ॒र्यः वाय॒वा च॒न्द्रेण॒ रथे॑न या॒हि सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: vihí hótrā ávītāḥ-  vípo ná rā́yo aryáḥ  vā́yav ā́ candréṇa ráthena  yāhí sutásya pītáye

translation.text: TASTE offerings never tasted yet, as bards enjoy the foeman's wealth. O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि॒र्यु॒वा॒णो अश॑स्तीर्नि॒युत्वाँ॒ इन्द्र॑सारथिः वाय॒वा च॒न्द्रेण॒ रथे॑न या॒हि सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: niryuvāṇó áśastīr  niyútvām̐ índrasārathiḥ  vā́yav ā́ candréṇa ráthena  yāhí sutásya pītáye

translation.text: Removing curses, drawn by teams, with Indra, seated by thy side, O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑ कृ॒ष्णे वसु॑धिती ये॒माते॑ वि॒श्वपे॑शसा वाय॒वा च॒न्द्रेण॒ रथे॑न या॒हि सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: ánu kr̥ṣṇé vásudhitī  yemā́te viśvápeśasā  vā́yav ā́ candréṇa ráthena  yāhí sutásya pītáye

translation.text: The two dark treasuries of wealth that wear all beauties wait on thee. O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वह॑न्तु त्वा मनो॒युजो॑ यु॒क्तासो॑ नव॒तिर्नव॑ वाय॒वा च॒न्द्रेण॒ रथे॑न या॒हि सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: váhantu tvā manoyújo  yuktā́so navatír náva  vā́yav ā́ candréṇa ráthena  yāhí sutásya pītáye

translation.text: May nine-and-ninety harnessed steeds who yoke them at thy will bring thee. O Vâyu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वायो॑ श॒तं हरी॑णां यु॒वस्व॒ पोष्या॑णाम् उ॒त वा॑ ते सह॒स्रिणो॒ रथ॒ आ या॑तु॒ पाज॑सा
verses.transliteration: vā́yo śatáṃ hárīṇāṃ  yuvásva póṣyāṇām  utá vā te sahasríṇo  rátha ā́ yātu pā́jasā

translation.text: Harness, O Vâyu, to thy car a hundred well-fed tawny steeds, Yea, or a thousand steeds, and let thy chariot come to us with might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं वा॑मा॒स्ये॑ ह॒विः प्रि॒यमि॑न्द्राबृहस्पती उ॒क्थं मद॑श्च शस्यते
verses.transliteration: idáṃ vām āsyè havíḥ  priyám indrābr̥haspatī  ukthám mádaś ca śasyate

translation.text: DEAR is this offering in your mouth, O Indra and Br̥ihaspati: Famed is the laud, the gladdening draught.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं वां॒ परि॑ षिच्यते॒ सोम॑ इन्द्राबृहस्पती चारु॒र्मदा॑य पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ vām pári ṣicyate  sóma indrābr̥haspatī  cā́rur mádāya pītáye

translation.text: This lovely Soma is effused, O Indra and Br̥ihaspati, For you, to drink it and rejoice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ न॑ इन्द्राबृहस्पती गृ॒हमिन्द्र॑श्च गच्छतम् सो॒म॒पा सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: ā́ na indrābr̥haspatī  gr̥hám índraś ca gachatam  somapā́ sómapītaye

translation.text: As Soma-drinkers to our house come, Indra and Br̥ihaspati-and Indra-to drink Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे इ॑न्द्राबृहस्पती र॒यिं ध॑त्तं शत॒ग्विन॑म् अश्वा॑वन्तं सह॒स्रिण॑म्
verses.transliteration: asmé indrābr̥haspatī  rayíṃ dhattaṃ śatagvínam  áśvāvantaṃ sahasríṇam

translation.text: Vouchsafe us riches hundredfold, O Indra, and Br̥ihaspati, With store of horses, thousandfold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॒बृह॒स्पती॑ व॒यं सु॒ते गी॒र्भिर्ह॑वामहे अ॒स्य सोम॑स्य पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: índrābŕ̥haspátī vayáṃ  suté gīrbhír havāmahe  asyá sómasya pītáye

translation.text: O Indra. and Br̥ihaspati, we call you when the meath is shed, With songs, to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोम॑मिन्द्राबृहस्पती॒ पिब॑तं दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हे मा॒दये॑थां॒ तदो॑कसा
verses.transliteration: sómam indrābr̥haspatī  píbataṃ dāśúṣo gr̥hé  mādáyethāṃ tádokasā

translation.text: Drink, Indra and Br̥ihaspati, the Soma in the giver's house: Delight yourselves abiding there.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त॒स्तम्भ॒ सह॑सा॒ वि ज्मो अन्ता॒न्बृह॒स्पति॑स्त्रिषध॒स्थो रवे॑ण तं प्र॒त्नास॒ ऋष॑यो॒ दीध्या॑नाः पु॒रो विप्रा॑ दधिरे म॒न्द्रजि॑ह्वम्
verses.transliteration: yás tastámbha sáhasā ví jmó ántān  bŕ̥haspátis triṣadhasthó ráveṇa  tám pratnā́sa ŕ̥ṣayo dī́dhyānāḥ  puró víprā dadhire mandrájihvam

translation.text: Him who with might hath propped earth's ends, who sitteth in threefold seat, Br̥ihaspati, with thunder, Him of the pleasant tongue have ancient sages, deep-thinking, holy singers, set before them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धु॒नेत॑यः सुप्रके॒तं मद॑न्तो॒ बृह॑स्पते अ॒भि ये न॑स्तत॒स्रे पृष॑न्तं सृ॒प्रमद॑ब्धमू॒र्वं बृह॑स्पते॒ रक्ष॑तादस्य॒ योनि॑म्
verses.transliteration: dhunétayaḥ supraketám mádanto  bŕ̥haspate abhí yé nas tatasré  pŕ̥ṣantaṃ sr̥prám ádabdham ūrvám  bŕ̥haspate rákṣatād asya yónim

translation.text: Wild in their course, in well-marked wise rejoicing were they, Br̥ihaspati, who pressed around us. Preserve Br̥ihaspati, the stall uninjured, this company's raining, ever-moving birthplace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॑स्पते॒ या प॑र॒मा प॑रा॒वदत॒ आ त॑ ऋत॒स्पृशो॒ नि षे॑दुः तुभ्यं॑ खा॒ता अ॑व॒ता अद्रि॑दुग्धा॒ मध्वः॑ श्चोतन्त्य॒भितो॑ विर॒प्शम्
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspate yā́ paramā́ parāvád  áta ā́ ta r̥taspŕ̥śo ní ṣeduḥ  túbhyaṃ khātā́ avatā́ ádridugdhāḥ-  mádhva ścotanty abhíto virapśám

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati, from thy remotest distance have they sat down who love the law eternal. For thee were dug wells springing from the mountain, which murmuring round about pour streams of sweetness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॒स्पतिः॑ प्रथ॒मं जाय॑मानो म॒हो ज्योति॑षः पर॒मे व्यो॑मन् स॒प्तास्य॑स्तुविजा॒तो रवे॑ण॒ वि स॒प्तर॑श्मिरधम॒त्तमां॑सि
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspátiḥ prathamáṃ jā́yamāno  mahó jyótiṣaḥ paramé vyòman  saptā́syas tuvijātó ráveṇa  ví saptáraśmir adhamat támāṃsi

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati, when first he had his being from mighty splendour in supremest heaven, Strong, with his sevenfold mouth, with noise of thunder, with his seven rays, blew and dispersed the darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सु॒ष्टुभा॒ स ऋक्व॑ता ग॒णेन॑ व॒लं रु॑रोज फलि॒गं रवे॑ण बृह॒स्पति॑रु॒स्रिया॑ हव्य॒सूदः॒ कनि॑क्रद॒द्वाव॑शती॒रुदा॑जत्
verses.transliteration: sá suṣṭúbhā sá ŕ̥kvatā gaṇéna  valáṃ ruroja phaligáṃ ráveṇa  bŕ̥haspátir usríyā havyasū́daḥ  kánikradad vā́vaśatīr úd ājat

translation.text: With the loud-shouting band who sang his praises, with thunder, he destroyed obstructive Vala. Br̥ihaspati thundering drave forth the cattle, the lowing cows who make oblations ready.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा पि॒त्रे वि॒श्वदे॑वाय॒ वृष्णे॑ य॒ज्ञैर्वि॑धेम॒ नम॑सा ह॒विर्भिः॑ बृह॑स्पते सुप्र॒जा वी॒रव॑न्तो व॒यं स्या॑म॒ पत॑यो रयी॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: evā́ pitré viśvádevāya vŕ̥ṣṇe  yajñaír vidhema námasā havírbhiḥ  bŕ̥haspate suprajā́ vīrávanto  vayáṃ syāma pátayo rayīṇā́m

translation.text: Serve we with sacrifices, gifts, and homage even thus the Steer of all the Gods, the Father. Br̥ihaspati, may we be lords of riches, with noble progeny and store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इद्राजा॒ प्रति॑जन्यानि॒ विश्वा॒ शुष्मे॑ण तस्थाव॒भि वी॒र्ये॑ण बृह॒स्पतिं॒ यः सुभृ॑तं बि॒भर्ति॑ वल्गू॒यति॒ वन्द॑ते पूर्व॒भाज॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá íd rā́jā prátijanyāni víśvā  śúṣmeṇa tasthāv abhí vīryèṇa  bŕ̥haspátiṃ yáḥ súbhr̥tam bibhárti  valgūyáti vándate pūrvabhā́jam

translation.text: Surely that King by power and might heroic hath made him lord of all his foes' posses-ions, Who cherishes Br̥ihaspati well-tended, adorns and worships him as foremost sharer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इत्क्षे॑ति॒ सुधि॑त॒ ओक॑सि॒ स्वे तस्मा॒ इळा॑ पिन्वते विश्व॒दानी॑म् तस्मै॒ विशः॑ स्व॒यमे॒वा न॑मन्ते॒ यस्मि॑न्ब्र॒ह्मा राज॑नि॒ पूर्व॒ एति॑
verses.transliteration: sá ít kṣeti súdhita ókasi své  tásmā íḷā pinvate viśvadā́nīm  tásmai víśaḥ svayám evā́ namante  yásmin brahmā́ rā́jani pū́rva éti

translation.text: In his own house he dwells in peace and comfort: to him for ever holy food flows richly. To him the people with free will pay homage-the King with whom the Brahman hath precedence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप्र॑तीतो जयति॒ सं धना॑नि॒ प्रति॑जन्यान्यु॒त या सज॑न्या अ॒व॒स्यवे॒ यो वरि॑वः कृ॒णोति॑ ब्र॒ह्मणे॒ राजा॒ तम॑वन्ति दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: ápratīto jayati sáṃ dhánāni  prátijanyāny utá yā́ sájanyā  avasyáve yó várivaḥ kr̥ṇóti  brahmáṇe rā́jā tám avanti devā́ḥ

translation.text: He, unopposed, is master of the riches.of his own subjects and of hostile people. The Gods uphold that King with their protection who helps the Brahman when he seeks his favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑श्च॒ सोमं॑ पिबतं बृहस्पते॒ऽस्मिन्य॒ज्ञे म॑न्दसा॒ना वृ॑षण्वसू आ वां॑ विश॒न्त्विन्द॑वः स्वा॒भुवो॒ऽस्मे र॒यिं सर्व॑वीरं॒ नि य॑च्छतम्
verses.transliteration: índraś ca sómam pibatam br̥haspate  -asmín yajñé mandasānā́ vr̥ṣaṇvasū  ā́ vāṃ viśantv índavaḥ svābhúvo  -asmé rayíṃ sárvavīraṃ ní yachatam

translation.text: Indra, Br̥ihaspati, rainers of treasure, rejoicing at this sacrifice drink the Soma. Let the abundant drops sink deep within you: vouchsafe us riches with full store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॑स्पत इन्द्र॒ वर्ध॑तं नः॒ सचा॒ सा वां॑ सुम॒तिर्भू॑त्व॒स्मे अ॒वि॒ष्टं धियो॑ जिगृ॒तं पुरं॑धीर्जज॒स्तम॒र्यो व॒नुषा॒मरा॑तीः
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspata indra várdhataṃ naḥ  sácā sā́ vāṃ sumatír bhūtv asmé  aviṣṭáṃ dhíyo jigr̥tám púraṃdhīr  jajastám aryó vanúṣām árātīḥ

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati and Indra, make us prosper may this be your benevolence to usward. Assist our holy thoughts, wake up our spirit: weaken the hatred of our foe and rivals.
