verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दमु॒ त्यत्पु॑रु॒तमं॑ पु॒रस्ता॒ज्ज्योति॒स्तम॑सो व॒युना॑वदस्थात् नू॒नं दि॒वो दु॑हि॒तरो॑ विभा॒तीर्गा॒तुं कृ॑णवन्नु॒षसो॒ जना॑य
verses.transliteration: idám u tyát purutámam purástāj  jyótis támaso vayúnāvad asthāt  nūnáṃ divó duhitáro vibhātī́r  gātúṃ kr̥ṇavann uṣáso jánāya

translation.text: FORTH from the darkness in the region eastward this most abundant splendid light hath mounted. Now verily the far-refulgent Mornings, Daughters of Heaven, bring welfare to the people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्थु॑रु चि॒त्रा उ॒षसः॑ पु॒रस्ता॑न्मि॒ता इ॑व॒ स्वर॑वोऽध्व॒रेषु॑ व्यू॑ व्र॒जस्य॒ तम॑सो॒ द्वारो॒च्छन्ती॑रव्र॒ञ्छुच॑यः पाव॒काः
verses.transliteration: ásthur u citrā́ uṣásaḥ purástāt-  mitā́ iva sváravo 'dhvaréṣu  vy ū̀ vrajásya támaso dvā́rā-  -uchántīr avrañ chúcayaḥ pāvakā́ḥ

translation.text: The richly-coloured Dawns have mounted eastward, like pillars planted at our sacrifices, And, flushing far, splendid and purifying, unbarred the portals of the fold of darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒च्छन्ती॑र॒द्य चि॑तयन्त भो॒जान्रा॑धो॒देया॑यो॒षसो॑ म॒घोनीः॑ अ॒चि॒त्रे अ॒न्तः प॒णयः॑ सस॒न्त्वबु॑ध्यमाना॒स्तम॑सो॒ विम॑ध्ये
verses.transliteration: uchántīr adyá citayanta bhojā́n  rādhodéyāyoṣáso maghónīḥ  acitré antáḥ paṇáyaḥ sasantu-  ábudhyamānās támaso vímadhye

translation.text: Dispelling gloom this day the wealthy Mornings urge liberal givers to present their treasures. In the unlightened depth of darkness round them let niggard traffickers sleep unawakened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कु॒वित्स दे॑वीः स॒नयो॒ नवो॑ वा॒ यामो॑ बभू॒यादु॑षसो वो अ॒द्य येना॒ नव॑ग्वे॒ अङ्गि॑रे॒ दश॑ग्वे स॒प्तास्ये॑ रेवती रे॒वदू॒ष
verses.transliteration: kuvít sá devīḥ sanáyo návo vā  yā́mo babhūyā́d uṣaso vo adyá  yénā návagve áṅgire dáśagve  saptā́sye revatī revád ūṣá

translation.text: O Goddesses, is this your car, I ask you, ancient this day, or is it new, ye Mornings, Wherewith, rich Dawns, ye seek with wealth Navagva, Daṣagva Angira, the seven-toned singer?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं हि दे॑वीर्ऋत॒युग्भि॒रश्वैः॑ परिप्रया॒थ भुव॑नानि स॒द्यः प्र॒बो॒धय॑न्तीरुषसः स॒सन्तं॑ द्वि॒पाच्चतु॑ष्पाच्च॒रथा॑य जी॒वम्
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ hí devīr r̥tayúgbhir áśvaiḥ  pariprayāthá bhúvanāni sadyáḥ  prabodháyantīr uṣasaḥ sasántaṃ  dvipā́c cátuṣpāc caráthāya jīvám

translation.text: With horses harnessed by eternal Order, Goddesses, swiftly round the worlds ye travel, Arousing from their rest, O Dawns, the sleeping, and all that lives, man, bird, and beast, to motion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व॑ स्विदासां कत॒मा पु॑रा॒णी यया॑ वि॒धाना॑ विद॒धुर्ऋ॑भू॒णाम् शुभं॒ यच्छु॒भ्रा उ॒षस॒श्चर॑न्ति॒ न वि ज्ञा॑यन्ते स॒दृशी॑रजु॒र्याः
verses.transliteration: kvà svid āsāṃ katamā́ purāṇī́  yáyā vidhā́nā vidadhúr r̥bhūṇā́m  śúbhaṃ yác chubhrā́ uṣásaś cáranti  ná ví jñāyante sadŕ̥śīr ajuryā́ḥ

translation.text: Which among these is eldest, and where is she through whom they fixed the R̥ibhus' regulations? What time the splendid Dawns go forth for splendour, they are not known aparto alike, unwasting.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता घा॒ ता भ॒द्रा उ॒षसः॑ पु॒रासु॑रभि॒ष्टिद्यु॑म्ना ऋ॒तजा॑तसत्याः यास्वी॑जा॒नः श॑शमा॒न उ॒क्थैः स्तु॒वञ्छंस॒न्द्रवि॑णं स॒द्य आप॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ ghā tā́ bhadrā́ uṣásaḥ purā́sur  abhiṣṭídyumnā r̥tájātasatyāḥ  yā́sv ījānáḥ śaśamāná ukthaíḥ-  stuváñ cháṃsan dráviṇaṃ sadyá ā́pa

translation.text: Blest were these Dawns of old, shining with succour, true with the truth that springs from holy Order; With whom the toiling worshipper, by praises, hymning and lauding, soon attained to riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता आ च॑रन्ति सम॒ना पु॒रस्ता॑त्समा॒नतः॑ सम॒ना प॑प्रथा॒नाः ऋ॒तस्य॑ दे॒वीः सद॑सो बुधा॒ना गवां॒ न सर्गा॑ उ॒षसो॑ जरन्ते
verses.transliteration: tā́ ā́ caranti samanā́ purástāt  samānátaḥ samanā́ paprathānā́ḥ  r̥tásya devī́ḥ sádaso budhānā́ḥ-  gávāṃ ná sárgā uṣáso jarante

translation.text: Hither from eastward all at once they travel, from one place spreading in the selfsame manner. Awaking, from the seat of holy Order the Godlike Dawns come nigh like troops of cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता इन्न्वे॒३॒॑व स॑म॒ना स॑मा॒नीरमी॑तवर्णा उ॒षस॑श्चरन्ति गूह॑न्ती॒रभ्व॒मसि॑तं॒ रुश॑द्भिः शु॒क्रास्त॒नूभिः॒ शुच॑यो रुचा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: tā́ ín nv èvá samanā́ samānī́r  ámītavarṇā uṣásaś caranti  gū́hantīr ábhvam ásitaṃ rúśadbhiḥ  śukrā́s tanū́bhiḥ śúcayo rucānā́ḥ

translation.text: Thus they go forth with undiminished colours, these Mornings similar, in self-same fashion, Concealing the gigantic might of darkness with radiant bodies bright and pure and shining.

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒यिं दि॑वो दुहितरो विभा॒तीः प्र॒जाव॑न्तं यच्छता॒स्मासु॑ देवीः स्यो॒नादा वः॑ प्रति॒बुध्य॑मानाः सु॒वीर्य॑स्य॒ पत॑यः स्याम
verses.transliteration: rayíṃ divo duhitaro vibhātī́ḥ  prajā́vantaṃ yachatāsmā́su devīḥ  syonā́d ā́ vaḥ pratibúdhyamānāḥ  suvī́ryasya pátayaḥ syāma

translation.text: O Goddesses, O Heaven's refulgent Daughters, bestow upon us wealth with store of children. As from our pleasant place of rest ye rouse us may we be masters of heroic vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वो॑ दिवो दुहितरो विभा॒तीरुप॑ ब्रुव उषसो य॒ज्ञके॑तुः व॒यं स्या॑म य॒शसो॒ जने॑षु॒ तद्द्यौश्च॑ ध॒त्तां पृ॑थि॒वी च॑ दे॒वी
verses.transliteration: tád vo divo duhitaro vibhātī́r  úpa bruva uṣaso yajñáketuḥ  vayáṃ syāma yaśáso jáneṣu  tád dyaúś ca dhattā́m pr̥thivī́ ca devī́

translation.text: Well-skilled in lore of sacrifice, ye Daughters of Heaven, refulgent Dawns, I thus address you. May we be glorious among the people. May Heaven vouchsafe us this, and Earth the Goddess,

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॒ ष्या सू॒नरी॒ जनी॑ व्यु॒च्छन्ती॒ परि॒ स्वसुः॑ दि॒वो अ॑दर्शि दुहि॒ता
verses.transliteration: práti ṣyā́ sūnárī jánī  vyuchántī pári svásuḥ  divó adarśi duhitā́

translation.text: THIS Lady, giver of delight, after her Sister shining forth, Daughter of Heaven, hath shown herself.-

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वे॑व चि॒त्रारु॑षी मा॒ता गवा॑मृ॒ताव॑री सखा॑भूद॒श्विनो॑रु॒षाः
verses.transliteration: áśveva citrā́ruṣī  mātā́ gávām r̥tā́varī  sákhābhūd aśvínor uṣā́ḥ

translation.text: Unfailing, Mother of the Kine, in colour like a bright red mare, The Dawn became the Aṣvins' Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त सखा॑स्य॒श्विनो॑रु॒त मा॒ता गवा॑मसि उ॒तोषो॒ वस्व॑ ईशिषे
verses.transliteration: utá sákhāsy aśvínor  utá mātā́ gávām asi  utóṣo vásva īśiṣe

translation.text: Yea, and thou art the Aṣvins' Friend, the Mother of the Kine art thou: O Dawn thou rulest over wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या॒व॒यद्द्वे॑षसं त्वा चिकि॒त्वित्सू॑नृतावरि प्रति॒ स्तोमै॑रभुत्स्महि
verses.transliteration: yāvayáddveṣasaṃ tvā  cikitvít sūnr̥tāvari  práti stómair abhutsmahi

translation.text: Thinking of thee, O joyous One, as her who driveth hate away, We woke to meet thee with our lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ भ॒द्रा अ॑दृक्षत॒ गवां॒ सर्गा॒ न र॒श्मयः॑ ओषा अ॑प्रा उ॒रु ज्रयः॑
verses.transliteration: práti bhadrā́ adr̥kṣata  gávāṃ sárgā ná raśmáyaḥ  óṣā́ aprā urú jráyaḥ

translation.text: Our eyes behold thy blessed rays like troops of cattle loosed to feed. Dawn hath filled full the wide expanse.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒प॒प्रुषी॑ विभावरि॒ व्या॑व॒र्ज्योति॑षा॒ तमः॑ उषो॒ अनु॑ स्व॒धाम॑व
verses.transliteration: āpaprúṣī vibhāvari  vy ā̀var jyótiṣā támaḥ  úṣo ánu svadhā́m ava

translation.text: When thou hast filled it, Fulgent One! thou layest bare the gloom with light. After thy nature aid us, Dawn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ द्यां त॑नोषि र॒श्मिभि॒रान्तरि॑क्षमु॒रु प्रि॒यम् उषः॑ शु॒क्रेण॑ शो॒चिषा॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ dyā́ṃ tanoṣi raśmíbhir  ā́ntárikṣam urú priyám  -úṣaḥ śukréṇa śocíṣā

translation.text: Thou overspreadest heaven with rays, the dear wide region of mid-air. With thy bright shining lustre, Dawn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुर्वार्यं॑ म॒हद्वृ॑णी॒महे॒ असु॑रस्य॒ प्रचे॑तसः छ॒र्दिर्येन॑ दा॒शुषे॒ यच्छ॑ति॒ त्मना॒ तन्नो॑ म॒हाँ उद॑यान्दे॒वो अ॒क्तुभिः॑
verses.transliteration: tád devásya savitúr vā́ryam mahád  vr̥ṇīmáhe ásurasya prácetasaḥ  chardír yéna dāśúṣe yáchati tmánā  tán no mahā́m̐ úd ayān devó aktúbhiḥ

translation.text: OF Savitar the God, the sapient Asura, we crave this great gift which is worthy of our choice, Wherewith he freely grants his worshiper defence. This with his rays the Great God hath vouchsafed to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो ध॒र्ता भुव॑नस्य प्र॒जाप॑तिः पि॒शङ्गं॑ द्रा॒पिं प्रति॑ मुञ्चते क॒विः वि॒च॒क्ष॒णः प्र॒थय॑न्नापृ॒णन्नु॒र्वजी॑जनत्सवि॒ता सु॒म्नमु॒क्थ्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: divó dhartā́ bhúvanasya prajā́patiḥ  piśáṅgaṃ drāpím práti muñcate kavíḥ  vicakṣaṇáḥ pratháyann āpr̥ṇánn urú-  ájījanat savitā́ sumnám ukthyàm

translation.text: Sustainer of the heaven, Lord of the whole world's life, the Sage, he putteth on his golden-coloured mail. Clear-sighted, spreading far, filling the spacious realm, Savitar hath brought forth bliss that deserveth laud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आप्रा॒ रजां॑सि दि॒व्यानि॒ पार्थि॑वा॒ श्लोकं॑ दे॒वः कृ॑णुते॒ स्वाय॒ धर्म॑णे प्र बा॒हू अ॑स्राक्सवि॒ता सवी॑मनि निवे॒शय॑न्प्रसु॒वन्न॒क्तुभि॒र्जग॑त्
verses.transliteration: ā́prā rájāṃsi divyā́ni pā́rthivā  ślókaṃ deváḥ kr̥ṇute svā́ya dhármaṇe  prá bāhū́ asrāk savitā́ sávīmani  niveśáyan prasuvánn aktúbhir jágat

translation.text: He hath filled full the regions of the heaven and earth: the God for his own strengthening waketh up the hymn. Savitar hath stretched out his arms to cherish life, producing with his rays and lulling all that moves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अदा॑भ्यो॒ भुव॑नानि प्र॒चाक॑शद्व्र॒तानि॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ताभि र॑क्षते प्रास्रा॑ग्बा॒हू भुव॑नस्य प्र॒जाभ्यो॑ धृ॒तव्र॑तो म॒हो अज्म॑स्य राजति
verses.transliteration: ádābhyo bhúvanāni pracā́kaśad  vratā́ni deváḥ savitā́bhí rakṣate  prā́srāg bāhū́ bhúvanasya prajā́bhyo  dhr̥távrato mahó ájmasya rājati

translation.text: Lighting all living creatures, neer to be deceived, Savitar, God, protects each holy ordinance. He hath stretched out his arms to all the folk of earth, and, with his laws observed, rules his own mighty course.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिर॒न्तरि॑क्षं सवि॒ता म॑हित्व॒ना त्री रजां॑सि परि॒भुस्त्रीणि॑ रोच॒ना ति॒स्रो दिवः॑ पृथि॒वीस्ति॒स्र इ॑न्वति त्रि॒भिर्व्र॒तैर॒भि नो॑ रक्षति॒ त्मना॑
verses.transliteration: trír antárikṣaṃ savitā́ mahitvanā́  trī́ rájāṃsi paribhū́s trī́ṇi rocanā́  tisró dívaḥ pr̥thivī́s tisrá invati  tribhír vrataír abhí no rakṣati tmánā

translation.text: Savitar thrice surrounding with his mightiness mid-air, three regions, and the triple sphere of light, Sets the three heavens in motion and the threefold earth, and willingly protects us with his triple law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒हत्सु॑म्नः प्रसवी॒ता नि॒वेश॑नो॒ जग॑तः स्था॒तुरु॒भय॑स्य॒ यो व॒शी स नो॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता शर्म॑ यच्छत्व॒स्मे क्षया॑य त्रि॒वरू॑थ॒मंह॑सः
verses.transliteration: br̥hátsumnaḥ prasavītā́ nivéśano  jágata sthātúr ubháyasya yó vaśī́  sá no deváḥ savitā́ śárma yachatu-  asmé kṣáyāya trivárūtham áṃhasaḥ

translation.text: Most gracious God, who brings to life and lulls to rest, he who controls the world, what moves not and what moves, May he vouchsafe us shelter, -Savitar the God,– for tranquil life, with triple bar against distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आग॑न्दे॒व ऋ॒तुभि॒र्वर्ध॑तु॒ क्षयं॒ दधा॑तु नः सवि॒ता सु॑प्र॒जामिष॑म् स नः॑ क्ष॒पाभि॒रह॑भिश्च जिन्वतु प्र॒जाव॑न्तं र॒यिम॒स्मे समि॑न्वतु
verses.transliteration: ā́gan devá r̥túbhir várdhatu kṣáyaṃ  dádhātu naḥ savitā́ suprajā́m íṣam  sá naḥ kṣapā́bhir áhabhiś ca jinvatu  prajā́vantaṃ rayím asmé sám invatu

translation.text: With the year's seasons hath Savitar, God, come nigh: may he prosper our home, give food and noble sons. May he invigorate us through the days and nights, and may he send us opulence with progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अभू॑द्दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता वन्द्यो॒ नु न॑ इ॒दानी॒मह्न॑ उप॒वाच्यो॒ नृभिः॑ वि यो रत्ना॒ भज॑ति मान॒वेभ्यः॒ श्रेष्ठं॑ नो॒ अत्र॒ द्रवि॑णं॒ यथा॒ दध॑त्
verses.transliteration: ábhūd deváḥ savitā́ vándyo nú naḥ-  idā́nīm áhna upavā́cyo nŕ̥bhiḥ  ví yó rátnā bhájati mānavébhyaḥ  śréṣṭhaṃ no átra dráviṇaṃ yáthā dádhat

translation.text: Now must we praise and honour Savitar the God: at this time of the day the men must call to him, Him who distributes wealth to Manu's progeny, that he may grant us here riches most excellent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वेभ्यो॒ हि प्र॑थ॒मं य॒ज्ञिये॑भ्योऽमृत॒त्वं सु॒वसि॑ भा॒गमु॑त्त॒मम् आदिद्दा॒मानं॑ सवित॒र्व्यू॑र्णुषेऽनूची॒ना जी॑वि॒ता मानु॑षेभ्यः
verses.transliteration: devébhyo hí prathamáṃ yajñíyebhyo  -amr̥tatváṃ suvási bhāgám uttamám  ā́d íd dāmā́naṃ savitar vy ū̀rṇuṣe  -anūcīnā́ jīvitā́ mā́nuṣebhyaḥ

translation.text: For thou at first producest for the holy Gods the noblest of all portions, immor-tality: Thereafter as a gift to men, O Savitar, thou openest existence, life succeeding life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अचि॑त्ती॒ यच्च॑कृ॒मा दैव्ये॒ जने॑ दी॒नैर्दक्षैः॒ प्रभू॑ती पूरुष॒त्वता॑ दे॒वेषु॑ च सवित॒र्मानु॑षेषु च॒ त्वं नो॒ अत्र॑ सुवता॒दना॑गसः
verses.transliteration: ácittī yác cakr̥mā́ daívye jáne  dīnaír dákṣaiḥ prábhūtī pūruṣatvátā  devéṣu ca savitar mā́nuṣeṣu ca  tváṃ no átra suvatād ánāgasaḥ

translation.text: If we, men as we are, have sinned against the Gods through want of thought, in weakness, or through insolence, Absolve us from the guilt and make us free from sin, O Savitar, alike among both Gods and men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न प्र॒मिये॑ सवि॒तुर्दैव्य॑स्य॒ तद्यथा॒ विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं धारयि॒ष्यति॑ यत्पृ॑थि॒व्या वरि॑म॒न्ना स्व॑ङ्गु॒रिर्वर्ष्म॑न्दि॒वः सु॒वति॑ स॒त्यम॑स्य॒ तत्
verses.transliteration: ná pramíye savitúr daívyasya tád  yáthā víśvam bhúvanaṃ dhārayiṣyáti  yát pr̥thivyā́ várimann ā́ svaṅgurír  várṣman diváḥ suváti satyám asya tát

translation.text: None may impede that power of Savitar the God whereby he will maintain the universal world. What the fair-fingered God brings forth on earth's expanse or in the heightof heaven, that work of his stands sure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ज्येष्ठान्बृ॒हद्भ्यः॒ पर्व॑तेभ्यः॒ क्षयाँ॑ एभ्यः सुवसि प॒स्त्या॑वतः यथा॑यथा प॒तय॑न्तो वियेमि॒र ए॒वैव त॑स्थुः सवितः स॒वाय॑ ते
verses.transliteration: índrajyeṣṭhān br̥hádbhyaḥ párvatebhyaḥ  kṣáyām̐ ebhyaḥ suvasi pastyā̀vataḥ  yáthā-yathā patáyanto viyemiré-  evaívá tasthuḥ savitaḥ savā́ya te

translation.text: To lofty hills thou sendest those whom Indra leads, and givest fixed abodes with houses unto these. However they may fly and draw themselves apart, still, Savitar, they stand obeying thy behest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये ते॒ त्रिरह॑न्त्सवितः स॒वासो॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ सौभ॑गमासु॒वन्ति॑ इन्द्रो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी सिन्धु॑र॒द्भिरा॑दि॒त्यैर्नो॒ अदि॑तिः॒ शर्म॑ यंसत्
verses.transliteration: yé te trír áhan savitaḥ savā́so  divé-dive saúbhagam āsuvánti  índro dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ síndhur adbhír  ādityaír no áditiḥ śárma yaṃsat

translation.text: May the libations poured to thee thrice daily, day after day, O Savitar, bring us blessing. May Indra, Heaven, Earth, Sindhu with the Waters, Aditi with Âdityas, give us shelter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को व॑स्त्रा॒ता व॑सवः॒ को व॑रू॒ता द्यावा॑भूमी अदिते॒ त्रासी॑थां नः सही॑यसो वरुण मित्र॒ मर्ता॒त्को वो॑ऽध्व॒रे वरि॑वो धाति देवाः
verses.transliteration: kó vas trātā́ vasavaḥ kó varūtā́  dyā́vābhūmī adite trā́sīthāṃ naḥ  sáhīyaso varuṇa mitra mártāt  kó vo 'dhvaré várivo dhāti devāḥ

translation.text: WHO of you, Vasus, saveth? who protecteth? O Heaven and Earth and Aditi, preserve us, Varuṇa., Mitra, from the stronger mortal. Gods, which of you at sacrifice giveth comfort?

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ये धामा॑नि पू॒र्व्याण्यर्चा॒न्वि यदु॒च्छान्वि॑यो॒तारो॒ अमू॑राः वि॒धा॒तारो॒ वि ते द॑धु॒रज॑स्रा ऋ॒तधी॑तयो रुरुचन्त द॒स्माः
verses.transliteration: prá yé dhā́māni pūrvyā́ṇy árcān  ví yád uchā́n viyotā́ro ámūrāḥ  vidhātā́ro ví té dadhur ájasrāḥ-  r̥tádhītayo rurucanta dasmā́ḥ

translation.text: They who with laud extol the ancient statutes, when they shine forth infallible dividers, Have ordered as perpetual Ordainers, and beamed as holy-thoughted WonderWorkers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र प॒स्त्या॒३॒॑मदि॑तिं॒ सिन्धु॑म॒र्कैः स्व॒स्तिमी॑ळे स॒ख्याय॑ दे॒वीम् उ॒भे यथा॑ नो॒ अह॑नी नि॒पात॑ उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ करता॒मद॑ब्धे
verses.transliteration: prá pastyā̀m áditiṃ síndhum arkaíḥ  svastím īḷe sakhyā́ya devī́m  ubhé yáthā no áhanī nipā́taḥ-  uṣā́sānáktā karatām ádabdhe

translation.text: The Housewife Goddess, Aditi, and Sindhu, the Goddess Svasti I implore for friendship: And may the unobstructed Night and Morning both, day and night, provide for our protection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्य॑र्य॒मा वरु॑णश्चेति॒ पन्था॑मि॒षस्पतिः॑ सुवि॒तं गा॒तुम॒ग्निः इन्द्रा॑विष्णू नृ॒वदु॒ षु स्तवा॑ना॒ शर्म॑ नो यन्त॒मम॑व॒द्वरू॑थम्
verses.transliteration: vy àryamā́ váruṇaś ceti pánthām  iṣás pátiḥ suvitáṃ gātúm agníḥ  índrāviṣṇū nr̥vád u ṣú stávānā  śárma no yantam ámavad várūtham

translation.text: Aryaman, Varuṇa have disclosed the pathway, Agni as Lord of Strength the road to welfare. Lauded in manly mode may Indra-Vishṇu grant us their powerful defence and shelter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ पर्व॑तस्य म॒रुता॒मवां॑सि दे॒वस्य॑ त्रा॒तुर॑व्रि॒ भग॑स्य पात्पति॒र्जन्या॒दंह॑सो नो मि॒त्रो मि॒त्रिया॑दु॒त न॑ उरुष्येत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ párvatasya marútām ávāṃsi  devásya trātúr avri bhágasya  pā́t pátir jányād áṃhaso no  mitró mitríyād utá na uruṣyet

translation.text: I have besought the favourof the Maruts, of Parvata, of Bhaga God who rescues. From trouble caused by man the Lord preserve us; from woe sent by his friend let Mitra save us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू रो॑दसी॒ अहि॑ना बु॒ध्न्ये॑न स्तुवी॒त दे॑वी॒ अप्ये॑भिरि॒ष्टैः स॒मु॒द्रं न सं॒चर॑णे सनि॒ष्यवो॑ घ॒र्मस्व॑रसो न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ अप॑ व्रन्
verses.transliteration: nū́ rodasī áhinā budhnyèna  stuvītá devī ápyebhir iṣṭaíḥ  samudráṃ ná saṃcáraṇe saniṣyávaḥ  gharmásvaraso nadyò ápa vran

translation.text: Agree, through these our watery oblations, Goddesses, Heaven and Earth, with Ahibudhnya. As if to win the sea, the Gharma-heaters have opened, as they come anear, the rivers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वैर्नो॑ दे॒व्यदि॑ति॒र्नि पा॑तु दे॒वस्त्रा॒ता त्रा॑यता॒मप्र॑युच्छन् न॒हि मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य धा॒सिमर्हा॑मसि प्र॒मियं॒ सान्व॒ग्नेः
verses.transliteration: devaír no devy áditir ní pātu  devás trātā́ trāyatām áprayuchan  nahí mitrásya váruṇasya dhāsím  árhāmasi pramíyaṃ sā́nv agnéḥ

translation.text: May Goddess Aditi with Gods defend us, save us the saviour God with care unceasing. We dare not stint the sacred food of Mitra and Varuṇa upon the back of Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निरी॑शे वस॒व्य॑स्या॒ग्निर्म॒हः सौभ॑गस्य तान्य॒स्मभ्यं॑ रासते
verses.transliteration: agnír īśe vasavyàsya-  -agnír maháḥ saúbhagasya  tā́ny asmábhyaṃ rāsate

translation.text: Agni is Sovran Lord of wealth, Agni of great prosperity: May he bestow these gifts on us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उषो॑ मघो॒न्या व॑ह॒ सूनृ॑ते॒ वार्या॑ पु॒रु अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ वाजिनीवति
verses.transliteration: úṣo maghony ā́ vaha  sū́nr̥te vā́ryā purú  -asmábhyaṃ vājinīvati

translation.text: Hither to us, rich pleasant Dawn, bring many things to be desired, Thou who hast ample store of wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्सु नः॑ सवि॒ता भगो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा इन्द्रो॑ नो॒ राध॒सा ग॑मत्
verses.transliteration: tát sú naḥ savitā́ bhágo  váruṇo mitró aryamā́  índro no rā́dhasā́ gamat

translation.text: So then may Bhaga, Savitar, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Indra, with bounty come to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒ही द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी इ॒ह ज्येष्ठे॑ रु॒चा भ॑वतां शु॒चय॑द्भिर॒र्कैः यत्सीं॒ वरि॑ष्ठे बृह॒ती वि॑मि॒न्वन्रु॒वद्धो॒क्षा प॑प्रथा॒नेभि॒रेवैः॑
verses.transliteration: mahī́ dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ihá jyéṣṭhe  rucā́ bhavatāṃ śucáyadbhir arkaíḥ  yát sīṃ váriṣṭhe br̥hatī́ viminván  ruvád dhokṣā́ paprathānébhir évaiḥ

translation.text: MAY mighty Heaven and Earth, most meet for honour, be present here with light and gleaming splendours; When, fixing them apart, vast, most extensive, the Steer roars loudly in far-reaching courses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वी दे॒वेभि॑र्यज॒ते यज॑त्रै॒रमि॑नती तस्थतुरु॒क्षमा॑णे ऋ॒ताव॑री अ॒द्रुहा॑ दे॒वपु॑त्रे य॒ज्ञस्य॑ ने॒त्री शु॒चय॑द्भिर॒र्कैः
verses.transliteration: devī́ devébhir yajaté yájatrair  áminatī tasthatur ukṣámāṇe  r̥tā́varī adrúhā deváputre  yajñásya netrī́ śucáyadbhir arkaíḥ

translation.text: The Goddesses with Gods, holy with holy, the Two stand pouring out their rain, exhaustless: Faithful and guileless, having Gods for children, leaders of sacrifice with shining splendours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इत्स्वपा॒ भुव॑नेष्वास॒ य इ॒मे द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी ज॒जान॑ उ॒र्वी ग॑भी॒रे रज॑सी सु॒मेके॑ अवं॒शे धीरः॒ शच्या॒ समै॑रत्
verses.transliteration: sá ít svápā bhúvaneṣv āsa  yá imé dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ jajā́na  -urvī́ gabhīré rájasī suméke  avaṃśé dhī́raḥ śácyā sám airat

translation.text: Sure in the worlds he was a skilful Craftsman, he who produced these Twain the Earth and Heaven. Wise, with his power he brought both realms, together spacious and deep, wellfashioned, unsupported.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू रो॑दसी बृ॒हद्भि॑र्नो॒ वरू॑थैः॒ पत्नी॑वद्भिरि॒षय॑न्ती स॒जोषाः॑ उ॒रू॒ची विश्वे॑ यज॒ते नि पा॑तं धि॒या स्या॑म र॒थ्यः॑ सदा॒साः
verses.transliteration: nū́ rodasī br̥hádbhir no várūthaiḥ  pátnīvadbhir iṣáyantī sajóṣāḥ  urūcī́ víśve yajaté ní pātaṃ  dhiyā́ syāma rathyàḥ sadāsā́ḥ

translation.text: O Heaven and Earth, with one accord promoting, with high protection as of Queens, our welfare, Far-reaching, universal, holy, guard us. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वां॒ महि॒ द्यवी॑ अ॒भ्युप॑स्तुतिं भरामहे शुची॒ उप॒ प्रश॑स्तये
verses.transliteration: prá vām máhi dyávī abhí-  úpastutim bharāmahe  śúcī úpa práśastaye

translation.text: To both of you, O Heaven and Earth, we bring our lofty song of praise, Pure Ones! to glorify you both.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒ना॒ने त॒न्वा॑ मि॒थः स्वेन॒ दक्षे॑ण राजथः ऊ॒ह्याथे॑ स॒नादृ॒तम्
verses.transliteration: punāné tanvā̀ mitháḥ  svéna dákṣeṇa rājathaḥ  ūhyā́the sanā́d r̥tám

translation.text: Ye sanctify each other's form, by your own proper might ye rule, And from of old observe the Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒ही मि॒त्रस्य॑ साधथ॒स्तर॑न्ती॒ पिप्र॑ती ऋ॒तम् परि॑ य॒ज्ञं नि षे॑दथुः
verses.transliteration: mahī́ mitrásya sādhathas  tárantī pípratī r̥tám  pári yajñáṃ ní ṣedathuḥ

translation.text: Furthering and fulfilling, ye, O Mighty, perfect Mitra's Law. Ye sit around our sacrifice.

suktas.deity: Gods of the Field (Charm for Unfruitful Land)

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्षेत्र॑स्य॒ पति॑ना व॒यं हि॒तेने॑व जयामसि गामश्वं॑ पोषयि॒त्न्वा स नो॑ मृळाती॒दृशे॑
verses.transliteration: kṣétrasya pátinā vayáṃ  hiténeva jayāmasi  gā́m áśvam poṣayitnv~ā́  sá no mr̥ḷātīdŕ̥śe

translation.text: WE through the Master of the Field, even as through a friend, obtain What nourisheth our kine and steeds. In such may he be good to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्षेत्र॑स्य पते॒ मधु॑मन्तमू॒र्मिं धे॒नुरि॑व॒ पयो॑ अ॒स्मासु॑ धुक्ष्व म॒धु॒श्चुतं॑ घृ॒तमि॑व॒ सुपू॑तमृ॒तस्य॑ नः॒ पत॑यो मृळयन्तु
verses.transliteration: kṣétrasya pate mádhumantam ūrmíṃ  dhenúr iva páyo asmā́su dhukṣva  madhuścútaṃ ghr̥tám iva súpūtam  r̥tásya naḥ pátayo mr̥ḷayantu

translation.text: As the cow yieldeth milk, pour for us freely, Lord of the Field, the wave that beareth sweetness, Distilling meath, well-purified like butter, and let the. Lords of holy Law be gracious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मधु॑मती॒रोष॑धी॒र्द्याव॒ आपो॒ मधु॑मन्नो भवत्व॒न्तरि॑क्षम् क्षेत्र॑स्य॒ पति॒र्मधु॑मान्नो अ॒स्त्वरि॑ष्यन्तो॒ अन्वे॑नं चरेम
verses.transliteration: mádhumatīr óṣadhīr dyā́va ā́po  mádhuman no bhavatv antárikṣam  kṣétrasya pátir mádhumān no astu-  áriṣyanto ánv enaṃ carema

translation.text: Sweet be the plants for us. the heavens, the waters, and full of sweets for us be air's mid-region. May the Field's Lord for us be full of sweetness, and may we follow after him uninjured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं वा॒हाः शु॒नं नरः॑ शु॒नं कृ॑षतु॒ लाङ्ग॑लम् शु॒नं व॑र॒त्रा ब॑ध्यन्तां शु॒नमष्ट्रा॒मुदि॑ङ्गय
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ vāhā́ḥ śunáṃ náraḥ  śunáṃ kr̥ṣatu lā́ṅgalam  śunáṃ varatrā́ badhyantāṃ  śunám áṣṭrām úd iṅgaya

translation.text: Happily work our steers and men, may the plough furrow happily. Happily be the traces bound; happily may he ply the goad.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुना॑सीरावि॒मां वाचं॑ जुषेथां॒ यद्दि॒वि च॒क्रथुः॒ पयः॑ तेने॒मामुप॑ सिञ्चतम्
verses.transliteration: śúnāsīrāv imā́ṃ vā́caṃ juṣethāṃ  yád diví cakráthuḥ páyaḥ  ténemā́m úpa siñcatam

translation.text: Ṣuna and Sîra, welcome ye this laud, and with the milk which ye have made in heaven Bedew ye both this earth of ours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वाची॑ सुभगे भव॒ सीते॒ वन्दा॑महे त्वा यथा॑ नः सु॒भगास॑सि॒ यथा॑ नः सु॒फलास॑सि
verses.transliteration: arvā́cī subhage bhava  sī́te vándāmahe tvā  yáthā naḥ subhágā́sasi  yáthā naḥ suphálā́sasi

translation.text: Auspicious Sita, come thou near: we venerate and worship thee That thou mayst bless and prosper us and bring us fruits abundantly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रः॒ सीतां॒ नि गृ॑ह्णातु॒ तां पू॒षानु॑ यच्छतु सा नः॒ पय॑स्वती दुहा॒मुत्त॑रामुत्तरां॒ समा॑म्
verses.transliteration: índraḥ sī́tāṃ ní gr̥hṇātu  tā́m pūṣā́nu yachatu  sā́ naḥ páyasvatī duhām  úttarām-uttarāṃ sámām

translation.text: May Indra press the furrow down, may Pûshan guide its course aright. May she, as rich in milk, be drained for us through each succeeding year.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नं नः॒ फाला॒ वि कृ॑षन्तु॒ भूमिं॑ शु॒नं की॒नाशा॑ अ॒भि य॑न्तु वा॒हैः शु॒नं प॒र्जन्यो॒ मधु॑ना॒ पयो॑भिः॒ शुना॑सीरा शु॒नम॒स्मासु॑ धत्तम्
verses.transliteration: śunáṃ naḥ phā́lā ví kr̥ṣantu bhū́miṃ  śunáṃ kīnā́śā abhí yantu vāhaíḥ  śunám parjányo mádhunā páyobhiḥ  śúnāsīrā śunám asmā́su dhattam

translation.text: Happily let the shares turn up the ploughland, happily go the ploughers with the oxen. With meath and milk Parjanya make us happy. Grant us prosperity, Ṣuna and Sîra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मु॒द्रादू॒र्मिर्मधु॑माँ॒ उदा॑र॒दुपां॒शुना॒ सम॑मृत॒त्वमा॑नट् घृ॒तस्य॒ नाम॒ गुह्यं॒ यदस्ति॑ जि॒ह्वा दे॒वाना॑म॒मृत॑स्य॒ नाभिः॑
verses.transliteration: samudrā́d ūrmír mádhumām̐ úd ārad  úpāṃśúnā sám amr̥tatvám ānaṭ  ghr̥tásya nā́ma gúhyaṃ yád ásti  jihvā́ devā́nām amŕ̥tasya nā́bhiḥ

translation.text: FORTH from the ocean sprang the wave of sweetness: together with the stalk it turned to Amrit, That which is holy oil's mysterious title: but the Gods' tongue is truly Amrit's centre.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं नाम॒ प्र ब्र॑वामा घृ॒तस्या॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे धा॑रयामा॒ नमो॑भिः उप॑ ब्र॒ह्मा शृ॑णवच्छ॒स्यमा॑नं॒ चतुः॑शृङ्गोऽवमीद्गौ॒र ए॒तत्
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ nā́ma prá bravāmā ghr̥tásya-  -asmín yajñé dhārayāmā námobhiḥ  úpa brahmā́ śr̥ṇavac chasyámānaṃ  cátuḥśr̥ṅgo 'vamīd gaurá etát

translation.text: Let us declare aloud the name of Ghr̥ita, and at this sacrifice hold it up with homage. So let the Brahman hear the praise we utter. This hath the four-horned Buffalo emitted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒त्वारि॒ शृङ्गा॒ त्रयो॑ अस्य॒ पादा॒ द्वे शी॒र्षे स॒प्त हस्ता॑सो अस्य त्रिधा॑ ब॒द्धो वृ॑ष॒भो रो॑रवीति म॒हो दे॒वो मर्त्याँ॒ आ वि॑वेश
verses.transliteration: catvā́ri śŕ̥ṅgā tráyo asya pā́dāḥ-  dvé śīrṣé saptá hástāso asya  trídhā baddhó vr̥ṣabhó roravīti  mahó devó mártyām̐ ā́ viveśa

translation.text: Four are his horns, three are the feet that bear him; his heads are two, his hands are seven in number. Bound with a triple bond the Steer roars loudly: the mighty God hath entered in to mortals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिधा॑ हि॒तं प॒णिभि॑र्गु॒ह्यमा॑नं॒ गवि॑ दे॒वासो॑ घृ॒तमन्व॑विन्दन् इन्द्र॒ एकं॒ सूर्य॒ एकं॑ जजान वे॒नादेकं॑ स्व॒धया॒ निष्ट॑तक्षुः
verses.transliteration: trídhā hitám paṇíbhir guhyámānaṃ  gávi devā́so ghr̥tám ánv avindan  índra ékaṃ sū́rya ékaṃ jajāna  venā́d ékaṃ svadháyā níṣ ṭatakṣuḥ

translation.text: That oil in triple shape the Gods discovered laid down within the Cow, concealed by Paṇis. Indra produced one shape, Sûrya another: by their own power they formed the third from Vena.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता अ॑र्षन्ति॒ हृद्या॑त्समु॒द्राच्छ॒तव्र॑जा रि॒पुणा॒ नाव॒चक्षे॑ घृ॒तस्य॒ धारा॑ अ॒भि चा॑कशीमि हिर॒ण्ययो॑ वेत॒सो मध्य॑ आसाम्
verses.transliteration: etā́ arṣanti hŕ̥dyāt samudrā́c  -śatávrajā ripúṇā nā́vacákṣe  ghr̥tásya dhā́rā abhí cākaśīmi  hiraṇyáyo vetasó mádhya āsām

translation.text: From inmost reservoir in countless channels flow down these rivers which the foe beholds not. I look upon the streams of oil descending, and lo! the Golden Reed is there among them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒म्यक्स्र॑वन्ति स॒रितो॒ न धेना॑ अ॒न्तर्हृ॒दा मन॑सा पू॒यमा॑नाः ए॒ते अ॑र्षन्त्यू॒र्मयो॑ घृ॒तस्य॑ मृ॒गा इ॑व क्षिप॒णोरीष॑माणाः
verses.transliteration: samyák sravanti saríto ná dhénāḥ-  antár hr̥dā́ mánasā pūyámānāḥ  eté arṣanty ūrmáyo ghr̥tásya  mr̥gā́ iva kṣipaṇór ī́ṣamāṇāḥ

translation.text: Like rivers our libations flow together, cleansing themselves in inmost heart and spirit. The streams of holy oil pour swiftly downward like the wild beasts that fly before the bowman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सिन्धो॑रिव प्राध्व॒ने शू॑घ॒नासो॒ वात॑प्रमियः पतयन्ति य॒ह्वाः घृ॒तस्य॒ धारा॑ अरु॒षो न वा॒जी काष्ठा॑ भि॒न्दन्नू॒र्मिभिः॒ पिन्व॑मानः
verses.transliteration: síndhor iva prādhvané śūghanā́so  vā́tapramiyaḥ patayanti yahvā́ḥ  ghr̥tásya dhā́rā aruṣó ná vājī́  kā́ṣṭhā bhindánn ūrmíbhiḥ pínvamānaḥ

translation.text: As rushing down the rapids of a river, flow swifter than the wind the vigorous currents, The streams of oil in swelling fluctuation like a red courser bursting through the fences.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि प्र॑वन्त॒ सम॑नेव॒ योषाः॑ कल्या॒ण्य१॒॑ः स्मय॑मानासो अ॒ग्निम् घृ॒तस्य॒ धाराः॑ स॒मिधो॑ नसन्त॒ ता जु॑षा॒णो ह॑र्यति जा॒तवे॑दाः
verses.transliteration: abhí pravanta sámaneva yóṣāḥ  kalyāṇyàḥ smáyamānāso agním  ghr̥tásya dhā́rāḥ samídho nasanta  tā́ juṣāṇó haryati jātávedāḥ

translation.text: Like women at a gathering fair to look on and gently smiling, they incline to Agni. The streams of holy oil attain the fuel, and Jâtavedas joyfully receives them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒न्या॑ इव वह॒तुमेत॒वा उ॑ अ॒ञ्ज्य॑ञ्जा॒ना अ॒भि चा॑कशीमि यत्र॒ सोमः॑ सू॒यते॒ यत्र॑ य॒ज्ञो घृ॒तस्य॒ धारा॑ अ॒भि तत्प॑वन्ते
verses.transliteration: kanyā̀ iva vahatúm étavā́~u  añjy àñjānā́ abhí cākaśīmi  yátra sómaḥ sūyáte yátra yajñó  ghr̥tásya dhā́rā abhí tát pavante

translation.text: As maidens dock themselves with gay adornment to join the bridal feast, I now behold them. Where Soma flows and sacrifice is ready, thither the streams of holy oil are running.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भ्य॑र्षत सुष्टु॒तिं गव्य॑मा॒जिम॒स्मासु॑ भ॒द्रा द्रवि॑णानि धत्त इ॒मं य॒ज्ञं न॑यत दे॒वता॑ नो घृ॒तस्य॒ धारा॒ मधु॑मत्पवन्ते
verses.transliteration: abhy àrṣata suṣṭutíṃ gávyam ājím  asmā́su bhadrā́ dráviṇāni dhatta  imáṃ yajñáṃ nayata devátā no  ghr̥tásya dhā́rā mádhumat pavante

translation.text: Send to our eulogy a herd of cattle bestow upon us excellent possessions. Bear to the Gods the sacrifice we offer the streams of oil flow pure and full of sweetness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धाम॑न्ते॒ विश्वं॒ भुव॑न॒मधि॑ श्रि॒तम॒न्तः स॑मु॒द्रे हृ॒द्य१॒॑न्तरायु॑षि अ॒पामनी॑के समि॒थे य आभृ॑त॒स्तम॑श्याम॒ मधु॑मन्तं त ऊ॒र्मिम्
verses.transliteration: dhā́man te víśvam bhúvanam ádhi śritám  antáḥ samudré hr̥dy àntár ā́yuṣi  apā́m ánīke samithé yá ā́bhr̥tas  tám aśyāma mádhumantaṃ ta ūrmím

translation.text: The universe depends upon thy power and might within the sea, within the heart, within all life. May we attain that sweetly-flavoured wave of thine, brought, at its gathering, o'er the surfaceof the floods.
